This class includes:

Manufacture of bakery products from flours, as follows:

- Manufacture of fresh, dry or chilled bakery products;

- Manufacture of bread and rolls;

- Manufacture of fresh pastry, cakes, pies, tarts, etc.

- Manufacture of rusk, biscuits and other dry bakery products;

- Manufacture of preserved pastries and rusk;

- Manufacture of sweet or salted snack products (cookies, crackers, pretzels, etc.);

- Manufacture of tortillas;

- Manufacture of chilled bakery products: pancakes, rolls, waffles, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of farinaceous products (pastas), under class 10740 (Manufacture of macaroni, noodles and similar products);

- Manufacture of potato snacks, under class 1030 (Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables);

- Heating of bakery items for immediate consumption, under division 56 (Food and beverage services).

1072 - 10720: Manufacture of sugar

This class includes:

- Manufacture of refined sugar (sucrose) and sugar from sugar-bearing plants such as beet, maple, sugar palm;

- Manufacture of sugar syrups;

- Manufacture of molasses;

- Production of maple syrup and sugar.

Exclusion: Manufacture of glucose, glucose syrup and maltose, under class 10620 (Manufacture of starches and starch products);

1073 - 10730: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and confectionery

This class includes:

- Manufacture of cocoa, cocoa oil, cocoa butter, cocoa fat;

- Manufacture of chocolate and chocolate confectionery;

- Manufacture of confectionery: hard candies, white chocolate, chewing gum, nougats, fondant;

- Manufacture of chewing gum;

- Immersion of fruit, nuts and other parts of plants in sugar;

- Manufacture of aromatic confectionery and pastilles.

Exclusion: Manufacture of sucrose, under class 10720 (Manufacture of sugar).

1074 - 10740: Manufacture of macaroni, noodles and similar products

This class includes:

- Manufacture of pastas and noodles, whether or not cooked or stuffed;

- Manufacture of couscous;

- Manufacture of canned or frozen pasta products.

Exclusion: Production of soup containing pasta, under class 10790 (Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified);

1075 - 10750: Manufacture of prepared meals and dishes

This class includes the manufacture of ready-made (prepared and cooked) meals and dishes in frozen or canned form. Such meals and dishes are usually packaged and labeled for re-sale, except the preparation of meals for immediate consumption in a restaurant.

This class also includes:

- Manufacture of prepared dishes from poultry, frozen or fresh meat;

- Manufacture of canned stews and vacuum-prepared meals;

- Manufacture of other prepared meals (for lunch and dinner);

- Manufacture of dishes from frozen fish balls and small fish slices;

- Manufacture of dishes of vegetables;

- Manufacture of frozen pizza.

Exclusion:

- Wholesale trade of prepared meals and dishes, under group 463 (Wholesale of rice, food, beverages and tobacco);

- Retail trade of prepared food in stores under class 47110 (Retail sale in non-specialized stores with food, beverage or tobacco predominating) and under class 47210 (Retail sale of food in specialized stores);

- Activities of contractors providing in-flight meals, under class 56290 (Other food services).

1079 - 10790: Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Roasting and percolation of coffee;

- Production of coffee products: soluble coffee, ground coffee, extracts and concentrates of coffee;

- Manufacture of coffee substitutes;

- Blending of tea and additives;

- Manufacture of extracts and preparations based on tea or additives;

- Manufacture of soup and broths;

- Manufacture of special foods, such as: nutrient-added meals, milk and nutritional supplements, infant formula, foods containing homogenized ingredients;

- Manufacture of spices, sauces and condiments such as mayonnaise, mustard flour and mustard;

- Manufacture of vinegar;

- Manufacture of artificial honey and candies;

- Manufacture of perishable prepared foods such as: sandwiches, pizza. This class also includes:

- Manufacture of herbal teas (mint, vervain, chamomile);

- Manufacture of brewer’s yeast;

- Manufacture of extracts and juices of meat, fish, crustaceans or molluscs;

- Manufacture of non-dairy milk and butter substitutes;

- Manufacture of egg products and egg albumin;

- Manufacture of food-grade salt, e.g. iodized salt, from purchased salt;

- Manufacture of artificial concentrates.

Exclusion:

- Growing of spice crops, under group 0128 ( Growing of spice and pharmaceutical crops);

- Manufacture of inulin, under class 10620 (Manufacture of starches and starch products);

- Manufacture of frozen pizza, under class 10750 (Manufacture of prepared meals and dishes);

- Manufacture of spirits, beer, wine and soft drinks, under division 11 (Manufacture of beverages);

- Manufacture of botanical products for pharmaceutical use, under class 2100 (Manufacture of drugs, medical chemical and pharmaceutical products).

108 - 1080 - 10800: Manufacture of feeds for cattle, poultry and aquatic animals

This class includes:

- Manufacture of prepared feeds for pets, including dogs, cats, birds, fish, etc.

- Manufacture of prepared feeds for farm animals, including animal feed concentrates and feed supplements;

- Preparation of unmixed feeds for farm livestock.

This class also includes the activities of treating of slaughter waste to produce animal feeds.

Exclusion:

- Production of animal feeds from fish meal, under class 1020 (Processing and preserving of aquatic products and related derivative products);

- Production of oilseed cake, under class 1040 (Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats);

- Activities resulting in by-products usable as animal feed without special treatment, e.g. oilseeds under class 1040 (Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats), or grain milling residues under class 1061 (Milling and manufacture of raw flour).

11: MANUFACTURE OF BEVERAGES

This division includes the manufacture of non-alcoholic beverages and mineral water; manufacture of alcoholic beverages mainly through fermentation; manufacture of beer and wine; manufacture of alcoholic beverages through distillation.

Exclusion:

- Production of juices of fruit and vegetables, under class 1030 (Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables);

- Manufacture of milk-based drinks, under class 10500 (Processing of milk and dairy products);

- Manufacture of coffee and tea, under class 10790 (Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified);

110: Manufacture of beverages

1101 - 11010: Distilling, rectifying and blending of spirits

This class includes:

- Manufacture of distilled or blended spirits: whisky, gin, liqueur, mixed drinks, etc.

- Blending of distilled spirits;

- Production of neutral spirits.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of denatured ethyl alcohol, under class 20110 (Manufacture of basic chemicals);

- Manufacture of non-distilled alcoholic beverages, under class 11020 (Manufacture of wines) and class 11030 (Manufacture of beer and malt);

- Bottling and labeling, under group 463 (Wholesale of rice, food, beverages and tobacco), if performed as part of wholesale, or under class 82920 (Packaging services) if performed on a fee or contract basis.

1102 - 11020: Manufacture of wines

This class includes:

- Manufacture of wine;

- Manufacture of sparkling wine;

- Manufacture of wine from concentrate grape must;

- Manufacture of fermented but non-distilled alcoholic beverages: sake, cider, perry, mead, other fruit wines and mixed beverages containing alcohol;

- Manufacture of vermouth and similar drinks.

This class also includes:

- Blending of wines;

- Manufacture of low-alcohol or non-alcoholic wine.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of vinegar, under class 10790 (Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified);

- Bottling and labeling, under group 463 (Wholesale of rice, food, beverages and tobacco), if performed as part of wholesale, or under class 82920 (Packaging services) if performed on a fee or contract basis.

1103 - 11030: Manufacture of beer and malt

This class includes:

- Manufacture of malt liquors such as beer and dark beer.

- Manufacture of malt.

- Manufacture of low-alcohol or non-alcoholic beer.

1104: Manufacture of non-alcoholic beverages and mineral water

11041: Manufacture of mineral water and bottled water

This class includes the manufacture of natural mineral waters and other bottled waters.

11042: Manufacture of non-alcoholic beverages

This class includes:

- Manufacture of non-alcoholic beverages, except non-alcoholic beer and wine;

- Manufacture of soft drinks;

- Manufacture of non-alcoholic sweetened waters or related powders: lemonade, orangeade, cola, fruit drinks, tonic waters, etc.

Exclusion:

- Production of juices of fruit and vegetables, under class 1030 (Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables);

- Manufacture of milk-based drinks, under class 10500 (Processing of milk and dairy products);

- Manufacture of coffee, tea and additives, under class 10790 (Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified);

- Production of non-alcoholic wine, under class 11020 (Manufacture of wines).

- Manufacture of non-alcoholic beer, under class 11030 (Manufacture of beer and malt);

- Bottling and labeling, under group 463 (Wholesale of rice, food, beverages and tobacco), if performed as part of wholesale, or under class 82920 (Packaging services) if performed on a fee or contract basis.

12: MANUFACTURE OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS

This division includes the activities of processing of tobacco into a form suitable for final consumption.

120 - 1200: Manufacture of tobacco products

12001: Manufacture of tobacco

This class includes:

- Manufacture of tobacco and tobacco products such as: cigarettes;

- Manufacture of homogenized or reconstituted tobacco.

Exclusion: Growing or preliminary processing of tobacco, under class 01150 (Growing of tobacco or aztec tobacco).

12009: Other manufacture of tobacco

This class includes:

- Stemming and drying of tobacco;

- Manufacture of cigars, pipe tobacco, chewing tobacco, roll-up tobacco.

13: MANUFACTURE OF TEXTILES

This division includes the production of textile fibers, textile weaving, fishing of textiles, manufacture of textile articles, except apparel (e.g. household fabric articles, linen, rugs, cordages, etc.) Growing of natural fibers is covered under division 01 (Agriculture and related services) while manufacture of synthetic fibers is a chemical process classified in class 20300 (Manufacture of man-made fibers). Manufacture of wearing apparel is covered in division 14 (Manufacture of wearing apparel).

131: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles

This group includes the manufacture of textile products, which consists of preparatory operations, textile fiber spinning and textile weaving. Products can be composed of various raw materials such as silk, wool, fibers of animal or vegetable origin or man-made fibers, paper or glass, etc.

This group also includes the activities of finishing of textiles and wearing apparel, i.e. bleaching, dyeing, sewing and similar activities.

1311 - 13110: Spinning of textile fibers

This class includes:

- Preparatory operations concerning textile fibers: spinning and weaving of fibers; degreasing and carbonizing of wool, dyeing of wool fleece; carding and combing of fibers of animal, vegetable or man-made origin;

- Reeling and production of yarn for weaving or sewing for trade or further processing;

- Texturizing, twisting, folding and dipping of synthetic or artificial fibers;

- Manufacture of broad cotton fabrics, wool fabrics, silk fabrics and flax linen fabrics, including artificial or synthetic fibers;

- Manufacture paper yarn.

Exclusion:

- Preparatory operations carried out in combination with agriculture or farming, under division 01 (Agriculture and related services);

- Nursing of plants bearing textile fibers (jute, flax, coir, etc.), under class 01160 (Growing of fiber crops);

- Cotton ginning, under class 01630 (Post-harvest crop activities);

- Manufacture of synthetic or artificial fibers or single yarns (including high-tenacity yarn and carpet yarn) of synthetic or artificial fibers, under class 20300 (Manufacture of man-made fibers);

- Manufacture of glass fibers, under class 23100 (Manufacture of glass and glass products).

1312 - 13120: Weaving of textiles

This class includes:

- Manufacture of broad woven cotton fabrics and other woven or embroidered fabrics from synthetic or man-made yarns

- Manufacture of other broad woven fabrics from flax, ramie, jute and special fibers;

- Manufacture of wool peach, chenille fabrics, terrycloth, gauze;

- Manufacture of woven fabrics of glass fibers;

- Manufacture of woven fabrics of carbon and aramid threads;

- Manufacture of imitation fur by weaving.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of woven fabric flooring, under class 13230 (Manufacture of carpets and rugs);

- Manufacture of non-woven felts and fabrics, under class 13290 (Manufacture of other textiles not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of narrow woven fabrics, under class 13290 (Manufacture of other textiles not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics, under class 13210 (Manufacture of knitted, crocheted and non-woven fabrics).

1313 - 13130: Finishing of textiles

This class includes:

- Bleaching or dyeing of woven fabrics, yarns and textile articles, including wearing apparel;

- Dressing, dyeing, steaming, shrinking, mending, mercerizing of fabrics and textile articles, including wearing apparel;

- Bleaching of jeans;

- Pleating and similar work on textile articles;

- Waterproofing, coating, rubberizing or impregnating of fabrics;

- Screen printing on garments and textile articles.

Exclusion: Manufacture of textile fabrics impregnated or coated with rubber as the main constituent, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products).

132: Manufacture of other textiles

This class includes the manufacture of products from textiles, except wearing apparel. Such products include made-up textile articles, carpets and rugs, rope, pillow fabrics and trimmings, etc.

1321 - 13210: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics

This class includes:

- Manufacture and processing of wool fabrics:

+ Pile and terrycloth,

+ Net and window furnishing fabrics knitted on Raschel or similar machines,

+ Other knitted or crocheted fabrics

- Manufacture of imitation fur by knitting.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of net and window furnishing fabrics of lace knitted on Raschel or similar machines, under class 13290 (Manufacture of other textiles not elsewhere classified).

- Manufacture of knitted and sewn garments and trimmings, under class 14300 (Manufacture of knitted and crocheted apparel).

1322 - 13220: Manufacture of made-up textiles (except wearing apparel)

This class includes:

- Manufacture of made-up articles of any textile materials, including wool fabrics:

+ Blankets and travelling rugs,

+ Bed linen, table linen or kitchen linen,

+ Quilts, eiderdowns, cushions, pillows and sleeping bags.

- Manufacture of made-up textile articles such as:

+ Curtains, valances, blinds, bedspreads, furniture or machine covers,

+ Tarpaulins, tents, camping goods, sails, loose covers for cars, machines or furniture,

+ Flags, banners, pennants, etc.

+ Dust cloths, dishcloths and similar articles, life jackets, parachutes,

This group also includes:

- Manufacture of electric blankets;

- Manufacture of hand-woven tapestries;

- Manufacture of tire covers.

Exclusion: Manufacture of textile articles for technical use, under class 13290 (Manufacture of other textiles not elsewhere classified);

1323 - 13230: Manufacture of carpets and rugs

This class includes:

- Manufacture of textile floor coverings: carpets, rugs, mats;

- Manufacture of floor coverings of needle loom felt.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of mats of plaiting materials, under class 1629 (Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of bamboo, straw and plaiting materials);

- Manufacture of floor coverings from plastics, rubber and plaiting materials, under class 1629 (Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of bamboo, straw and plaiting materials);

- Manufacture of linoleum and resilient floor coverings, under class 2220 (Manufacture of plastics products).

1324 - 13240: Manufacture of cordages and nets

This class includes:

- Manufacture of twine, cordage, braided rope and cables of textile fibers or similar fibers, whether or not impregnated, coated or sheathed with rubber or plastics;

- Manufacture of knotted nets of cordage, twine or braided rope;

- Manufacture of products of netting or cordage: fishing nets, ships’ fenders, cables and cordages with metal rings, slings, cushions, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of hairnets, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Production of wire rope, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

1329 - 13290: Manufacture of other textiles not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

Activities related to the manufacture of textiles or textile products not specified elsewhere in division 12 or 13.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of narrow woven fabrics, including warp-less fabrics that consist of weft assembled by means of an adhesive,

- Manufacture of labels, banners, etc.

- Manufacture of ornamental trimmings: pompons, tassels,

- Manufacture of felt,

- Manufacture of tulles and other net fabrics, of laces in roll, piece, in strips or in motifs.

- Manufacture of fabrics impregnated, coated or laminated with plastics,

- Manufacture of metalized yarn, rope and rubber cord covered with textile material, textile yarn coated, covered or sheathed with rubber or plastics,

- Manufacture of tyre cord fabrics of high-tenacity man-made yarn,

- Manufacture of treated or coated fabrics: hunting clothing, sailcloth, tent fabrics, painter’s canvass, buckram and stiffened fabrics, etc.

- Manufacture of other textile articles: lamp wicks, gas mantle fabrics,

- Manufacture of gas mantels, hosepiping, conveyor belts or belting (whether or not reinforced with metal or other materials, strained cloth,

- Manufacture of machine covers,

- Manufacture of pressure-sensitive cloth,

- Manufacture of oil panting canvas and tracing cloth,

- Manufacture of shoe lace,

- Manufacture of powder puffs and gloves.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of floor coverings, under class 13220 (Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except wearing apparel);

- Manufacture of textile wadding and articles of wadding: bath towel or sanitary pads, under class 17090 (Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of conveyor belts or transmission belts of textile fabric, rope or cordage covered or coated with rubber as the main constituent, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products);

- Manufacture of plates, sheets or pieces of rubber combined with textiles for reinforcing purpose, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products) or class 2220 (Manufacture of plastics products);

- Production of garments of metal wire, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

14: MANUFACTURE OF WEARING APPAREL

This division includes the activities of tailoring (ready-to-wear or made-to-measure) in all materials (e.g. leather, fabric, knitted or crocheted fabrics) of all items of clothing (e.g. outerwear or underwear for men, women and children; work or casual clothing, urban clothing, etc.) and accessories. There is no distinction made between clothing for adults and for children, or between modern and traditional clothing.

141 - 1410 - 14100: Manufacture of wearing apparel (except fur apparel)

This class includes:

- Manufacture of wearing apparel using materials of any kind, which may be coated, impregnated or rubberized;

- Manufacture of wearing apparel made of leather or composition leather, including leather accessories for industrial work such as leather aprons;

- Manufacture of protective clothing;

- Manufacture of outerwear made of wool fabric, knitted or crocheted fabrics or other types for women, men and children: coats, jackets, suits, trousers, skirts, etc.

- Manufacture of underwear and nightwear made of wool fabric, knitted or crocheted fabrics for men, women and children: shirts, T-shirts, shorts, tight shorts, pajamas, nightdresses, blouses, undershirt, corsets, etc.

- Manufacture of babies’ garments, swimwear, ski suits;

- Manufacture of hats and caps;

- Manufacture of other clothing accessories: gloves, belts, cravats, hairnets, shawls;

- Manufacture of festival costumes;

- Manufacture of headgear of fur skins;

- Manufacture of footwear of textile material without applied soles;

- Manufacture of parts of the products listed.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of wearing apparel of fur skins (except headgear), under class 14200 (Manufacture of articles of fur);

- Manufacture of footwear, under class 15200 (Manufacture of footwear);

- Manufacture of wearing apparel of rubber or plastics not assembled by stitching but merely by fastening, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products) and class 22209 (Manufacture of other plastics products);

- Manufacture of leather sports gloves and sports headgears, under class 32300 (Manufacture of sports goods);

- Manufacture of safety headgear (except sports headgear), under class 32900 (Other manufacturing not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of fire resistant and protective safety clothing, under class 32900 (Other manufacturing not elsewhere classified);

- Repair of wearing apparel, under class 95290 (Repair of other personal and household goods).

142 - 1420 - 14200: Manufacture of articles of fur

This class includes:

Manufacture of articles made of fur skins:

+ Wearing apparel and clothing accessories,

+ Assemblies of fur skins such as mats, plates, strips, etc.

+ Other by-products of fur skins such as rugs, pouffes, industrial polishing cloths.

Exclusion:

- Production of fur skins, under class 14200 (Manufacture of articles of fur);

- Production of raw hides and skins, under class 1010 (Processing and preserving of meat and meat products);

- Production of imitation furs (woven or knitted long-hair clothing), under class 13110 (Spinning of textile fibers) and class 13120 (Weaving of textiles);

- Manufacture of fur hats, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Manufacture of apparel trimmed with fur, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Dressing and dyeing of fur, under class 15110 (Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur);

- Production of boots or shoes containing fur parts, under class 15200 (Manufacture of footwear);

143 - 1430 - 14300: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted apparel

This class includes:

- Manufacture of knitted or crocheted wearing apparel or other made-up articles knitted or crocheted directly into shape: pullovers, sweaters, cardigans, and similar articles;

- Manufacture of hosiery, including tights, pantyhose and socks.

Exclusion: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics, under class 13210 (Manufacture of knitted, crocheted and non-woven fabrics).

15: MANUFACTURE OF LEATHER AND RELATED PRODUCTS

This division includes the activities of dressing and dyeing of fur, transformation of hides into leather by tanning, fabrication of leather into products for final consumption. It also includes the manufacture of similar products from other materials (artificial leathers or leather substitutes), such as rubber footwear or textile luggage. The products made from leather substitutes are included in this division since they are made in ways similar to those in which leather products are made (e.g. luggage). They are often produced in the same unit.

151: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddle; dressing and dyeing of fur

This class includes the manufacture of leather, fur and products thereof.

1511 - 15110: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur

This class includes:

- Tanning and dyeing of hides and skins;

- Manufacture of dressed leather of chamois, dressed parchment of sheep or goat skin, patent leather or rubberized leather.

- Manufacture of composition leather;

- Scraping, combing, tanning, bleaching, shearing, plucking and dyeing of skins and hides.

Exclusion:

- Production of hides and skins as part of ranching, under group 014 (Animal husbandry)

- Production of hides and skins as part of slaughtering, under class 1010 (Processing and preserving of meat and meat products);

- Manufacture of leather apparel, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Production of artificial leather not based on natural leather, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products) and class 2220 (Manufacture of plastics products).

1512 - 15120: Manufacture of luggage, handbags and similar articles; manufacture of saddle and harness

This class includes:

- Manufacture of luggage, handbags and similar articles made of leather, composition leather or any other materials such as plastic, textile materials, vulcanized fiber or paperboard, provided that such materials undergo the same technology for leather processing;

- Manufacture of saddle and harness;

- Manufacture of non-metallic watch bands (e.g. fabric, leather, plastic);

- Manufacture of other articles of leather or composition leather: safety belt, bags, etc.

- Manufacture of leather shoe-lace;

- Manufacture of horse whips and riding crops.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of leather apparel, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Manufacture of leather gloves and hats, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Manufacture of footwear, under class 15200 (Manufacture of footwear);

- Manufacture of bicycle saddles, under class 30920 (Manufacture of bicycles and invalid carriages);

- Manufacture of watch bands of precious metals, under class 32110 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

- Manufacture of watch bands of non-precious metals, under class 32120 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

- Manufacture of linemen’s safety belts and other belts for occupational use, under class 32900 (Other manufacturing not elsewhere classified).

152 - 1520 -15200: Manufacture of footwear

This class includes:

- Manufacture of footwear for all purposes, of any material, by any process including moulding;

- Manufacture of leather parts of footwear: production of toe caps and parts of uppers, outer and inner soles;

- Manufacture of gaiters, leggings and similar articles.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of footwear of textile material without applied sole, under class 14100 (Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel);

- Manufacture of plastic parts of footwear, under class 2220 (Manufacture of plastics products)

- Manufacture of rubber boots, rubber shoes, soles and other footwear parts of rubber, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products);

- Manufacture of wooden shoe parts (e.g. lasts and heels), under class 1629 (Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of bamboo, straw and plaiting materials).

16: WOOD PROCESSING AND MANUFACTURE OF PRODUCTS OF WOOD AND BAMBOO (EXCEPT FURNITURE); MANUFACTURE OF ARTICLES OF STRAW AND PLAITING MATERIALS

This division includes the manufacture of wood products, such as: lumber, plywood, veneers, wooden containers, wood flooring, wood trusses and prefabricated wood buildings. The processes of production include sawing, planing, shaping, laminating and assembling of wood products. Such processes start from cutting of logs into bolts or lumber that are then cut further or shaped by lathes or other shaping tools. Lumber or transformed wood shapes may be subsequently planed or smoothed and assembled into finished products, such as wooden containers.

Exclusion: Manufacture of furniture, under class 3100 (Manufacture of furniture), or installation of wooden fittings and similar articles, under class 43300 (Building completion and finishing).

161 - 1610: Sawing, milling, planing and preserving of wood

16101: Sawmilling and planing of wood

This class includes:

- Sawing, milling, planing and machining of wood.

- Slicing, peeling or chipping logs.

- Manufacture of wooden railway sleepers.

- Manufacture of unassembled wooden flooring.

- Manufacture of wood wool, wood flour, chips and particles.

16102: Preserving of wood

This class includes:

- Drying of wood.

- Impregnation or chemical treatment of wood with preservatives or other materials.

Exclusion:

- Logging and production of wood in the rough, under class 02210 (Logging)

- Manufacture of thin veneer sheets for use in plywood, boards and panels, under class 16210 (Manufacture of veneer, plywood and veneer panels).

- Manufacture of shingles and shakes, beadings and mouldings, under class 16220 (Manufacture of builders’ carpentry and joinery).

162: Manufacture of products of wood, bamboo (except furniture), straw and plaiting materials

This class includes the manufacture of products (e.g. basic shapes and assembled products) of wood, bamboo, straw and plaiting materials.

1621 - 16210: Manufacture of veneer, plywood and veneer panels

This class includes:

- Manufacture of veneer sheets thin enough to be used for veneering or making plywood or for other purposes:

+ Smoothed, dyed, coated, impregnated and reinforced sheets (with paper or fabric backing),

+ In form of motifs,

- Manufacture of plywood, veneer panels and similar wood boards and sheets,

- Manufacture of particle board or fiberboard.

- Manufacture of densified wood and heat-insulating glass materials;

- Manufacture of glue laminated wood and laminated veneer wood.

1622 - 16220: Manufacture of builders’ carpentry and joinery 

This class includes:

- Manufacture of wooden goods intended to be used primarily in the construction industry:

+ Rafter, beam, struts,

+ Prefabricated wooden roof trusses that are glue-laminated or metal-connected.

+ Doors, windows, shutters, their frames, whether or not containing metal fittings such as hinges, locks, etc.

+ Stairs, railings,

+ Wooden shingles and shakes, beadings, mouldings,

+ Parquet floor blocks, strips assembled into panels.

- Manufacture of prefabricated buildings or elements thereof, predominantly of wood;

- Manufacture of wooden mobile homes;

- Manufacture of wooden parts (except free standings).

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of unassembled wooden flooring, under class 1610 (Sawmilling and planing of wood);

- Manufacture of kitchen cabinets, bookcases, wardrobes, etc., under class 3100 (Manufacture of furniture);

- Manufacture of freestanding partitions, under class 3100 (Manufacture of furniture).

1623 - 16230: Manufacture of wood packaging

This class includes:

- Manufacture of wooden cases, boxes, crates, drums and similar wood packings;

- Manufacture of pallets, box pallets and other load boards of wood;

- Manufacture of barrels, vats, tubs and other wooden containers;

- Manufacture of wooden cable-drums.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of wooden luggage, under class 15120 (Manufacture of luggage, handbags and similar articles; manufacture of saddle and harness);

- Manufacture of cases of plaiting materials, under class 1629 (Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of bamboo, straw and plaiting materials);

1629: Manufacture of other products of wood, bamboo, straw and plaiting materials

16291: Manufacture of other products of wood

This class includes:

- Manufacture of various wood products:

+ Handles and bodies for tools, brooms, brushes,

+ Boot or shoe last and tree, or clothes hangers,

+ Household utensils and kitchenware of wood,

+ Wooden statuettes and ornaments, wood marquetry, inlaid wood,

+ Wooden cases for jewellery and similar articles of wood,

+ Wooden spools, cops, bobbins, sewing thread reels, and similar articles of wooden silk winders,

+ Other articles of woods.

- Manufacture of fire logs, made of pressed wood or substitute materials like coffee ground or soybean ground.

16292: Manufacture of other forest products (except wood), sedge and plaiting materials

- Manufacture of furniture, under class 3100 (Manufacture of furniture);

- Manufacture of wooden toys, under class 32400 (Manufacture of games and toys);

- Manufacture of brushes and brooms, under class 32900 (Other manufacturing not elsewhere classified);

17: MANUFACTURE OF PAPER AND PAPER PRODUCTS

This division includes:

Manufacture of pulp, paper or paper products. The manufacture of these products is grouped together because they constitute a series of vertically connected processes. More than one activity is often carried out in a single unit. There are normally three activities: Manufacture of pulp involves separating cellulose fibers from impure wood or used paper. Manufacture of paper involves matting fibers into a sheet. Products of paper and other materials are made by various cutting and shaping techniques, including coating and laminating activities. Paper articles may be printed (e.g. wallpaper, gift wrap), etc.

The production of pulp, paper and paperboard is included in class 1701 (Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard).

170: Manufacture of paper and paper products

1701 - 17010: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

This class includes:

- Manufacture of bleached, semi-bleached or unbleached paper pulp by mechanical, chemical (dissolving or non-dissolving) or semi-chemical processes;

- Manufacture of cotton-linters pulp;

- Removal of ink and manufacture of pulp from waste paper;

- Manufacture of paper and paperboard through high-technology processes.

- Processing of paper and paperboard:

+ Coating, covering and impregnating of paper and paperboard,

+ Manufacture of crinkled paper,

+ Manufacture of laminated sheets of paper and paperboard,

- Manufacture of handmade paper;

- Manufacture of newsprint and printing or writing paper;

- Manufacture of cellulose wadding and webs of cellulose fibers;

- Manufacture of carbon paper or stencil paper in rolls or large sheets.

Exclusion:

- Production of corrugated paper and paperboard, under class 1702 (Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard).

- Production of further-processed articles of paper, paperboard or pulp, under class 17090 (Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified);

- Production of coated or impregnated paper, where the coating or impregnant is the main ingredient, under class in which Manufacture of the coating or impregnant is included;

- Production of abrasive paper, under class 23990 (Manufacture of other chemical products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of life preservers, under class 32900 (Other manufacturing not elsewhere classified);

1702: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper and paperboard

17021: Manufacture of containers of paper and paperboard

This class includes:

- Manufacture of containers of corrugated paper or paperboard (with folds for storage of glassware);

- Manufacture of containers of solid board;

- Manufacture of other containers of paper and paperboard;

- Manufacture of paper sacks;

- Manufacture of office file boxes and similar articles.

Exclusion: Production of envelopes, under class 17090 (Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified);

17022: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard

This class includes:

- Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard.

- Manufacture of containers made of corrugated paper or paperboard.

Exclusion: Production of moulded or pressed articles of paper pulp, under class 17090 (Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified);

1709 - 17090: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Manufacture of personal hygiene and household paper and cellulose wadding:

+ Toilet paper.

+ Serviettes, napkin paper, tower,

+ Sanitary pads and sanitary towels, infant’s paper diapers,

+ Cups, dishes and trays.

- Manufacture of textile wadding and articles of wadding: sanitary towels, sanitary pads;

- Manufacture of printing and writing paper ready for use;

- Manufacture of computer printout paper ready for use;

- Manufacture of self-copy paper ready for use;

- Manufacture of duplicator stencils and carbon paper ready for use;

- Manufacture of gummed or adhesive paper ready for use;

- Manufacture of envelopes and postcards;

- Manufacture of registers, accounting books, binders, albums and similar educational and commercial stationery;

- Manufacture of boxes, pouches, wallets and writing compendiums containing an assortment of paper stationery;

- Manufacture of wallpaper and similar wall coverings, including plastic-coated and textile wallpaper;

- Manufacture of labels;

- Manufacture of filter paper and paperboard;

- Manufacture of paper and paperboard bobbins and cops;

- Manufacture of egg trays and other moulded pulp packaging products;

- Manufacture of paper novelties;

- Manufacture of joss papers.

Exclusion:

- Production of broad paper or paperboard, under class 17010 (Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard).

- Printing on paper products, under class 18110 (Printing);

- Manufacture of games and toys of paper or paperboard, under class 32400 (Manufacture of games and toys);

18: PRINTING AND REPRODUCTION OF RECORDED MEDIA

This division includes:

Printing of products, such as newspapers, books, periodicals, greeting cards, business forms and other materials, as well as relevant support activities such as bookbinding, plate-making services and data imaging. The support activities included in this division are an integral part of the printing industry for products (printing plates, bound books, computer disks or files).

Processes used in printing include a variety of methods for transferring an image from a plate, screen or computer file to a medium, such as paper, plastics, metal, textile articles or wood. The most prominent of these methods entails the transfer of the image from a plate or screen to the medium through lithographic, gravure, or flexographic printing. Often a computer file is used to directly drive the printing mechanism to create the image or electrostatic and other types of equipment (digital or non-impact printing).

Printing and publishing can be carried out by the same unit (e.g. a newspaper).

This division also includes the reproduction of recorded media, such as compact discs, video recordings, software on discs or tapes, records.

Exclusion: Publishing activities under division 58 (Publishing activities). 181: Printing and related services

This group includes the activities of printing of products, such as newspapers, books, periodicals, greeting cards, business forms and other materials, as well as associated support activities such as bookbinding, plate-making services and data imaging. Printing can be done using various techniques and on different materials.

1811 - 18110: Printing

This class includes:

- Printing of newspapers, magazines and other periodicals, books and brochures, music manuscripts, maps, atlases, posters, advertising catalogues, prospectuses and other printed advertising, postage stamps, taxation stamps, documents, cheques and other security papers, diaries, calendars, business forms and other commercial printed matter, personal stationery and other printed matter by letterpress, offset, flexographic, lithographic and other printing presses, duplication machines, computer printers, embossers;

- Printing directly onto textiles, plastics, metal, wood and ceramics;

- The material printed is copyrighted.

This class also includes the activities of printing on labels or tags (lithographic, gravure printing, flexographic printing, etc.)

Exclusion:

- Silk screen printing (including thermal printing) on wearing apparel, under class 13130 (Finishing of textiles);

- Manufacture of paper articles, such as binders, under class 17090 (Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified);

- Publishing of printed matter, under group 581 (Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities);

- Photocopying of documents, under class 8219 (Photocopying, document preparation and other specialized office support activities).

1812 - 18120: Printing and related services

This class includes:

- Binding of printed sheets into books, magazines, brochures, catalogues, etc., by folding, assembling, stitching, gluing, collating (pages), basting, adhesive binding, trimming, gold stamping;

- Composition, typesetting, phototypesetting, pre-press data input including scanning and optical character recognition, electronic make-up;

- Plate-making services including image-setting and plate-setting (for letterpress and offset printing)

- Engraving or etching of cylinders for gravure;

- Direct processing of plate to plate (including photopolymer plates);

- Preparation of plates and dyeing for relief of stamping or printing;

- Production of printing proofs;

- Artistic works including preparation of litho stones and prepared woodblocks (a wooden board used as printout);

- Production of reprographic products;

- Design of printing products such as sketches, layouts, dummies;

- Other graphic activities such as die-sinking, die-stamping, Braille copying, punching and drilling, embossing, varnishing and laminating, collating and insetting, creasing.

182 - 1820 - 18200: REPRODUCTION OF RECORDED MEDIA

This class includes:

- Reproduction from master copies of gramophone records, compact discs and music tapes;

- Reproduction from master copies of video recordings, magnetic discs and video tapes;

- Reproduction from master copies of software and data on discs and tapes.

Exclusion:

- Reproduction of printed matter, under class 18110 (Printing);

- Publishing of software, under class 58200 (Software publishing);

- Production and distribution of motion pictures, video discs and movies on DVD or similar media, under classes 5911 (Motion picture, video and television program production activities) , 5912 (Post-production activities) and 5913 (Motion picture, video and television program distribution activities);

- Production of master copies of sound recordings or other audio materials, under class 59130 (Motion picture, video and television program distribution activities);

- Reproduction of films for theatrical distribution, under class 59200 (Sound recording and music publishing activities).

19: MANUFACTURE OF COKE AND REFINED PETROLEUM PRODUCTS

This division includes the transformation of crude petroleum and coal into usable products. The dominant manufacturing process is petroleum refining, which involves the separation of crude petroleum into component products through such techniques as cracking and distillation.

This division also includes the manufacture of bearing similar characteristics (e.g. coke, butane, propane, oil, petrol, etc.) as well as processing services (e.g. custom refining). Manufacture of gases such as ethane, propane and butane as products of petroleum refineries.

Exclusion:

Manufacture of such gases in other units and of basic chemicals, under class 20110 (Manufacture of basic chemicals); manufacture of industrial gases, under class 20110 (Manufacture of basic chemicals); extraction of natural gas (methane, ethane, butane or propane), under class 06200 (Extraction of natural gas) and manufacture of fuel gas except petroleum gases (e.g. coal gas, water gas, producer gas) under class 35200 (Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains). Manufacture of petrochemicals from refined petroleum is classified in division 20 (Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products).

191 - 1910 -19100: Manufacture of coke oven products

This class includes:

- Operation of coke ovens;

- Production of coke and semi-coke;

- Production of pitch and pitch coke;

- Production of coke oven gas;

- Production of crude gas and asphalt;

- Distillation of coke.

192 - 1920 - 19200: Manufacture of refined petroleum products

This class includes:

Manufacture of liquid or gaseous fuels or other products from crude petroleum, bituminous minerals or their fractionation products. Petroleum refining involves one or more of the following activities: fractionation, straight distillation of crude oil, and cracking.

This class includes:

- Production of motor fuel: gasoline, kerosene, etc.

- Production of fuel: light, medium and heavy fuel oil, refinery gases such as ethane, propane, butane, etc.

- Manufacture of oil-based lubricating oils or greases, including those from waste oil;

- Manufacture of products for the petrochemical industry and for the production of road coverings;

- Manufacture of various products: white spirit, Vaseline, paraffin wax, petroleum jelly, etc.

- Manufacture of hard-coal and lignite fuel briquettes;

- Manufacture of petroleum briquettes;

- Blending of biofuels, i.e. blending of alcohols with petroleum.

20: MANUFACTURE OF CHEMICALS AND CHEMICAL PRODUCTS

This division includes:

The transformation of organic and inorganic raw materials by a chemical process towards the formation of products. It distinguishes the production of basic chemicals that constitute the first industry group from the production of intermediate and end-products made by further processing of basic chemicals, which make up the remaining industry classes.

201: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms

This class includes the production of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms.

2011 - 20110: Manufacture of basic chemicals

This class includes the manufacture of chemicals through basic processes, such as thermal cracking and distillation. The output of these processes is usually separate chemical elements or separate chemically defined compounds.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of liquefied or compressed inorganic industrial or medical gases:

+ Elemental gases,

+ Liquid or compressed air,

+ Refrigerant gases,

+ Mixed industrial gases,

+ Inert gases such as carbon dioxide,

+ Isolating gases.

- Manufacture of dyes and pigments from any source in basic form or as concentrate;

+ Manufacture of chemical elements,

+ Manufacture of inorganic acids except nitric acid,

+ Manufacture of alkalis, lyes and other inorganic bases except ammonia.

+ Manufacture of other organic compounds.

+ Manufacture of basic organic chemicals:

+ Acyclic hydrocarbons, saturated or unsaturated,

+ Cyclic hydrocarbons, saturated or unsaturated,

+ Acyclic and cyclic alcohols,

+ mono-carboxylic and polycarboxylic acids, including acetic acid,

+ Other oxygen-function compounds, including aldehydes, ketones, quinones and dual or poly oxygen-function compounds,

+ Synthetic glycerol,

+ Nitrogen-function organic compounds, including amines,

+ Fermentation of sugar, cereals or the like to produce alcohol and esters,

+ Other organic compounds, including wood distillation products (e.g. charcoal).

- Manufacture of distilled water;

- Manufacture of synthetic aromatic products;

- Roasting of iron pyrites.

This group also includes:

- Manufacture of products of the same kind to be used as fluorescent brightening agents;

- Enrichment of uranium and thorium ores.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of nitrogenous fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, under class 20120 (Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds);

- Manufacture of ammonia, under class 20120 (Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds);

- Manufacture of ammonium chloride, under class 20120 (Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds);

- Manufacture of nitrites and nitrates of potassium, under class 20120 (Production of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds);

- Manufacture of ammonium carbonates, under class 20120 (Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds);

- Manufacture of plastics in primary forms, under class 2013 (Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms);

- Manufacture of synthetic rubber in primary forms, under class 2013 (Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms);

- Manufacture of dyes and pigments, under class 2022 (Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mastics);

- Manufacture of crude glycerol, under class 2023 (Manufacture of cosmetics, soap, detergents, polishing preparations and toilet preparations);

- Manufacture of natural essential oils, under class 20290 (Manufacture of other chemical products not elsewhere classified);

222 - 2220: Manufacture plastics products

22201: Manufacture of plastic packaging

This class includes:

Processing of new or used plastics resins into intermediate or final products through processes such as compression moulding, extrusion moulding, injection moulding, blow moulding and cutting. For all of such processes, the production process is such that a wide variety of products can be made.

- Manufacture of hard plastic floor coverings or linoleum;

- Manufacture of artificial stone;

- Manufacture of transformed plastics products: Plastic cap, insulating fittings, parts of lighting fittings, office or school supplies, articles of apparel (if sealed but not sewn together), household articles, statuettes, transmission and conveyor belts, plastic wall paper, shoe soles, cigar holders, combs, hair curlers and other items.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of luggage trunks, under class 15120 (Manufacture of luggage, handbags and similar articles; manufacture of saddle and harness);

- Manufacture of plastic footwear, under class 15200 (Manufacture of footwear);

- Manufacture of plastics in primary forms, under class 2013 (Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms);

- Manufacture of articles of synthetic or natural rubber, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products);

- Manufacture of plastic furniture, under class 31009 (Manufacture of furniture of other materials);

- Manufacture of uncovered plastic honeycomb mats, under class 31009 (Manufacture of furniture of other materials);

- Manufacture of plastic sports requisites, under class 32300 (Manufacture of sports goods);

- Manufacture of plastic games and toys, under class 32400 (Manufacture of games and toys);

- Manufacture of plastic dental and medical appliances, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental equipment and supplies);

- Manufacture of plastic ophthalmic goods, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental equipment and supplies);

- Manufacture of plastic hard hats and personal safety equipment of plastics, under class 32900 (Other manufacture not elsewhere classified).

23: MANUFACTURE OF OTHER NON-METALLIC MINERAL PRODUCTS

This division includes manufacturing activities related to a single substance of mineral origin. This division includes the manufacture of glass and glass products (e.g. flat glass, hollow glass, fiberglass, etc.) and ceramic products, baked clay products, cement and plaster from raw materials to finished articles.

Shaping and finishing of stone and other mineral products are also included in this division.

231 - 2310 - 23100: Manufacture of glass and glass products

This class includes:

Manufacture of glass in all forms, through all processes and into all products such as:

- Manufacture of flat glass, including colored, wired or flat glass

- Manufacture of laminated or toughened flat glass;

- Manufacture of glass in tubes or rods;

- Manufacture of glass paving blocks;

- Manufacture of glass mirrors;

- Manufacture of multiple-walled insulating units of glass;

- Manufacture of bottles and other containers of glass;

- Manufacture of drinking glasses, glassware or crystal articles;

- Manufacture of glass fibers, including glass wool and non-woven glass products;

- Manufacture of pharmaceutical glassware, laboratory and hygienic glassware;

- Manufacture of clock or watch glasses, optical glass and optical elements not optically worked;

- Manufacture of glass used in jewellery;

- Manufacture of glass insulators;

- Manufacture of glass envelopes for light bulbs;

- Manufacture of glass figurines.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of woven fabrics of glass yarn, under class 13120 (Weaving of textiles);

- Manufacture of optical elements optically worked, under class 26700 (Manufacture of optical instruments and equipment);

- Manufacture of optical fiber and fiber optical cable for live transmission of images, under group 273 (Manufacture of wiring and wiring devices);

- Manufacture of glass toys, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

- Manufacture of syringes and other medical laboratory equipment, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies).

239: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products not elsewhere classified

This class includes the manufacture of final or intermediate products from mined or quarried non-metallic minerals such as sand, gravel or kaolin.

2391 - 23910: Manufacture of refractory products

This class includes:

- Manufacture of refractory mortars and concrete.

- Manufacture of refractory ceramic goods:

+ Heat-insulating ceramic goods of siliceous fossil materials.

+ Refractory bricks and tiles.

+ Nozzles, pots, tubes, pipes.

This group also includes the manufacture of refractory articles containing magnesite, chromite or dolomite.

2392 - 23920: Manufacture of clay building materials

This class includes:

- Manufacture of non-refractory tiles and mosaic cubes;

- Manufacture of non-refractory flagstone and paving stone;

- Manufacture of non-refractory ceramic building materials: Manufacture of ceramic bricks, roofing tiles, chimney pots, etc.

- Manufacture of flooring blocks in baked clay;

- Manufacture of ceramic sanitary fixtures.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of artificial stone (e.g. cultured marble), under class 2220 (Manufacture of plastics products);

- Manufacture of refractory ceramic products, under class 23910 (Manufacture of refractory products).

2393 - 23930: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products

This class includes:

- Manufacture of ceramic tableware, household goods and toilet articles;

- Manufacture of statuettes and other ornamental ceramic articles;

- Manufacture of electrical insulators and insulating fittings of ceramics;

- Manufacture of ceramic laboratory, chemical and industrial products;

- Manufacture of ceramic pots, jars, bottles and similar articles of a kind, used for conveyance or packing of goods;

- Manufacture of ceramic furniture;

- Manufacture of ceramic products not elsewhere classified.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of artificial stone (e.g. cultured marble), under class 2220 (Manufacture of plastics products);

- Manufacture of refractory ceramic goods, under class 23910 (Manufacture of refractory products).

- Manufacture of ceramic building materials, under class 23920 (Manufacture of clay building materials);

- Manufacture of ceramic sanitary fixtures, under class 23920 (Manufacture of clay building materials);

- Manufacture of imitation jewellery, under class 32120 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

- Manufacture of ceramic toys, under class 32400 (Manufacture of games and toys);

- Manufacture of artificial teeth, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

23941: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

23941: Manufacture of cement

This class includes the manufacture of clinkers and hydraulic cements, including Portland cement, aluminous cement, slag cement and superphosphate cements.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of articles of plaster, under class 23950 (Production of articles of concrete, cement and plaster);

- Manufacture of ready-mixed and dry-mix concrete and mortars, under class 23950 (Production of articles of concrete, cement and plaster);

- Manufacture of cements used in dentistry, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

23942: Manufacture of lime

This class includes the manufacture of quicklime, slaked lime and hydraulic lime.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of articles of plaster, under class 23950 (Production of articles of concrete, cement and plaster);

- Manufacture of ready-mixed and dry-mix concrete and mortars, under class 23950 (Production of articles of concrete, cement and plaster);

- Manufacture of cements used in dentistry, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

23943: Manufacture of plaster

This class includes:

- Manufacture of calcined dolomite;

- Manufacture of plasters of calcined gypsum or calcined sulphate.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of refractory mortars and concrete, under class 23910 (Manufacture of refractory products).

- Manufacture of articles of cement, under class 23950 (Production of articles of concrete, cement and plaster);

- Manufacture of cements used in dentistry, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

2395 - 23950: Manufacture of concrete and articles of cement and plaster

This class includes:

- Manufacture of precast concrete, cement or artificial stone articles for use in construction: tiles, flagstones, bricks, sheets, panels, pipes, etc.

- Manufacture of prefabricated structural components for buildings or civil engineering of cement, concrete or artificial stone;

- Manufacture of plaster articles for use in construction: Boards, sheets, panels

- Manufacture of building materials of vegetable substances (wood, vegetable fiber, straw, rushes) agglomerated with cement, plaster and other mineral binders;

- Manufacture of articles of asbestos-cement or cellulose fiber-cement or similar materials: corrugated sheets, panels, tiles, tubes, pipes, faucets, jars, sinks, window frames;

- Manufacture of other articles: flowerpots, reliefs, statutes of concrete, plaster, cement or artificial stone;

- Manufacture of powdered mortars;

- Manufacture of ready-mix and dry-mix concrete.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of non-refractory cements and mortars, under class 23910 (Manufacture of refractory products).

2396 - 23960: Cutting, shaping and finishing of stone

This class includes:

- Cutting, shaping and finishing of stone for use in construction, in cemeteries, on roads and as roofing

- Manufacture of stone furniture.

Exclusion:

- Activities of stone quarry operators, e.g. production of rough cut stone, under class 0810 (Quarrying of stone, sand and clay);

- Production of crushed stone, stone powder and similar products, under class 23990 (Manufacture of other chemical products not elsewhere classified);

- Activities of sculptors, under class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities).

2399 - 23990: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Manufacture of powdered, sharpening or polishing stones and natural or artificial products, including those on a soft base (e.g. sandpaper);

- Manufacture of woven non-metallic mineral yarn and pieces in wearing apparel, hats, footwear, paper, braids, ropes, etc.0}

- Manufacture of friction material and un-mounted articles thereof with a base of mineral substances or of cellulose;

- Manufacture of soundproof mineral materials: slag wool, rock wool and similar mineral wools, mineral fertilizers, clays and similar sound-insulating, heat-insulating or sound-absorbing materials;

- Manufacture of articles of various mineral substances: mica and articles of mica, peat, graphite (except electric articles);

- Manufacture of articles of asphalt or similar material, e.g. asphalt-based adhesives, coal tar pitch;

- Carbon and graphite fibers and carbon-fiber products (except electric articles).

Exclusion: Manufacture of woven and non-woven glass wool products, under class 23100 (Manufacture of glass and glass products).

24: MANUFACTURE OF METALS

This division includes:

Activities of smelting and/or refining non-ferrous and ferrous metals from ore, pig or scrap, through electrometallurgical process and other metallurgic techniques. This also includes the manufacture of metal alloys and super-alloys by introducing other chemical elements to pure metals. The output of smelting and refining, usually in ingot form, is used in rolling, drawing and extruding operations to make products such as sheet, bars, panels, wire and in molten form to make castings and other basic metal products.

241 - 2410 - 24100: Manufacture of iron, steel and cast iron

This class includes:

Direct extraction of iron ore, production of melted or hard scraps of steel; conversion of steel scrap into crude steel; production of ferro-alloy, manufacture of steel and sheet piling (e.g. plate, sheet, panel, wire) and manufacture of steel ingots and pipes, as follows:

- Operation of blast furnaces, steel converters, rolling and finishing mills;

- Production of steel scraps, spiegeleisen in pigs, blocks or other primary forms;

- Production of ferro-alloys;

- Production of ferrous products by direct reduction of iron and other spongy ferrous products, and production of pure iron by electrolysis or other chemical processes;

- Production of granular iron and iron powder;

- Production of steel in ingots or other primary forms;

- Production of semi-finished products of steel;

- Manufacture of hot-rolled, cold-rolled and flat-rolled steel products;

- Manufacture of hot-rolled bars of steel;

- Manufacture of hot-rolled open sections of steel;

- Manufacture of steel bars and solid sections of steel by cold drawing, grinding or turning;

- Manufacture of open sections by progressive cold forming on a roll mill or folding on a press of flat-rolled products of steel;

- Manufacture of wire of steel by cold drawing or stretching;

- Manufacture of sheet piling of steel and welded open sections of steel;

- Manufacture of railway track materials (unassembled rails) of steel;

- Manufacture of seamless tubes, pipes and hollow profiles of steel by hot rolling, hot drawing or cold rolling or cold drawing;

- Manufacture of welded tubes and pipes of steel by hot or cold forming and welding, further processed by cold drawing or cold rolling or manufactured by hot forming and welding;

- Manufacture of tube fittings of steel, such as flat flanges and flanges with forged collars, welds.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of castings for tubes, pipes and hollow profiles and of tube and pipe fittings of cast-steel, under class 24310 (Casting of iron and steel);

- Manufacture of seamless tubes and pipes of steel by centrifugal casting, under class 24310 (Casting of iron and steel);

- Manufacture of fittings of cast-steel, under class 24310 (Casting of iron and steel);

242 - 2420 - 24200: Manufacture of non-ferrous and precious metals

This class includes:

- Production and refining of unwrought or wrought precious metals: gold, silver, platinum, etc. from ore or scrap;

- Production of precious metal alloys;

- Production of precious metal semi-products;

- Production of silver rolled onto base metals;

- Production of gold rolled onto base metals or silver;

- Production of platinum and platinum group’s metals rolled onto gold, silver and base metals;

- Production of aluminum from alumina;

- Production of aluminum from electrolytic refining of aluminum waste and scrap;

- Manufacture of aluminum alloys;

- Semi-manufacturing of aluminum;

- Production of alloys of lead, zinc and tin from ores;

- Production of lead, zinc and tin from electrolytic refining of waste and scrap of lead, zinc and tin;

- Production of alloys of lead, zinc and tin;

- Semi-manufacturing of lead, zinc and tin;

- Production of copper from ores;

- Production of copper from electrolytic refining of copper waste and scrap;

- Manufacture of copper alloys;

- Manufacture of fuse wire;

- Semi-manufacturing of copper;

- Production of chrome, manganese, nickel, etc. from electrolytic and aluminothermic refining of waste and scrap of chrome, manganese, nickel, etc.;

- Production of alloys of chrome, manganese, nickel, etc.

- Semi-manufacturing of chrome, manganese, nickel, etc.

- Production of matters of nickel, etc.

- Production of uranium metal from uraninite and other ores;

- Smelting and refining of uranium;

This group also includes:

- Manufacturing of wire of these metals by drawing;

- Production of aluminum oxide (alumina);

- Production of aluminum wrapped metals;

- Manufacture of aluminum (tin) foil laminates made from aluminum (tin) foil as primary component;

- Manufacture of precious metal foil laminates.

Exclusion:

- Casting of non-ferrous metals, under class 24320 (Casting of non-ferrous metals);

- Manufacture of precious metal jewellery, under class 32110 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

243: Casting of metals

This class includes the manufacture of semi-finished products and various castings according to their technical specifications.

Exclusion:

Manufacture of finished cast products such as:

+ Boilers and radiators, under class 25120 (Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal)

+ Cast household items, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

2431 - 24310: Casting of iron and steel

This class includes:

Activities of iron and steel foundries:

+ Casting of semi-finished iron products,

+ Casting of iron,

+ Manufacture of spheroidal graphite iron castings,

+ Casting of malleable iron,

+ Casting of semi-finished steel products,

+ Casting of steel,

+ Manufacture of tubes, pipes and hollow profiles and tube or pipe fittings of cast-iron,

+ Manufacture of seamless tubes and pipes of steel by centrifugal casting,

+ Manufacture of tubes or pipe fittings of cast-steel.

2432 - 24320: Casting of non-ferrous metals

This class includes:

- Casting of semi-finished products of aluminum, magnesium, titanium, zinc, etc.

- Casting of light metals,

- Casting of heavy metals.

- Casting of precious metals,

- Casting of non-ferrous metals.

25: MANUFACTURE OF FABRICATED METAL PRODUCTS (EXCEPT MACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT)

This division includes the manufacture of pure metal products (such as parts, containers and building structures), usually with a static, immovable function, as opposed to the divisions 26 - 30, which cover Manufacture of combinations or assemblies of such metal products (sometimes with other materials) into more complex units that, unless they are purely electrical, electronic or optical work or moving parts. Manufacture of weapons and ammunition is also included in this division.

251: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators

This group includes the manufacture of structural metal products (such as metal frameworks or parts for construction), as well as metal container-type objects (such as reservoirs, tanks, central heating boilers) and steam generators.

2511 - 25110: Manufacture of structural metal products

This class includes:

- Manufacture of metal frameworks or skeletons for construction and parts thereof (towers, masts, bridges, etc.)

- Manufacture of industrial frameworks in metal (frameworks for blast furnaces, lifting and handling equipment, etc.)

- Manufacture of prefabricated buildings of metal: Site huts and modular exhibition elements, etc.

- Manufacture of metal doors, windows and their frames, shutters and gates;

- Metal room partitions.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of sections of ships or water-powered vessels, under class 25130 (Manufacture of steam generators, except central heating hot water boilers);

- Manufacture of railway track fixtures, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of sections of ships, under class 30110 (Building of ships and floating structures).

2512 - 25120: Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal

This class includes:

- Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and similar containers of metal for storage or manufacturing use.

- Manufacture of metal containers for compressed or liquefied gas;

- Manufacture of central heating boilers and radiators.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of drums, cans, casks, bidons, boxes, etc. of a kind normally used for carrying and packing of goods (regardless of size), under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of transport containers, under class 29200 (Manufacture of bodies for motor vehicles, of trailers and semi-trailers);

- Manufacture of tanks (armored vehicles), under class 30400 (Manufacture of military fighting vehicles).

2513 - 25130: Manufacture of steam generators (except central heating hot water boilers)

This class includes:

- Manufacture of steam generators or other vapor generators;

- Manufacture of auxiliary equipment for use with steam generators: Steam collectors and accumulators, water residue cleaners, economizers and boiler deposit removers;

- Manufacture of nuclear reactors, except isotope separators;

- Manufacture of parts for water-powered ships.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of central heating hot-water boilers and radiators, under class 25120 (Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal);

- Manufacture of boiler-turbine sets, under class 28110 (Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines);

- Manufacture of isotope separators, under class 2829 (Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery);

252 - 2520 - 25200: Manufacture of weapons and ammunition

This class includes:

- Manufacture of heavy weapons (artillery, mobile guns, rocket launchers, torpedoes, heavy machine guns)

- Manufacture of small arms (revolvers, shotguns, light machine guns);

- Manufacture of air or gas guns;

- Manufacture of war ammunition. This class also includes:

- Manufacture of hunting, sporting or protective firearms and ammunition;

- Manufacture of explosive devices such as bombs, mines and torpedoes.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of percussion caps, detonators or signaling flares, under class 20290 (Manufacture of other chemical products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of cutlasses, swords and bayonets, under class 25930 (Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware);

- Manufacture of armored vehicles for the transport of banknotes or valuables, under class 29100 (Manufacture of motor vehicles);

- Manufacture of space vehicles, under class 30300 (Manufacture of aircraft, spacecraft and related machinery);

- Manufacture of tanks and other fighting vehicles, under class 30400 (Manufacture of military fighting vehicles).

259: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities

This group includes general activities for the treatment of metal, such as forging or pressing, plating, coating, polishing, welding, etc., which are typically carried out on a fee or contract basis. This group also includes the manufacture of a variety of metal products, such as cutlery; metal hand tools and general hardware; containers, bottles; metal household articles; metal fixtures; ships anchors; railway track fixtures, etc. for a variety of household and industrial uses.

2591 - 25910: Forging, pressing, stamping and roll-forming of metal; powder metallurgy

This class includes:

- Forging, pressing, stamping and roll-forming of metal;

- Powder metallurgy: production of metal objects directly from metal powders by heat treatment or under pressure.

Exclusion: Production of metal powder, under class 24100 (Production of iron, steel, cast iron) and 24200 (Production of non-ferrous and precious metals).

2592 - 25920: Machining; treatment and coating of metals

This class includes:

- Plating, polishing of metals, etc.

- Heat treatment of metals;

- Sandblasting, tumbling, cleaning of metals;

- Coloring, engraving and printing on metals;

- Non-metallic coating: enameling, lacquering, etc.

- Eroding and buffing of metals;

- Boring, turning, milling, eroding, planing, chiseling, sawing, polishing, welding, splicing, etc. of metalwork pieces;

- Cutting of and writing on metals by means of laser beams.

Exclusion:

- Rolling precious metals onto base metals or other metals, under class 24200 (Manufacture of basic non-ferrous and precious metals);

- Activities of farriers, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services).

2593 - 25930: Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware

This class includes:

- Manufacture of household cutlery such as knives, forks, spoons, etc.

- Manufacture of parts of cutlery: cleavers and choppers, razors and razor blades, scissors and hair clippers

- Manufacture of knives and cutting blades for machines or for related supplies;

- Manufacture of hand tools such as pliers and screwdrivers;

- Manufacture of non-power-driven agricultural hand tools;

- Manufacture of saws and saw blades, including circular saw blades and chainsaw blades;

- Manufacture of non-interchangeable hand tools, whether or not power-operated, or for machine tools: drills, punches, thread cutters, milling cutters;

- Manufacture of press tools;

- Manufacture of blacksmiths’ tools: forges, anvils, etc.

- Manufacture of moulding boxes (except ingot moulds);

- Manufacture of vices and clamps;

- Manufacture of padlocks, locks, keys, hinges, similar items, hardware for buildings, furniture, bicycles, etc.

- Manufacture of cutlasses, swords, bayonets, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of hollowware (pots, kettles, etc.), dinnerware (bowls, platters, etc.) or flatware (saucers, etc.), under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of power-driven hand tools, under class 28180 (Manufacture of motorized or pneumatic hand tools);

- Manufacture of ingot moulds, under class 28230 (Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy);

- Manufacture of cutlery of precious metal, under class 32110 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

2599: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified

25991: Manufacture of metal kitchenware, sanitary ware and dinnerware

This class includes:

- Manufacture of tins and cans for food products, collapsible tubes and boxes;

- Manufacture of metal household articles: flatware (e.g. saucers, etc.), hollowware (e.g. pots, kettles, etc.), dinnerware (e.g. bowls, platters, etc.), saucepans, frying pans and other non-electrical utensils for use at the table or in the kitchen, small hand-operated appliances and metal scouring pads;

- Manufacture of baths, washbasins and similar articles.

25999: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Manufacture of metal goods for office use, except furniture;

- Manufacture of safety doors, safes, armored doors, etc.

- Manufacture of bags for storage of jewellery;

- Manufacture of pails, cans, drums, buckets, boxes;

- Manufacture of metal boxes for food products, collapsible tubes and boxes;

- Manufacture of screw machine products;

- Manufacture of motion driving parts (except watch’s motion parts): spiral parts, torsion bar, leaves;

- Manufacture of metal cable, plaited bands and similar articles;

- Manufacture of metal cable, un-insulated or insulated against electricity;

- Manufacture of articles made of wire: barbed wire, wire fencing, grill, netting, cloth, etc.

- Manufacture of nails and pins;

- Manufacture of rivets, washers and similar non-threaded products;

- Manufacture of screw products

- Manufacture of bolts, screws and similar threaded products;

- Manufacture of springs (except watch springs): Leaf springs, helical springs, spiral springs, leaves for springs;

- Manufacture of chains, except power transmission chain;

- Manufacture of various metal articles:

+ Ship propellers and blades thereof,

+ Anchors,

+ Bells,

+ Railway tracks,

+ Clasps, buckles, hinges.

- Manufacture of permanent metallic magnets;

- Manufacture of metal vacuum jugs;

- Manufacture of metal badges and metal military insignia;

- Manufacture of metal hair curlers, metal umbrella handles, combs.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of tanks and reservoirs, under class 25120 (Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal);

- Manufacture of swords, under class 25930 (Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware);

- Manufacture of clock and watch springs, under class 26520 (Manufacture of watches and clocks);

- Manufacture of wire and cable for electricity transmission, under class 27320 (Manufacture of other electronic and electric wires and cables);

- Manufacture of power transmission chain, under class 28140 (Manufacture of bearings, gears, gearing and driving elements);

- Manufacture of shopping carts for use in supermarkets, under class 30990 (Manufacture of other transport equipment not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of metal furniture, under class 31009 (Manufacture of furniture of other materials);

- Manufacture of sports goods, under class 32300 (Manufacture of sports goods);

- Manufacture of games and toys, under class 32400 (Manufacture of games and toys);

26: MANUFACTURE OF COMPUTER, ELECTRONIC AND OPTICAL PRODUCTS

This division includes the manufacture of computers, computer peripherals, communications equipment, and similar electronic products, as well as the manufacture of components for such products.

Production processes of this division are characterized by the design and use of integrated circuits and the application of highly specialized technologies.

This division also includes:

Manufacture of consumer electronics, measuring, testing, and control equipment, irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment, optical instruments and equipment, and Manufacture of magnetic and optical media.

261 - 2610 - 26100: Manufacture of electronic components

This class includes the manufacture of semiconductors and other components for electronic applications.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of electronic capacitors;

- Manufacture of electronic resistors;

- Manufacture of microprocessors;

- Manufacture of bare printed circuit boards;

- Manufacture of electron tubes;

- Manufacture of electronic connectors;

- Manufacture of integrated circuits;

- Manufacture of diodes, transistors and related discrete devices;

- Manufacture of inductors (e.g. chokes, coils, transformers), electronic component type;

- Manufacture of electronic crystals and crystal assemblies;

- Manufacture of solenoids, switches and transducers for electronic applications;

- Manufacture of semiconducting dices, finished or semi-finished;

- Manufacture of interface cards (e.g. sound, video, controllers, network);

- Manufacture of display components (plasma, polymer, LCD);

- Manufacture of light emitting diodes (LED);

- Manufacture of printer cables, monitor cables, USB cables, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of smart cards, under class 18110 (Printing);

- Manufacture of modems (carrier equipment), under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);
