- Manufacture of computer and television displays, under class 26200 (Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment) and 26400 (Manufacture of consumer electronics);

- Manufacture of X-ray tubes and similar irradiation devices, under class 26600 (Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment);

- Manufacture of optical equipment and instruments, under class 26700 (Manufacture of optical instruments and equipment);

- Manufacture of splitters of a kind for electronic applications, under division 27 (Manufacture of electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of lighting ballasts, under class 27101 (Manufacture of motors and generators);

- Manufacture of electrical relays, under class 27101 (Manufacture of motors and generators);

- Manufacture of electrical wiring devices, under class 27330 (Manufacture of wiring devices);

- Manufacture of complete equipment classified elsewhere according to the classification of electronics.

262 - 2620 - 26200: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment

This class includes:

Manufacture and/or assembly of electronic computers, such as displays, desktop computers, computer servers and laptops; and computer peripheral equipment, such as storage devices and input/output devices (printers, monitors, keyboards). Computers can be analog, digital or hybrid. The most common type of digital computers includes devices capable of handling the following tasks: (1) store the processing program or programs and the data immediately necessary for the execution of the program, (2) can be freely programmed in accordance with the requirements of the user, (3) perform arithmetical computations specified by the user and (4) execute, without human intervention, a processing program that requires the computer to modify its execution by logical decision during the processing run. Analog computers are capable of simulating mathematical models and comprise at least analog control and programming elements.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of desktop computers;

- Manufacture of laptop computers;

- Manufacture of computer servers;

- Manufacture hand-held computers (e.g. PDA);

- Manufacture of magnetic disk drives, flash drives and other storage devices;

- Manufacture of optical disk drives (e.g. CD-RW, CD-ROM, DVD-ROM, DVD-RW);

- Manufacture of printers;

- Manufacture of monitors;

- Manufacture of keyboards;

- Manufacture of mice, joysticks and track devices;

- Manufacture of computer interfaces;

- Manufacture of scanners, including bar code scanners;

- Manufacture of smart card readers;

- Manufacture of virtual reality helmets;

- Manufacture of computer projectors.

This class also includes:

- Manufacture of computer terminals such as automatic teller machines (ATM), point-of-sale (POS) terminals, not mechanically operated;  

- Manufacture of multi-function office equipment, such as fax-scanner-copier combinations.

Exclusion:

- Reproduction of recorded media, under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media);

- Manufacture of electronic components and electronic assemblies used in computers and peripherals, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of internal/external computer modems, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of interface cards, modules and assemblies, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of modems and carrier equipment, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of digital communication devices, data communications equipment (e.g. bridges, gateways), under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of consumer electronic devices, such as CD players and DVD players, under class 26400 (Manufacture of consumer electronics);

- Manufacture of television monitors and displays, under class 26400 (Manufacture of consumer electronics);

- Manufacture of video game consoles, under class 26400 (Manufacture of consumer electronics);

- Manufacture of optical and magnetic media for use with computers or other devices, under class 26800 (Manufacture of magnetic and optical media).

263 - 2630 - 26300: Manufacture of communication equipment

This class includes:

- Manufacture of telephone and data communications equipment used to convey signals electronically over wires or through the air such as radio and television broadcast and wireless communications equipment.

- Manufacture of central office switching equipment;

- Manufacture of cordless telephones;

- Manufacture of private branch exchange (PBX) equipment;

- Manufacture of telephone and facsimile equipment, including telephone answering machines;

- Manufacture of data communications equipment, such as bridges, routers and gateways;

- Manufacture of transmitting and receiving antenna;

- Manufacture cable television equipment;

- Manufacture of pagers;

- Manufacture of cellular phones;

- Manufacture of mobile communication equipment;

- Manufacture of radio and television studio equipment, including television cameras;

- Manufacture of modems and carrier equipment;

- Manufacture of burglar alarm and alert lighting systems, which send signals to a control station;

- Manufacture of radio and television transmitters;

- Manufacture of infrared devices (e.g. remote controls).

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of computers and computer peripheral equipment, under class 26200 (Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment);

- Manufacture of consumer audio and video equipment, under class 26400 (Manufacture of consumer electronics);

- Manufacture of electronic components and sub-assemblies used in communications equipment, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of internal/external computer modems (for personal computer), under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of electronic scoreboards, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of traffic lights, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

264 - 2640 - 26400: Manufacture of consumer electronics

This class includes:

- Manufacture of electronic audio and video equipment for home entertainment, motor vehicle, public address system and sound amplification;

- Manufacture of video recorders and duplicating equipment;

- Manufacture of televisions;

- Manufacture of television monitors and displays;

- Manufacture of audio recording and duplicating systems;

- Manufacture of stereo equipment;

- Manufacture of radio receivers;

- Manufacture of speaker systems;

- Manufacture of household-type video cameras;

- Manufacture of jukeboxes;

- Manufacture of amplifiers for musical instruments and public address systems;

- Manufacture of microphones;

- Manufacture of CD and DVD players;

- Manufacture of karaoke machines;

- Manufacture of headphones (e.g. radio, stereo, computer);

- Manufacture of video game consoles.

Exclusion:

- Reproduction of recorded media (computer media, sound, video, etc.), under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media); - Manufacture of computer peripheral devices and computer monitors, under class 26200 (Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment);

- Manufacture of telephone answering machines, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of paging equipment, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of remote control devices (radio and infrared), under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of cameras and other audio broadcast devices, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of audio recording equipment such as reproduction equipment, transmitting and receiving antennas, commercial video cameras, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of electronic games with fixed software, under class 32400 (Manufacture of games and toys);

265: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; manufacture of watches and clocks

This group includes the manufacture of testing, navigating and control equipment and systems for various industrial and non-industrial purposes, including time-based measuring devices such as tabletop clocks and wall clocks and related devices.

2651 - 26510: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment

This class includes the manufacture of search, exploration, navigation, aeronautical and nautical systems and instruments; automatic controls and regulators for applications, such as heating, air-conditioning, refrigeration and appliances; instruments and devices for measuring, displaying, recording, transmitting and controlling industrial process variables, such as temperature, humidity, pressure, vacuum, combustion, flow, level, viscosity, density, acidity, concentration and rotation; totalizing (i.e. metering) combustion meters and computing devices; instruments for measuring and testing the characteristics of electricity and electronic signals; instruments and instrumentation systems for laboratory analysis of the chemical or physical composition or concentration of samples of solid, fluid, gaseous or composite material and other measuring and testing instruments and parts thereof.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of aircraft engine instruments;

- Manufacture of automotive emissions testing equipment;

- Manufacture of meteorological instruments;

- Manufacture of physical properties testing and inspection equipment;

- Manufacture of polygraph machines;

- Manufacture of instruments for measuring and testing electricity and electronic signals (including those for telecommunications);

- Manufacture of radiation detection and monitoring instruments;

- Manufacture of surveying instruments;

- Manufacture of thermometers liquid-in-glass and bimetal types (except medical ones);

- Manufacture of humidistats;

- Manufacture of hydronic limit controls;

- Manufacture of flame and heat controls;

- Manufacture of spectrometers;

- Manufacture of pneumatic gauges;

- Manufacture of consumption meters (e.g. water, gas);

- Manufacture of flow meters and counting devices;

- Manufacture of tally counters;

- Manufacture of ore detectors, pulse sensors, metal detectors;

- Manufacture of aircraft recorders, testing, measuring and navigation equipment, aeronautical and nautical equipment, including sonobuoys;

- Manufacture of GPS devices;

- Manufacture of environmental controls and automatic controls;

- Manufacture of measuring and recording equipment (e.g. light measurement);

- Manufacture of motion detectors;

- Manufacture of laboratory analytical instruments (e.g. blood analysis equipment);

- Manufacture of laboratory distillation equipment, centrifugal and ultrasound devices;

- Manufacture of laboratory scales, balances, incubators;

- Manufacture of other measuring devices such as radiation detectors, other detectors, humidistats, meteorological instrumentation;

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of telephone answering machines, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of medical examination equipment, under class 26600 (Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment)

- Manufacture of optical positioning devices, under class 26700 (Manufacture of optical instruments and equipment);

- Manufacture of dictating machines, under class 28170 (Manufacture of office machinery and equipment, except computers and peripheral equipment);

- Manufacture of simple mechanical apparatus for measuring (e.g. tapes, compasses) is classified according to their primary constituent materials;

- Manufacture of industrial process control equipment, under class 33200 (Installation of industrial machinery and equipment).

2652 - 26520: Manufacture of watches and clocks

This class includes:

- Manufacture of watches, clocks and timing mechanisms and parts thereof;

- Manufacture of watches and clocks, including instrument panel clocks;

- Manufacture of watch and clock cases, including cases of precious metals;

- Manufacture of time-recording equipment and devices for measuring or displaying intervals of time with a watch or clock movement or with synchronous motor, such as:

+ Parking meters,

+ Time clocks,

+ Time/date stamps,

+ Process timers.

- Manufacture of time switches and other releases with a watch or clock movement or with synchronous motor: time locks;

- Manufacture of components for clocks and watches:

+ Hands of various kinds for watches and clocks,

+ Springs, dials, plates, bridges and other parts,

+ Covers of all materials for watches and clocks.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of non-metal watch bands (textile, leather, plastic), under class 15120 (Manufacture of luggage, handbags and similar articles; manufacture of saddle and harness);

- Manufacture of watch bands of precious metals, under class 32110 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

- Manufacture of watch bands of non-precious metals, under class 32120 (Manufacture of jewellery and related articles);

266 - 2660 - 26600: Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment

This class includes:

Manufacture of electromechanical and electrotherapeutic machinery such as magnetic resonance equipment, medical ultrasound equipment, electrocardiographs, electromechanical endoscopic equipment, irradiation apparatus and tubes (e.g. medical diagnosis, medical therapy, industrial use, research and scientific purpose); Beta-, gamma, X-ray and other ionizing radiation equipment.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of irradiation apparatus and tubes (e.g. industrial, medical diagnostic, medical therapeutic, research and scientific);

- Manufacture of X-ray equipment;

- Manufacture of CT scanners;

- Manufacture of PET scanners;

- Manufacture of MRI equipment;

- Manufacture of medical laser equipment;

- Manufacture of medical endoscopic equipment;

- Manufacture of food and milk irradiation equipment.

Exclusion: Manufacture of tanning beds, under class 2829 (Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery);

267 - 2670 - 26700: Manufacture of optical instruments and equipment

This class includes:

Manufacture of optical instruments and lenses, such as binoculars, microscopes (except electron, proton), telescopes, prisms and lenses; the coating or polishing of lenses (except ophthalmic); the mounting of lenses (except ophthalmic) and Manufacture of photographic equipment such as cameras and light meters.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of optical mirrors;

- Manufacture of optical gun sighting equipment;

- Manufacture of optical positioning equipment;

- Manufacture of optical magnifying instruments;

- Manufacture of optical precision tools;

- Manufacture of optical comparators;

- Manufacture of optical and digital cameras;

- Manufacture of motion picture and slide projectors;

- Manufacture of transparency projectors;

- Manufacture of optical measuring and checking devices and instruments (e.g. fire control equipment, photographic light meters, range finders);

- Manufacture of lenses, optical microscopes, binoculars and telescopes;

- Manufacture of laser assemblies.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of computer projectors, under class 26200 (Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment);

- Manufacture of commercial television and video cameras, under class 26300 (Manufacture of communication equipment);

- Manufacture of household-type video cameras, under class 26400 (Manufacture of household electronics);

- Manufacture of complete equipment using laser components, under class 26600 (Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment)

- Manufacture of photocopy machinery, under class 28170 (Manufacture of office machinery and equipment, except computers and peripheral equipment);

- Manufacture of ophthalmic goods, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

268 - 2680 - 26800: Manufacture of magnetic and optical media

This class includes the manufacture of magnetic and optical recording media, such as blank magnetic audio and video cassettes, blank diskettes, blank optical discs and high-speed communication equipment, etc.

Exclusion: Reproduction of recorded media (digital communication, sound, video, etc.), under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media).

27: MANUFACTURE OF ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT

This division includes the manufacture of products that generate, distribute and use electric power. This division also includes the manufacture of electrical lighting, signaling equipment and household appliances.

Exclusion: Manufacture of electronic products, under division 26 (Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products).

271 - 2710: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus

This group includes the manufacture of power, distribution and specialty transformers; electric power generator sets and concentrators; switchgear and switchboard apparatus; relays and industrial controls. The electrical equipment manufactured in this class is arranged by level of resistance.

27101: Manufacture of motors and generators

This class includes:

- Manufacture of electric distribution transformers;

- Manufacture of arc-welding transformers;

- Manufacture of fluorescent ballasts (i.e. transformers);

- Manufacture of power generators (except internal combustion engine starting motors);

- Manufacture of power generators (except battery charging alternators for internal combustion engines);

- Manufacture of generator sets (except turbine generator set units).

27102: Manufacture of electric transformers, electricity distribution and control apparatus

This class includes:

- Manufacture of substation transformers for electric power distribution;

- Manufacture of transmission and distribution regulators;

- Manufacture of power distribution control panels;

- Manufacture of power circuit breakers;

- Manufacture of control panels for distribution of electric power;

- Manufacture of duct for electromechanical switchboard apparatus;

- Manufacture of electric fuses;

- Manufacture of power switching equipment;

- Manufacture of electric power switches (except push button, snap, solenoid, tumbler);

- Manufacture of prime mover generator sets;

- Rewinding of armatures on a factory basis.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of electrical component-type transformers and switches, under 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of environmental controls and industrial process control instruments, under class 26510 (Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment);

- Manufacture of switches for electrical circuits, such as push button and snap switches, under class 27330 (Manufacture of wiring devices);

- Manufacture of electric welding and soldering equipment, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of electric converters and current alternators, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of turbine generators, under class 28110 (Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines);

- Manufacture of starting motors and generators for internal combustion engines, under class 29300 (Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles and automotive engines).

272 - 2720 - 27200: Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

This class includes the manufacture of rechargeable and non-rechargeable batteries. This class includes:

- Manufacture of cells and batteries: cells containing manganese dioxide, mercuric dioxide, silver oxide, etc.

- Manufacture of electric accumulators, including parts thereof: separators, containers, covers;

- Manufacture of lead acid batteries;

- Manufacture of NiCad batteries;

- Manufacture of NiMH batteries;

- Manufacture of lithium batteries;

- Manufacture of dry cell batteries;

- Manufacture of wet cell batteries.

273: Manufacture of wiring and wiring devices

This group includes the manufacture of current-carrying wiring devices and non current-carrying wiring devices for wiring electrical circuits regardless of material.

This group also includes the manufacture of electrically insulated wire and fiber optic cables.

2731 - 27310: Manufacture of fiber optic cables

This class includes the manufacture of fiber optic cable for data transmission or live transmission of images.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of glass fibers, under class 23100 (Manufacture of glass and glass products).

- Manufacture of optical cable sets with connectors or other attachments, subject to their applications, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components).

2732 - 27320: Manufacture of other electronic and electric wires and cables

This class includes the manufacture of insulated wire and cable, made of steel, copper or aluminum. Exclusion:

- Manufacture (drawing) of wire, under class 24100 (Production of iron, steel, cast iron) and class 24200 (Production of non-precious and precious metals).

- Manufacture of computer cables, printer cables, USB cables and similar cable sets, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of cable sets, wiring covers and similar cable sets or assemblies for automotive applications, under class 29300 (Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles and automotive engines).

2733 - 27330: Manufacture of wiring devices

This class includes:

- Manufacture of current-carrying and non current-carrying wiring devices regardless of material.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of bus bars, electrical conductors (except switchgear-type);

- Manufacture of GFCI (ground fault circuit interrupters);

- Manufacture of lamp holders;

- Manufacture of lightning arrestors and coils;

- Manufacture of circuit breakers for electrical wiring (e.g. pressure, push button, tumbler);

- Manufacture of electrical sockets and current-carrying wiring;

- Manufacture of boxes for electric wiring (e.g. junction, switch boxes);

- Manufacture of electrical cables and equipment;

- Manufacture of electrical conduit and fitting;

- Manufacture of transmission pole and line hardware;

- Manufacture of plastic non current-carrying wiring devices including plastic cables, junction boxes, face plates, plastic pole line fittings and similar devices.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of glass and ceramic insulators, under class 23930 (Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products);

- Manufacture of electrical connectors, lamp holders and switches, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

274 - 2740 - 27400: Manufacture of electric lighting equipment

This class includes:

Manufacture of electric light bulbs and tubes and parts and components thereof (except glass blanks for electric light tubes), electric lighting fixtures (except electric vehicles); non-electric lighting equipment; lamp shades (except those made of glass and plastic); lighting fixture components (except current-carrying wiring devices). Manufacture of non-electric lighting equipment is also classified here.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of discharge, incandescent, fluorescent, ultra-violet, infrared lamps, other types of lamps, fixtures and bulbs;

- Manufacture of ceiling lighting fixtures;

- Manufacture of chandeliers;

- Manufacture of table lamps (i.e. lighting fixtures);

- Manufacture of Christmas tree lighting sets;

- Manufacture of electric fireplaces;

- Manufacture of flashlights;

- Manufacture of electric insect lamps;

- Manufacture of lanterns (e.g. carbide, electric, gas, kerosene);

- Manufacture of lighting equipment for means of transport (except vehicles);

- Manufacture of street lighting fixtures (except traffic signals);

- Manufacture of lighting equipment for vehicles (e.g. motor vehicles, aircraft, boat).

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of glassware and glass parts for lighting fixtures, under class 23100 (Manufacture of glass and glass products);

- Manufacture of current-carrying wiring devices for fighting fixtures, under class 27330 (Manufacture of wiring devices);

- Manufacture of ceiling fans or bath fans with integrated lighting fixtures, under class 27500 (Manufacture of household appliances);

- Manufacture of electrical signaling equipment such as traffic lights and pedestrian signaling equipment, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electric equipment).

275 - 2750 - 27500: Manufacture of household appliances

This class includes the manufacture of small electric appliances and electric housewares, household-type vacuum cleaners, household-type fans, household-type washing machines, electric household-type floor care machines, household-type cooking appliances, household-type refrigerators, freezers, other electric and non-electric household appliances, such as dishwashers, water heaters and garbage disposal units. This class includes the manufacture of appliances with electric, gas or other fuel sources.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of electric household appliances: Refrigerators, freezers, dishwashers and drying machines, vacuum cleaners, floor polishers, waste disposers, blinders, grinders, juice squeezers, tin openers, electric shavers, electric toothbrushes and other electric personal care device, knife sharpeners, exhaust fans and exhaust hoods;

- Manufacture of electrothermic household appliances: electric water heaters, electric blankets, dryers, combs, brushes, electric curlers, electric smoothing irons, space heaters and household-type fans, electric ovens, microwave ovens, electric hotplates, toasters, coffee makers, fry pans, roasters, grills, steamers, heating resistors, etc.

- Manufacture of non-electric cooking and heating equipment:

+ Non-electric space heaters, grates, stoves, water heaters, cooking appliances, plate dryers.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of commercial and industrial refrigerators and freezers, room air-conditioners, attic fans, permanent-mounted space heaters and commercial ventilation and exhaust fans, commercial-type cooking equipment; commercial-type laundry, dry-cleaning equipment; commercial, industrial and office vacuum cleaners, under division 28 (Manufacture of machinery and equipment not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of household-type sewing machines, under class 28260 (Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production);

- Installation of central vacuum cleaning systems, under class 43290 (Other construction installation).

279 - 2790 - 27900: Manufacture of other electric equipment

This class includes:

Manufacture of miscellaneous electrical equipment other than generators, motors or transformers, batteries, accumulators, wires, wiring devices, lighting equipment or household appliances.

This class includes:

- Manufacture of solid-state battery chargers;

- Manufacture of electric-powered door-opening and door-closing devices;

- Manufacture of electric bells;

- Manufacture of insulated extension cords;

- Manufacture of ultrasonic cleaning machines (except those for laboratory and dentistry);

- Manufacture of solid-state inverters, rectifying apparatus, fuel cells, regulated and unregulated uninterruptible power supplies;

- Manufacture of uninterruptible power supplies (UPS);

- Manufacture of surge suppressors;

- Manufacture of appliance cords, extension cords and other electrical cord sets with insulated wire and connectors;

- Manufacture of carbon and graphite electrodes, contacts, and other electrical carbon and graphite products;

- Manufacture of particle accelerators;

- Manufacture of electrical capacitors, resistors, accelerators and similar devices;

- Manufacture of hand-held soldering irons;

- Manufacture of electromagnets;

- Manufacture of sirens;

- Manufacture of electronic scoreboards;

- Manufacture of electrical signaling equipment such as traffic lights and pedestrian signaling equipment;

- Manufacture of electrical insulators (except those made of glass or porcelain), basic metal cables;

- Manufacture of electrical equipment and components for use in internal combustion engines;

- Manufacture of electrical welding and soldering equipment, including hand-held steel soldering equipment.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of porcelain electrical insulators, under class 23930 (Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products);

- Production of carbon and graphite fibers and products, under class 23990 (Manufacture of other chemical products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of electrical component-type rectifiers, voltage regulating circuits, power converting circuits, capacitors, resistors and similar devices, under class 26100 (Manufacture of electronic components);

- Manufacture of transformers, motors, switchgear, relays and industrial controls, under class 2710 (Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus);

- Manufacture of batteries, under class 27200 (Manufacture of batteries and accumulators);

- Manufacture of communication and energy wire, current-carrying and non current-carrying wiring, under class 27330 (Manufacture of wiring devices);

- Manufacture of lighting equipment, under class 27400 (Manufacture of electric lighting equipment);

- Manufacture of household-type appliances, under class 27500 (Manufacture of household appliances);

- Manufacture of non-electric welding and soldering equipment, under class 28190 (Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery);

- Manufacture of carbon and graphite pads, under class 28190 (Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery);

- Manufacture of motor vehicles’ electrical equipment, such as generators, alternators, spark plugs, electric-powered window and door systems, voltage regulators, under class 29300 (Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles and automotive engines);

- Manufacture of mechanical and electromechanical signaling, safety and traffic control equipment for railways, tramways, waterways, roads, parking facilities, airfields, under class 30200 (Manufacture of railway locomotives, trams and rail cars).

28: MANUFACTURE OF MACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT NOT ELSEWHERE CLASSIFIED

This division includes the manufacture of machinery and equipment that act independently on materials either mechanically or thermally or perform operations on materials (such as weighing or packing), including their mechanical components that produce and apply force, and any specially manufactured primary parts. This includes the manufacture of fixed and mobile or hand-held devices, whether they are designed for industrial, building and civil engineering, agricultural or home use. The manufacture of special equipment for passenger or freight transport in related areas also belongs within this division.

This division also includes:

- Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery, not covered elsewhere in the classification, whether or not used in a manufacturing process, such as fairground amusement equipment, automatic bowling alley equipment, etc.

- Manufacture of metal products for general use (division 25), associated control devices, computer equipment, measurement and testing equipment, electricity distribution and control apparatus (divisions 26 and 27) and general-purpose motor vehicles (divisions 29 and 30).

281: Manufacture of general-purpose machinery

This group includes the manufacture of general-purpose machinery, i.e. machinery that is being used in a wide range of VSIC industries. This can include the manufacture of components used in the manufacture of a variety of other machinery or the manufacture of machinery that support the operation of other businesses.

2811 - 28110: Manufacture of engines and turbines (except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines)

This class includes:

- Manufacture of internal combustion piston engines, except motor vehicle, aircraft and cycle propulsion engines:

+ Hydraulic engines,

+ Railway engines.

- Manufacture of pistons, piston rings, carburetors and such for all internal combustion engines, diesel engines;

- Manufacture of inlet and exhaust valves of internal combustion engines;

- Manufacture of turbines and parts thereof:

+ Steam turbines and other vapor turbines,

+ Hydraulic turbines, waterwheels and relevant regulators,

+ Wind turbines,

+ Gas turbines, except turbojets or turbo propellers for aircraft propulsion,

+ Manufacture of boiler-turbine sets,

+ Manufacture of turbine-generator sets.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of electric generator sets, under class 2710 (Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus);

- Manufacture of prime mover generator sets (except turbine generator sets), under class 2710 (Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus);

- Manufacture of electric equipment and components of internal combustion engines, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of cycle propulsion engines for motor vehicle or aircraft, under class 29100 (Manufacture of motor vehicles), class 30300 (Manufacture of aircraft, space craft and related machinery), class 30910 (Manufacture of motorcycles);

- Manufacture of turbojets and turbo propellers, under class 30300 (Manufacture of aircraft, spacecraft and related machinery);

2812 - 28120: Manufacture of fluid power equipment

This class includes:

- Manufacture of hydraulic and pneumatic components (including hydraulic pumps, hydraulic motors, hydraulic cylinders, hydraulic and pneumatic valves, hydraulic and pneumatic hose and fittings);

- Manufacture of air preparation equipment for use in pneumatic systems;

- Manufacture of combustible energy systems;

- Manufacture of hydraulic transmission equipment.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of compressors, under class 28130 (Manufacture of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves);

- Manufacture of pumps and valves for non-hydraulic applications, under class 28130 (Manufacture of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves);

- Manufacture of mechanical transmission equipment, under class 28140 (Manufacture of bearings, gears, gearing and driving elements);

2813 - 28130: Manufacture of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves

This class includes:

- Manufacture of air or vacuum pumps, air or gas compressors;

- Manufacture of pumps for liquids whether or not fitted with a measuring device;

- Manufacture of pumps designed for fitting to internal combustion engines: oil, water or fuel pumps for motor vehicles, etc.

This class also includes:

- Manufacture of industrial taps and valves, including regulating valves and intake taps;

- Manufacture of sanitary taps and valves;

- Manufacture of heating taps and valves;

- Manufacture of hand pumps;

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of valves of vulcanized rubber, glass or of ceramic materials, under class 22120 (Manufacture of other rubber products), class 23100 (Manufacture of glass and glass products) or class 23930 (Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products);

- Manufacture of hydraulic transmission equipment, under class 28120 (Manufacture of fluid power equipment);

- Manufacture of inlet valves of internal combustion engines, under class 28110 (Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines);

2814 - 28140: Manufacture of bearings, gears, gearing and driving elements

This class includes:

- Manufacture of balls, ball bearings and parts thereof;

- Manufacture of mechanical power transmission equipment:

+ Transmission shafts and cranks: camshafts, crankshafts, cranks, etc.

+ Plain bearings and friction-driving toothed wheels.

- Manufacture of gears, gearing and gear boxes and other speed changers;

- Manufacture of clutches and shaft couplings;

- Manufacture of flywheels and pulleys;

- Manufacture of articulated link chain;

- Manufacture of power transmission chain.

Exclusion:

- Production of other chains, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

- Manufacture of (electromagnetic) clutches, under class 29300 (Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles and automotive engines);

- Manufacture of sub-assemblies of power transmission equipment identifiable as parts of vehicles or aircraft, under division 29 (Manufacture of motor vehicles) and division 30 (Manufacture of other transport equipment).

2815 - 28150: Manufacture ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

This class includes:

- Manufacture of electrical and industrial and laboratory furnaces and ovens, including incinerators;

- Manufacture of burners;

- Manufacture of permanent-mounted electric cooking ranges, electric swimming pool heaters, non-electric household cooking equipment, such as solar heating, steam heating, oil heat and similar furnaces;

- Manufacture of electric household-type furnaces (electric forced air furnaces, heat pumps, etc.), non-electric forced air furnaces;

This class also includes the manufacture of mechanical stokers, heaters, dischargers, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of household ovens, under class 27500 (Manufacture of household appliances);

- Manufacture of agricultural dryers, under class 28250 (Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing);

- Manufacture of bakery ovens, under class 28250 (Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing);

- Manufacture of dryers for wood, paper pulp, paper or paperboard, under class 2829 (Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery);

- Manufacture of medical instruments, surgical appliances or sterilizers and laboratory apparatus, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

- Laboratory furnaces (in dentistry), under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies);

2816 - 28160: Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment

This class includes:

- Manufacture of hand-operated or power-driven lifting, handling, loading or unloading machinery:

+ Pulley, winches, capstans,

+ Derricks, cranes, mobile lifting frames, etc.

+ Works trucks, whether or not fitted with lifting or handling equipment, whether or not self-propelled, of the type used in factories,

+ Mechanical manipulators and industrial robots specifically designed for lifting, loading or unloading.

- Manufacture of conveyors, etc.

- Manufacture of lifts, escalators and moving walkways;

- Manufacture of parts specialized for lifting and handling equipment.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of continuous-action elevators and conveyors for underground use, under class 28240 (Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction);

- Manufacture of mechanical shovels and excavators, under class 28240 (Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction);

- Manufacture of industrial robots for multiple uses, under class 2829 (Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery);

- Manufacture of floating cranes, railway cranes, crane-lorries, under class 30110 (Building of ships and floating structures) and class 30200 (Manufacture of railway locomotives, trams and rail cars);

- Installation of lifts and elevators,  under class 43290 (Other construction installation).

2817 - 28170: Manufacture of office machinery and equipment (except computers and peripheral equipment)

This class includes:

- Manufacture of mechanical calculators;  

- Manufacture of adding machines, cash registers;

- Manufacture of electronic or non-electronic calculators;

- Manufacture of postage meters, mail handling machines (envelope stuffing, sealing and addressing machinery; opening, sorting), supporting machinery;

- Manufacture of collating machinery;

- Manufacture of typewriters;

- Manufacture of stenography machines;

- Manufacture of office-type binding equipment (i.e. plastic or tape binding);

- Manufacture of cheque writing machines;

- Manufacture of coin counting and coin wrapping machinery;

- Manufacture of pencil sharpeners;

- Manufacture of staplers and staple removers;

- Manufacture of voting machines;

- Manufacture of hole punchers;

- Manufacture of mechanically-operated vending machines;

- Manufacture of mechanically-operated cash registers;

- Manufacture of photocopy machines;

- Manufacture of disc players;

- Manufacture of blackboards, white boards and marker boards;

- Manufacture of dictating machines.

Exclusion: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment, under class 26200 (Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment);

2818 - 28180: Manufacture of power-driven or pneumatic hand tools

This class includes:

Manufacture of hand tools with self-contained electric or non-electric motor or hydraulic drive, such as:

+ Circular or reciprocating saws,

+ Drills and hammer drills,

+ Hand-held electric sanders,

+ Pneumatic nailers,

+ Buffers,

+ Routers,

+ Grinders,

+ Staplers,

+ Hydraulic rivet guns,

+ Planers,

+ Shears,

+ Impact wrenches,

+ Power-actuated nailers.

2819 - 28190: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery

This class includes:

- Manufacture of industrial refrigerating or freezing equipment, including assemblies of major components;

- Manufacture of air-conditioning machines, including those for motor vehicles;

- Manufacture of non-household fans;

- Manufacture of household-type weighing machinery: Luggage scales, weighbridges, other weights, etc.

- Manufacture of filtering and purifying machinery and apparatus for liquefaction;

- Manufacture of equipment for projecting or dispersing liquids or powders: Spray guns, fire extinguishers, sandblasting machines, steam cleaning machines, etc.

- Manufacture of packing and wrapping machinery: Filling, closing, sealing, wrapping and labeling machines, etc.

- Manufacture of machinery for cleaning or drying bottles for production of beverages;

- Manufacture of distilling and rectifying equipment for petroleum refineries, chemical industries and beverage industries;

- Manufacture of heat exchangers;

- Manufacture of machinery for liquefying air and gas;

- Manufacture of gas generators;

- Manufacture of calendering or rolling machines and cylinders thereof (except those used for metal and glass);

- Manufacture of centrifuges (except cream separators and clothes dryers);

- Manufacture of gaskets and similar joints made of a combination of materials or layers of the same material;

- Manufacture of automatic vending machines;

- Manufacture of parts for general-purpose machinery;

- Manufacture of ventilation fans (gable fans, roof ventilators);

- Manufacture of measures, similar hand tools, machinists’ precision tools (except optical ones);

- Manufacture of non-electrical welding and soldering equipment.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of sensitive laboratory-type balances, under class 26510 (Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment);

- Manufacture of household-type refrigerating or freezing equipment, under class 27500 (Manufacture of household appliances);

- Manufacture of household-type fans, under class 27500 (Manufacture of household appliances);

- Manufacture of electric welding and soldering equipment, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of agricultural spraying machinery, under class 28210 (Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery);

- Manufacture of metal or glass rolling machinery and parts thereof, under class 28230 (Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy) and class 2829 (Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery);

- Manufacture of agricultural dryers or machinery for filtering or purifying food, under class 28250 (Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing);

- Manufacture of cream separators, under class 28250 (Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing);

- Manufacture of commercial clothes dryers, under class 28260 (Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production);

- Manufacture of textile printing machinery, under class 28260 (Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production);

282: Manufacture of special-purpose machinery

This group includes the manufacture of special-purpose machinery, i.e. machinery for exclusive use in a division or a small cluster of groups in a division in the standard industrial classification system. While most of these are used in other manufacturing processes, such as food manufacturing or textile manufacturing, this group also includes the manufacture of machinery specific for other (non-manufacturing industries), such as aircraft launching gear or amusement park equipment.

2821 - 28210: Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery

This class includes:

- Manufacture of tractors used in agriculture and forestry;

- Manufacture of walking (pedestrian-controlled) tractors;

- Manufacture of mowers and lawnmowers;

- Manufacture of agricultural self-loading or self-unloading trailers or semi-trailers;

- Manufacture of agricultural machinery for planting or fertilizing: Ploughs, manure spreaders, seeders, harrows, etc.

- Manufacture of harvesting or threshing machinery: Harvesters, threshers, sorters, etc.

- Manufacture of milking machines;

- Manufacture of spraying machinery for agricultural use;

- Manufacture of diverse agricultural machinery: Poultry-keeping machinery, bee-keeping machinery, equipment for preparing fodder, etc. Manufacture of machines for cleaning and sorting eggs, fruit, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of non-electric agricultural hand tools, under class 25930 (Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware);

- Manufacture of conveyors for farm use, under class 28160 (Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment);

- Manufacture of power-driven hand tools, under class 28180 (Manufacture of power-driven hand tools)

- Manufacture of cream separators, under class 28250 (Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing);

- Manufacture of machinery for cleaning and sorting grain, rice or dried leguminous vegetables, under class 28250 (Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing);

- Manufacture of road tractors for semi-trailers, under class 29100 (Manufacture of motor vehicles);

- Manufacture of road trailers or semi-trailers, under class 29200 (Manufacture of bodies for motor vehicles, of trailers and semi-trailers);

2822 - 28220: Manufacture of machine tools and metal-forming machinery

This class includes:

- Manufacture of machine tools for processing metals and other materials (wood, bone, stone, hard rubber, hard plastics, cold glass, etc.), including those using a laser beam, ultrasonic waves, plasma arc, magnetic pulse, etc.

- Manufacture of machines for turning, milling, drilling, shaping, crushing, etc.

- Manufacture of stamping or pressing tools;

- Manufacture of punch presses, hydraulic presses, hydraulic brakes, hammers, forestry machines, etc.

- Manufacture of thread rollers or wire-working machines;

- Manufacture of machines for nailing, stapling, gluing or otherwise assembling wood, bamboo, bone, hard rubber or plastics, etc.

- Manufacture of rotary percussion drills, chainsaws, filing machines, riveters, metal cutters, etc.

- Manufacture of presses for the production of particle board and similar items;

- Manufacture of electroplating machinery.

This class also includes the manufacture of parts and accessories for the machine tools listed above: work holders, dividing heads and special attachments for machine tools.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of interchangeable tools for hand tools or machine tools (drills, punches, cutters, milling or turning tools, saw blades, cutting knives, etc.), under class 25930 (Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware);

- Manufacture of electric hand-held soldering irons and soldering guns, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of hand tools, under class 28180 (Manufacture of power-driven hand tools)

- Manufacture of machinery used in metal milling, under class 28230 (Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy);

- Manufacture of machinery for mining and quarrying, under class 28240 (Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction);

2823 - 28230: Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy

This class includes:

- Manufacture of machines and equipment for handling hot metals:

- Furnaces, ingot moulds, ladles, casting machines;

- Manufacture of metal-rolling mills.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of draw-benches, under class 28220 (Manufacture of machine tools and metal-forming machinery);

- Manufacture of moulding boxes and moulds (except ingot moulds), under class 25930 (Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware);

- Manufacture of machines for forming moulds, under class 2829 (Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery);

2824 - 28240: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction

This class includes:

- Manufacture of continuous-action elevators and conveyors for underground use;

- Manufacture of boring, cutting, sinking and tunneling machinery (whether or not for underground use);

- Manufacture of machinery for treating minerals by screening, sorting, washing, crushing, etc.

- Manufacture of concrete and mortar mixers;

- Manufacture of earth-moving machinery: Bulldozers, angle-dozers, graders, scrapers, mechanical shovels, etc.

- Manufacture of pile drivers and pile presses, mortar spreaders, bitumen spreaders, concrete surfacing machinery, etc.

- Manufacture of track-laying tractors and tractors used in construction or mining;

- Manufacture of bulldozers or angle-dozers;

- Manufacture of push vehicles.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment, under class 28160 (Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment);

- Manufacture of other tractors, under class 28210 (Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery) and class 29100 (Manufacture of motor vehicles);

- Manufacture of machine tools for stone processing, including machines for splitting or cleaning stone, under class 28220 (Manufacture of machine tools and metal-forming machinery);

- Manufacture of concrete-mixer lorries, under class 29100 (Manufacture of motor vehicles);

2825 - 28250: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing

This class includes:

- Manufacture of agricultural dryers;

- Manufacture of machinery for the dairy industry:

+ Cream separators,

+ Milk processing machinery (e.g. homogenizers),

+ Milk converting machinery (e.g. butter chums, butter workers and moulding machines),

+ Cheese-making machines (e.g. homogenizers, moulders, presses), etc.

- Manufacture of machinery for the grain milling industry:

+ Machinery for cleaning, sorting or grading seeds, grinding or drying leguminous vegetables (winnowers, threshers, separators, crushing machines, etc.)

+ Machinery for producing flour and meal, etc. (grinding mills, feeders, sifters, bran cleaners, hullers).

- Manufacture of machinery for the bakery industry or for making macaroni or similar products;

- Bakery ovens, dough mixers, dough dividers, slicers, cake-making machines, etc.

+ Machinery to make cocoa or chocolate, to manufacture sugar, to brew beer, to process meat or poultry, to prepare vegetables, nuts, fruit, fish, crabs or other seafood,

+ Machinery for filtering and purifying,

+ Other machinery for the industrial preparation and production of food and drink.

- Manufacture of machinery for preparation or extraction of animal fats or vegetable oils,

- Manufacture of machinery for preparing tobacco and for making cigar, pipe or chewing tobacco,

- Manufacture of machinery for preparation of food in hotels and restaurants.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of food and milk sterilizing equipment, under class 26600 (Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment);

- Manufacture of packing, wrapping and weighing machinery, under class 28190 (Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery);

- Manufacture of cleaning, sorting or grading machinery for eggs, fruit or other crops (except seeds, rice and dried leguminous vegetables), under class 28210 (Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery).

2826 - 28260: Manufacture of machinery for textile and leather production

This class includes:

- Manufacture of textile machinery:

+ Machines for preparing, producing, drawing, weaving or cutting man-made fabrics, materials or yarns,

+ Machines for preparing textile yarns: reelers, warpers and related machines, etc.

+ Weaving machines, including hand looms,

+ Knitting machines,

+ Machines for making net, tulle, lace, braid, etc.

- Manufacture of auxiliary machines or equipment for textile machinery: Jacquard weaving, automatic stop motions, shuttle changing mechanisms, spindles and spindle flyers, etc.

- Manufacture of textile printing machinery;

- Manufacture of laundry machinery: ironing machines, washing and drying machines, dry-cleaning machines.

Exclusion:

- Production of calendaring machines, under class 28190 (Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery);

2829: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery

This class includes the manufacture of special-purpose machines not elsewhere classified.

28291: Manufacture of machinery for producing building materials

This class includes the manufacture of machinery for producing roof tiles, wall tiles, floor tiles, ceramic pastes, mixed substances, conduit, graphite electrodes, board chalk, foundry moulds, etc.

28299: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of ingot moulds, under class 28230 (Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy);

29: MANUFACTURE OF MOTOR VEHICLES

This division includes the manufacture of motor vehicles for transporting passengers and freight, as well as the manufacture of various parts and accessories, and of trailers and semi-trailers;

Maintenance and repair of vehicles produced in this division are classified under 45200 (Maintenance and repair of motor vehicles).

291 - 2910 - 29100: Manufacture of motor vehicles

This class includes:

- Manufacture of passenger cars;

- Manufacture of commercial vehicles: Vans, over-the-road tractors for semi-trailers, etc.

- Manufacture of buses, trolleybus and coaches;

 - Manufacture of motor vehicle engines;

- Manufacture of chassis fitted with engines;

- Manufacture of motor vehicle engines;

+ Manufacture of snowmobiles, golf carts, amphibious airplanes,

+ Fire engines, street sweepers, travelling libraries, armored cars, etc.

+ Concrete-mixer lorries,

+ ATVs, go-carts and similar vehicles including race cars.

This class also includes the activities of factory rebuilding of motor vehicles.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of lighting equipment for motor vehicles and non-motorized vehicles, under class 27400 (Manufacture of electric lighting equipment);

292 - 2920 - 29200: Manufacture of bodies for motor vehicles, of trailers and semi-trailers

This class includes:

- Manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers: For transport of goods: oil tankers; for transport of passengers: caravan trailers;

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers specially designed for use in agriculture, under class 28210 (Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery);

This class includes:

30: MANUFACTURE OF OTHER TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT

This division includes the manufacture of transportation equipment such as shipbuilding and boat manufacturing; manufacture of locomotives and railroad rolling stock, aircrafts, spacecrafts and parts thereof.

301: Building of ships and boats

This group includes the activities of building of ships, boats and other floating structures for transportation and other commercial purposes, as well as for sports and recreational purposes.

3011 - 30110: Building of ships and floating structures

This class includes the activities of building of ships, except vessels for sports or recreation, and construction of floating structures.

This class includes:

- Building of commercial vessels: passenger ships, ferry boats, cargo ships, tankers, tugs, etc.

- Building of warships;

- Building of fishing boats and fish-processing factory vessels. This class also includes:

- Building of hovercraft (except recreation-type hovercraft);

- Construction of drilling platforms, floating or submersible vessels;

- Construction of floating structures: Floating docks, pontoons, coffer-dams, floating landing stages, buoys, floating tanks, barges, floating cranes, non-recreational inflatable rafts, etc.

- Manufacture of sections for ships and floating structures.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of parts of vessels, which are not major hull assemblies:

+ Manufacture of sails, under class 13220 (Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except wearing apparel);

+ Production of ships’ propellers, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

+ Production of steel or iron anchors, under class 2599 (Manufacture of other fabricated metal products not elsewhere classified);

Manufacture of marine vessels’ engines, under class 28110 (Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines);

- Manufacture of inflatable rafts and rafts for recreation, under class 30120 (Building of pleasure and sporting boats);

- Ship breaking, under class 3830 (Materials recovery);

- Interior installation of boats, under class 43300 (Building completion and finishing).

This class includes:

- Building of motor boats;

- Building of recreation-type hovercraft;

- Building of personal amphibious airplanes;

- Building of other tourist and sporting boats: Canoes, kayaks (lightweight wood boats), rowing boats, skiffs.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of parts of tourist and sporting boats:

Manufacture of marine vessels’ engines, under class 28110 (Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines);

- Manufacture of air force control systems, under class 26510 (Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment);

- Manufacture of lighting equipment for aircraft, under class 27400 (Manufacture of electric lighting equipment);

- Manufacture of ignition parts and other electrical parts for internal combustion engines, under class 27900 (Manufacture of other electrical equipment);

- Manufacture of pistons, piston rings and carburetors, under class 28110 (Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, automobile and motorcycle engines);

304 - 3040 - 30400: Manufacture of military fighting vehicles

This class includes:

- Manufacture of tanks;

- Manufacture of amphibious military equipment;

- Manufacture of other military fighting vehicles.

309: Manufacture of other transport equipment not elsewhere classified

This group includes the manufacture of transport equipment other than motor vehicles and transport equipment for railway, waterway, aviation or space travel, and military vehicles.

3091 - 30910: Manufacture of motorcycles

This class includes:

3092 - 30920: Manufacture of bicycles and invalid carriages
