- Activities of wholesale auctioneering houses.

Exclusion:

- Wholesale trade in one’s own name, under groups from 462 (Wholesale of agricultural and forest raw materials (except wood and bamboo) and live animals) to 469 (Non-specialized wholesale trade);

- Activities of commission agents related to small cars with 12 or fewer seats, under class 45131 (Activities of commission agents for small cars with 12 or fewer seats), to motor vehicles, under class 45139 (Activities of commission agents for other motor vehicles), and to motorcycles, under class 45413 (Activities of commission agents for motorcycles);

- Activities of commission agents related to parts and accessories for automobiles and motor vehicles, under classes 45303 (Wholesale of motor vehicle parts and accessories) and for motorcycles, under class 45433 (Wholesale of parts and accessories for motorcycles);

- Retail sale by non-store commission agents, under class 47990 (Other retail sale not elsewhere classified).

- Activities of insurance agents, under class 66220 (Activities of insurance agents and brokers);

- Activities of real estate agents, under class 68200 (Real estate consultancy, brokerage and auctioning, land use right auctioning).

46102: Brokers

This class includes the activities of brokers engaged in sale and purchase of goods: Intermediary traders (brokers) involved in bringing sellers and buyers together (connected parties) with regard to:

- Raw materials of agriculture and forestry, live animals, textile raw materials and semi-finished goods,

- Fuels, ores, metals and industrial chemicals, fertilizers,

- Food, beverages and tobacco,

- Textiles, made-up apparel, fur, footwear, genuine and artificial leather goods,

- Timber and building materials,

- Machinery and equipment, including office machines, computers, industrial equipment, ships and aircraft,

- Beds, closets, tables, chairs and similar furniture, household goods, hardware.

Exclusion:

- Activities of insurance agents, under class 66220 (Activities of insurance agents and brokers);

- Activities of real estate agents, under class 68200 (Real estate consultancy, brokerage and auctioning, land use right auctioning).

46103: Auction agents

This class includes the activities of auctioneering houses, i.e. sellers by themselves or through a hired auctioneer conduct a public sale session to find highest bidders for:

- Fuels, ores, metals and industrial chemicals, fertilizers;

- Timber and building materials;

- Beds, closets, tables, chairs and similar furniture, household goods, hardware.

Exclusion: activities of auctioneering houses related to real estate and land use right, under class 68200 (Real estate consultancy, brokerage and auctioning, land use right auctioning).

47: RETAIL TRADE (EXCEPT MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES)

This division includes:

Resale (sale without transformation) of new and used goods to the general public for personal or household consumption or social utilization, by specialized  and non-specialized shops, department stores, stalls, mail-order houses, consumer cooperatives, mobile vendors or markets.

Retail trade is classified first by type of sale outlet. Retail trade thereof is classified into: retail trade in stores under groups from 471 (Retail sale in non-specialized stores) to 477 (Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores); non-store retail trade under groups 478 (Retail sale visa stalls or markets) and 479 (Retail trade not in stores, stalls or markets).

Retail trade in stores, including retail sale of used goods, is classified under class 4774 (Retail sale of second-hand goods in specialized stores). There exists a further distinction between specialized retail sale under groups from 472 (Retail sale of food, beverages, and tobacco in specialized stores) to 477 (Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores) and non-specialized retail sale under group 471 (Retail sale in non-specialized stores). The above groups are further subdivided into 4th and 5th levels by the type of products sold.

Sale not via stores is subdivided according to the forms of trade, such as retail sale via stalls, kiosks and markets, under group 478 (Retail sale via stalls or markets) and other non-store retail sale, e.g. mail order, Internet shopping, door-to-door, by vending machines, etc. under class 479 (Retail trade not in stores, stalls or markets). The goods sold in the retail trade are usually referred to as consumer goods. Goods not usually entering the retail trade, such as ores, industrial machinery and equipment, are excluded. This division also includes units engaged primarily in selling to organizations some consumer products such as personal computers, stationery, paint or timber, although these sales may not be for personal or household use. Some processing of goods incidental to sale activities may be included, e.g. sorting, storing, packing and installation of household goods.

This division also includes the retail sale by commission agents and activities of retail auctioning houses.

Exclusion:

- Sale of farm products by farmers, under division 01 (Agriculture and related services)

- Manufacture of sale of goods, generally classified as manufacturing, under divisions 10 to 32;

- Sale of motor vehicles, motorcycles and their parts, under division 45 (Sale and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles);

- Trade in ores, crude oil, industrial chemicals, iron, steel, industrial machinery, equipment and related supplies, under division 46 (Wholesale trade, except motor vehicles and motorcycles);

- Sale of food and drinks for consumption on the premises and sale of takeaway food, under division 56 (Food and beverage services);

- Leasing of personal and household goods, under group 772 (Leasing of personal and household goods).

Exclusion:

- Retail sale of second-hand motor vehicles and motorcycles, under classes 45120 (Retail sale of small cars with 12 or fewer seats) and 45412 (Retail sale of motorcycles);

- Activities of Internet auctions and other non-store auctions (retail), under classes 47910 (Retail sale via mail order or via Internet) and 47990 (Other retail sale not elsewhere classified);

- Activities of pawnshops, under class 64920 (Other credit granting).

478: Retail sale via stalls or markets

This group includes the retail sale of new or second-hand products in a stationary stall or kiosk in a fixed marketplace or in a movable stall along a public road.

4781: Retail sale of food, beverages and tobacco via stalls or markets

This class includes the retail sale of rice, corn, food products, beverages and tobacco products via markets or stalls.

Exclusion:

- Retail sale of prepared food and beverages for immediate consumption (mobile food vendors), under class 56109 (Other mobile food and beverage services).

47811: Retail sale of food via stalls or via markets

This class includes the retail sale of rice and corn via markets or stalls.

47812: Retail sale of food products via stalls or via markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of food products: meat, meat products, aquatic products, fruit, vegetables, eggs, dried food and other products via markets or stalls;

- Retail sale of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages via markets or stalls.

Exclusion:

- Retail sale of prepared food products for immediate consumption, such as Vietnamese pork rolls,  roast pork, fermented meat, grilled meat balls, etc., under class 56109 (Other mobile food and beverage services);

- Prepared dishes for immediate or takeaway consumption, such as pho, vermicelli, congee, under class 56109 (Other mobile food and beverage services).

47813: Retail sale of beverages via stalls or markets

This class includes the retail sale of alcoholic beverages (beers, wines) and non-alcoholic beverages (coke, pepsi cola, bottled or canned soft drinks, natural mineral water, bottled water).

Exclusion: Retail sale of prepared beverages for immediate or takeaway consumption, such as fresh fruit juices, smoothies, sugarcane juice, ready-made tea and coffee, under class 56109 (Other mobile food and beverage services).

47814: Retail sale of tobacco products via stalls or markets

This class includes the retail sale of cigarettes, cigars and other tobacco products.

4782: Retail sale of textiles, ready-made clothing and footwear via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of fabrics and other textile products;

- Retail sale of wearing apparel;

- Retail sale of footwear;

47821: Retail sale of textiles via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of clothing fabrics;

- Retail sale of other textile products: wool, yarn, haberdashery, etc.

47822: Retail sale of ready-made clothing via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of ready-made clothing;

- Retail sale of articles of fur;

- Retail sale of clothing accessories: Gloves, socks, shawls, ties, etc.

47823: Retail sale of footwear via stalls or markets

This class includes the retail sale of footwear, including sports shoes and sandals of all materials.

4789: Retail sale of other goods via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of perfumes, cosmetics and sanitary articles;

- Retail sale of carpets, rugs and bedding sets;

- Retail sale of books, newspapers and magazines;

- Retail sale of games and toys;

- Retail sale of household appliances and consumer electronics;

- Retail sale of music and video recordings.

47891: Retail sale of cosmetics and sanitary articles via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of perfumes and aromatic waters;

- Retail of cosmetics: lipsticks, powders, creams, preparations for eye makeup and other makeup articles;

- Retail sale of sanitary articles: shampoos, shower creams, aromatic napkins, etc.

47892: Retail sale of porcelain articles, pottery and glassware via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of household goods made of porcelain and pottery;

- Retail sale of household glassware.

Exclusion: Retail sale of antique porcelain articles, pottery and glassware, under class 47749 (Retail sale of other second-hand goods in specialized stores).

47893: Retail sale of fresh flowers and ornamental plants via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of fresh flowers and ornamental plants;

- Retail sale of man-made decorative flowers and tree parts;

- Retail sale of fertilizers;

47899: Retail sale of other goods not elsewhere classified via stalls or markets

This class includes:

- Retail sale of ornamental animals and their feeds;

- Retail sale of worshiping articles, joss paper and other religious goods;

- Retail sale of cleaning items such as broomsticks, brushes, cloths, etc.;

- Retail sale of firearms and ammunition for hunting or sports;

- Retail sale of stamps and coins;

- Retail sale of non-food products not elsewhere classified.

479: Other retail sale (except retail sale via stalls or markets)

This group includes retail sale activities by mail order, over the Internet, through door-to-door sales, vending machines, etc.

4791 - 47910: Retail sale via mail order or via Internet

This class includes retail sale activities in which the buyer makes his choice on the basis of advertisements, catalogues, information provided on a website, samples or any other means of advertising. The buyer then places his order by mail, phone or over the Internet (usually through special means provided by a website). The products purchased can be either directly downloaded from the Internet or physically delivered to the customer.

This class includes:

- Retail sale of goods by mail order;

- Retail sale of products over the Internet.

This class also includes:

- Direct sale via television, radio and telephone;

- Internet-based retail auctions.

4799 - 47990: Other retail sale not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Retail sale of goods in any way that is not included in previous classes: by direct sales or door-to-door salespersons or through vending machines, etc.;

- Direct selling of fuel (heating oil, fuel wood), delivered directly to the consumers' premises;

- Activities of non-store auctions (retail);

- Retail sale by (non-store) commission agents.

Exclusion: Delivery of products by stores, under groups from 471 (Retail sale in non-specialized stores) to 477 (Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores).

H: TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE

This section includes:

Provision of passenger or freight transport, whether scheduled or on demand, by rail, pipeline, road, water or air and associated activities such as parking facilities, harbors, airfields, railway stations, cargo handling and storage, etc.

This section also includes:

Leasing of transport equipment with a driver or operator. Postal and courier activities.

Exclusion:

- Major repair or replacement of transport equipment, except motor vehicles and motorcycles, under class 33150 (Repair and maintenance of transport equipment, except motor vehicles);

- Construction, maintenance and repair of road, railroads, harbors, airfields, under classes 42101 (Construction of roads) and 42900 (Construction of other civil engineering projects);

- Maintenance and repair of motorcycles and motor vehicles, under classes 4520 (Maintenance and repair of motor vehicles) and 4542 (Maintenance and repair of motorcycles);

- Leasing of transport equipment without a driver or operator, under class 7710 (Leasing of motor vehicles).

49: LAND TRANSPORT AND TRANSPORT VIA PIPELINES

This division includes the activities of transport of passengers and freight via road and railway, and transport of freight via pipelines.

491: Transport via railways

This group includes the rail transportation of passengers and/or freight by railroad rolling stock on mainline networks spreading over a region, a geographic area or a short-line local railroad.

Exclusion:

- Related activities such as switching and shunting, under class 52211 (Service activities incidental to rail transportation);

- Maintenance of railway systems, under class 52211 (Service activities incidental to rail transportation).

4911 - 49110: Passenger rail transport

This class includes:

- Passenger transport by inter-provincial railways;

- Operation of sleeping cars and dining cars as an integrated operation of railway companies.

Exclusion:

- Passenger transport by urban and suburban railway systems, under class 49311 (Passenger transport by underground railroad);

- Rail passenger terminal activities, under class 52211 (Service activities incidental to rail transportation);

- Operation of sleeping and dining cars by a separate unit, under classes 55909 (Other accommodation not elsewhere classified) and 56290 (Other food services).

4912 - 49120: Freight rail transport

This class includes the activities of freight transport on inter-provincial, urban and suburban railroads.

Exclusion:

- Storage and warehousing, under group 521 (Warehousing and storage);

- Rail freight terminal activities, under class 52211 (Service activities incidental to rail transportation);

- Cargo handling, under class 52241 (Rail freight handling).

492 - 4920 - 49200: Transport by bus

This class includes:

- Passenger transport by urban, suburban or inter-provincial buses;

- Transport, on a contract basis, of pupils to schools or workers to workplaces.

493: Other land transport

This group includes land-based passenger and freight transport activities (except Transport by bus and rail transport).

4931: Urban and suburban passenger land transport (except Transport by bus)

This class includes the activities of land transport of passengers in urban or suburban areas, by different modes of land transport (except buses), such as: underground and elevated railways, streetcars, tramway, etc. The nature of such transport is that it is carried out on scheduled at fixed stops.

This class also includes:

- Town-to-airport or town-to-station lines;

- Operation of funicular railways, aerial cableways, etc. as part of an urban or suburban transit system.

Exclusion:

- Passenger transport by inter-provincial railways, under class 49110 (Rail passenger transport);

- Transport by bus, under class 49200 (Transport by bus);

49311: Passenger transport by underground railway

This class includes the activities of urban and suburban passenger transport by underground electric railways.

49312: Passenger transport by taxicabs

This class includes the activities of passenger transport by taxicabs, including airport transfer taxicabs.

49313: Passenger transport by three-wheeler lambros, ricksaws and motorcycles

This class includes:

- Passenger transport by three-wheeler lambros;

- Passenger transport by ricksaws;

- Passenger transport by motorcycles.

Exclusion: Leasing of auto ricksaws and motorcycles without a driver, under class 77309 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified).

49319: Passenger transport by bicycles, cyclos and non-motorized vehicles

This class includes:

- Passenger transport by bicycles;

- Passenger transport by cyclos;

- Passenger transport by non-motorized vehicles such as horse-drawn carts, bullock carts, etc.

Exclusion: Leasing of bicycles, cyclos and non-motorized vehicles without a driver, under class 77309 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified).

4932: Other passenger land transport

This class includes:

- Passenger transport by intra-provincial and inter-provincial vehicles;

- Chartering of vehicles with driver for passenger transport, tourist excursions or other purposes;

- Operation of cable cars and funiculars.

Exclusion:

- Leasing of vehicles without a driver, under class 77309 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified).

- Ambulance transport, under class 86990 (Other health activities not elsewhere classified).

49321: Passenger transport by intra-provincial and inter-provincial vehicles

This class includes:

- Passenger transport by intra-provincial vehicles travelling between urban and suburban districts of a city or of a province;

- Passenger transport by inter-provincial vehicles;

- Chartering of vehicles with driver for passenger transport, tourist excursions or other purposes;

Exclusion: Leasing of passenger vehicles without a driver, under class 77309 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified).

49329: Other passenger land transport not elsewhere classified

This class includes the operation of funicular railways, aerial cableways, etc. as part of an urban or suburban transit system.

4933: Freight transport by road

This class includes:

- Transportation of ordinary goods: wood, livestock, forest products, aquatic products, other ordinary goods;

- Transportation of goods by special-purpose vehicles: tank trucks, chemical trucks, refrigerated trucks;

- Heavy haulage and transportation of containers;

- Transportation of waste and waste materials, without collection or disposal.

This class also includes:

- Furniture relocation;

- Leasing of trucks with driver;

- Freight transport by man-drawn or animal-drawn vehicles.

Exclusion:

- Log hauling within a forest, as part of logging operations, under class 02400 (Support services to forestry);

- Distribution of water by trucks, under class 36000 (Water collection, treatment and supply);

- Operation of terminal facilities for handling freight, under class 52219 (Service activities incidental to land transportation);

- Crating and packing services for transport, under class 52299 (Other transportation support activities not elsewhere classified);

- Postal services and courier activities, under classes 53100 (Postal activities and 53200 (Courier activities);

- Waste transport as integrated part of waste collection activities, under classes 38110 (Collection of non-hazardous waste), 38121 (Collection of medical waste) and 38129 (Collection of other hazardous waste).

49331: Freight transport by special-purpose automobiles

This class includes:

- Haulage in tanker trucks;

- Haulage in chemical trucks;;

- Refrigerated food transport;

- Leasing of freight vehicles with driver.

Exclusion:

- Distribution of water by trucks, under class 36000 (Water collection, treatment and supply);

- Waste transport as integrated part of waste collection activities, under classes 38110 (Collection of non-hazardous waste), 38121 (Collection of medical waste) and 38129 (Collection of other hazardous waste).

- Leasing of special-purposed vehicles without a driver, under class 77309 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified).

49332: Freight transport by other automobiles (except special-purpose vehicles)

This class includes:

- Transportation of ordinary goods: wood, livestock, forest products, aquatic products, other normal goods;

- Heavy haulage and transportation of containers;

- Transportation of waste and waste materials, without collection or disposal.

This class also includes:

- Relocation of household and office furniture and equipment, etc.;

- Leasing of freight vehicles (except special-purpose vehicles) with driver.

Exclusion:

- Log hauling within a forest, as part of logging operations, under class 02400 (Support services to forestry);

- Operation of terminal facilities for handling freight, under class 52219 (Service activities incidental to land transportation);

- Crating and packing services for transport, under class 52299 (Other transportation support activities not elsewhere classified);

- Postal services and courier activities, under classes 53100 (Postal activities and 53200 (Courier activities);

- Leasing of freight vehicles without a driver, under class 77109 (Leasing of other motor vehicles).

49333: Freight transport by three-wheeler lambros, ricksaws and modified tractors

This class includes:

- Transportation of ordinary goods by three-wheeler lambros, ricksaws and modified tractors;

- Leasing of three-wheeler lambros, ricksaws and modified tractors for goods transport.

49334: Freight transport by non-motorized vehicles

This class includes the transportation of goods by improved carts, bullock carts, horse-drawn or animal-drawn carts.

49339: Other road freight transport

This class includes:

Road freight transport by other means not elsewhere classified.

494 - 4940 - 49400: Transport via pipeline

This class includes the transportation of gases, liquefied gases, water, liquids, slurry and other commodities via pipelines.

This class also includes the operation of pump stations.

Exclusion:

- Distribution of natural or manufactured gas, water or steam, under classes 35200 (Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains), 3530 (Manufacture and supply of steam, hot water, air conditioning and ice) and 36000 (Water collection, treatment and supply);

- Transportation of water, liquids, etc. by tanker trucks, under class 49331 (Freight transport by special-purpose vehicles).

50: WATER TRANSPORT

This division includes the transportation of passengers or freight over water, whether scheduled or not. Operation of towing or pushing boats, cruise ships or sightseeing boats, ferries, water taxis, etc. Although the geographical location is an indicator for the separation between sea and inland waterway transport, the deciding factor is the type of vessel used. All transport on sea-going vessels is classified in group 501 (Coastal and seawater transport), while transport using other vessels is classified in group 502 (Inland water transport).

Exclusion: Restaurant and bar activities on board ships, if carried out by separate units, under classes 56101 (Restaurant and food serving places) and 56301 (Taverns and bars).

501: Coastal and seawater transport

This class includes the transportation of passengers or freight on vessels designed for operating on sea or coastal waters.

Also included is the transportation of passengers or freight on great lakes, etc. when similar types of sea vessels are used.

5011: Coastal and sea passenger water transport

This class includes:

- Transportation of passengers overseas and coastal waters, whether scheduled or not;

- Operation of cruise ships or sightseeing boats;

- Operation of ferries and water taxis.

This class also includes the activities of chartering of vessels with crew for coastal and seawater transport (e.g. fishing cruises).

Exclusion:

- Restaurant and bar activities on board ships, if carried out by separate units, under classes 56101 (Restaurant and food serving places) and 56301 (Taverns and bars).

- Operation of "floating casinos”, under class 92002 (Betting and gambling activities), if operated by separate units.

50111: Coastal passenger water transport

This class includes:

- Transportation of passengers over coastal waters, whether scheduled or not;

- Operation of excursion or sightseeing boats;

- Operation of ferries and water taxis.

This class also includes the activities of chartering of vessels with crew for coastal water transport (e.g. fishing cruises).

Exclusion:

- Restaurant and bar activities on board ships, if carried out by separate units, under classes 56101 (Restaurant and food serving places) and 56301 (Taverns and bars).

- Operation of "floating casinos”, under class 92002 (Betting and gambling activities), if operated by separate units.

50112: Sea passenger water transport

This class includes:

- Transportation of passengers overseas waters, whether scheduled or not;

- Operation of cruise ships or sightseeing boats.

This class also includes the activities of chartering of vessels with crew for seawater transport (e.g. fishing cruises).

Exclusion: Restaurant and bar activities on board ships, if carried out by separate units, under classes 56101 (Restaurant and food serving places) and 56301 (Taverns and bars).

5012: Coastal and sea freight water transport

This class includes:

- Transportation of freight overseas and coastal waters, whether scheduled or not;

- Transport by towing or pushing of barges, oil rigs, etc.

Exclusion:

- Storage of freight, under group 521 (Warehousing and storage);

- Harbor operation and other auxiliary activities such as docking, piloting, lighterage, vessel salvage, under class 52221 (Service activities incidental to coastal and seawater transport);

- Cargo handling, under class 52243 (Seaport cargo handling).

50121: Coastal freight water transport

This class includes:

- Coastal freight water transport, whether scheduled or not;

- Transport by towing or pushing of barges, oil rigs, etc.

Exclusion:

- Storage of freight, under group 521 (Warehousing and storage);

- Harbor operation and other auxiliary activities such as docking, piloting, lighterage, vessel salvage, under class 52221 (Service activities incidental to coastal and seawater transport);

- Cargo handling, under class 52243 (Seaport cargo handling).

50122: Sea freight water transport

This class includes:

- Sea freight water transport, whether scheduled or not;

- Transport by towing or pushing of barges, oil rigs, etc.

Exclusion:

- Storage of freight, under group 521 (Warehousing and storage);

- Harbor operation and other auxiliary activities such as docking, piloting, lighterage, vessel salvage, under class 52221 (Service activities incidental to coastal and seawater transport);

- Cargo handling, under class 52243 (Seaport cargo handling).

502: Inland water transport

This class includes: Transport of passengers or freight on rivers, lakes and canals, involving vessels that are not suitable for sea transport or other motorized vessels (ferries, motorized boats and skiffs) and non-motorized vessels (non-motorized boats and skiffs).

5021: Inland passenger water transport

This class includes the transportation of passengers via rivers, lakes and canals by motorized and non-motorized vessels.

This class also includes the activities of chartering of ships with crew or leasing of skiffs with operator for transporting passengers via rivers, lakes and canals.

50211: Inland passenger water transport by motorized vessels

This class includes the transportation of passengers via rivers, lakes and canals by ships and other vessels (ferries and motorized boats and skiffs).

This class also includes the activities of chartering of ships with crew or leasing of motorized skiffs with operator for transporting passengers via rivers, lakes and canals.

50212: Inland passenger water transport by non-motorized vessels

This class includes the transportation of passengers via rivers, lakes and canals by non-motorized vessels: boats and skiffs without motor.

This class also includes the leasing of skiffs with operator for transporting passengers via rivers, lakes and canals.

5022: Inland freight water transport

This class includes the transportation of freight via rivers, lakes and canals by motorized and non-motorized vessels.

This class also includes the activities of chartering of ships with crew or leasing of skiffs with operator for transporting freight via rivers, lakes and canals.

50221: Inland freight water transport by motorized vessels

This class includes the transportation of freight via rivers, lakes and canals by ships and other motorized vessels (motorized boats and skiffs).

This class also includes the activities of chartering of ships with crew or leasing of motorized skiffs with operator for transporting freight via rivers, lakes and canals.

50222: Inland freight water transport by non-motorized vessels

This class includes the transportation of freight via rivers, lakes and canals by non-motorized vessels: boats and skiffs without motor.

This class also includes the leasing of skiffs with operator for transporting passengers via rivers, lakes and canals.

51: AIR TRANSPORT

This division includes the transportation of passengers or freight by air.

Exclusion:

- Aerial application, under class 01610 (Cultivation service activities);

- Overhaul of aircraft or aircraft engines, under class 33150 (Repair and maintenance of transport equipment, except cars, motorcycles and motor vehicles);

- Operation of airports, under classes 52231 (Air traffic control activities) and 52239 (Service activities incidental to air transportation);

- Aerial advertising (skywriting by aircraft’s expulsion of smoke), under class 73100 (Advertising);

- Aerial photography, under class 74200 (Photographic activities).

511 - 5110 - 51100: Passenger air transport

This class includes:

- Transportation of passengers by air over regular or ad-hoc routes and schedules;

- Charter flights for passenger transport;

- Scenic and sightseeing flights. This class also includes:

- Chartering of aircraft with operator for passenger transport;

- Aviation activities: transportation of passengers by aero clubs for instruction or pleasure.

512 - 5120 - 51200: Freight air transport

This class includes:

- Transportation of freight by air over regular or ad-hoc routes and schedules;

- Non-scheduled flights for freight air transport;

- Launching of satellites and space vehicles.

This class also includes the renting of aircraft with operator for transporting freight.

52: WAREHOUSING AND SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR TRANSPORTATION

This division includes warehousing and support activities for transportation, such as the operation of parking facilities, airports, harbors, tunnels, bridges, and the activities of transport agencies and cargo handling, etc.

521 - 5210: Warehousing and storage

This class includes the activities of goods storage and warehouse facilities such as silos, general warehouses, refrigerated warehouses, etc.

This class also includes the storage of goods in bonded warehouses.

Exclusion:

- Parking facilities for automobiles and other motor vehicles, under class 52219 (Service activities incidental to land transportation);

- Operation of self-storage facilities owned or rented, under class 68100 (Trading of own or rented property and land use rights).

- Leasing of vacant space, under class 68100 (Trading of own or rented property and land use rights).

52101: Warehousing and storage of goods in bonded warehouses

This class includes the operation of bonded warehouses: storing and warehousing of domestically produced goods cleared from usual export procedures but not yet transported to foreign countries, or of foreign goods not yet cleared from Vietnam customs authorities’ usual import procedures.

52102: Warehousing and storage of goods in refrigerated warehouses (except bonded warehouses)

This class includes the storage of goods in warehouses (except bonded warehouses) installed with refrigerators to preserve goods, particularly fresh food products (except the operation of bonded warehouses).

52109: Other warehousing and storage of goods

This class includes the storage of goods in ordinary warehouses (except bonded and refrigerated warehouses) to store goods for ordinary activities such as manufacturing materials, consumer goods, machinery and equipment, etc.

522: Support activities for transportation

This group includes the activities supporting the transportation of passengers or freight, such as the operation of parking facilities, airports, habors, tunnels, bridges, other transport facilities, or the activities of loading and unloading goods into and out of one or multiple means of transport.

The class also includes: Maintenance of all transport facilities and equipment.

5221: Service activities incidental to rail and road transportation

This class includes:

Service activities supporting directly the rail and road transportation of passengers and freight.

Exclusion: Rail freight handling, under class 52241 (Rail freight handling), and road cargo handling, under class 52242 (Road cargo handling).

52211: Service activities incidental to rail transportation

This class includes service activities related to rail transport of passengers, animals or freight:

- Operation of railway stations;

- Management and dispatching of railroads;

- Switching and operation of level crossings.

Exclusion: Rail freight handling, under class 52241 (Rail freight handling).

52219: Service activities incidental to road transportation

This class includes:

- Service activities related to road transport of passengers, animals or freight:

- Operation of road transport terminals and cargo handling stations;

- Operation of roads, bridges, tunnels, car parks or garages, bicycle and motorcycle parking;

- Towing and roadside assistance.

The class also includes the liquefaction of gas for transportation purposes.

Exclusion: Road cargo handling, under class 52242 (Road cargo handling).

5222: Service activities incidental to water transportation

This class includes:

- Service activities related to water transport of passengers, animals or freight:

- Operation of harbors, ports and piers;

- Operation of water locks;

- Piloting, towing, and berthing activities;

- Lighterage, LASH and salvage activities;

- Lighthouse activities.

Exclusion:

- Cargo handling, under classes 52243 (Seaport cargo handling) and 52244 (Riverport cargo handling);

- Operation of marinas, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

52221: Service activities incidental to coastal and seawater transportation

This class includes:

- Service activities related to coast and seawater transport of passengers, animals or freight:

- Operation of sea harbors, ports and piers;

- Piloting, towing, and berthing activities;

- Lighterage, LASH and salvage activities;

- Lighthouse activities.

Exclusion:

- Seaport cargo handling, under class 52243 (Seaport cargo handling);

- Operation of marinas, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

52222: Service activities incidental to inland water transportation

This class includes:

- Service activities related to transport of passengers, animals or freight via rivers, lakes and canals;

- Operation of river harbors, berths and piers;

- Piloting, towing, and berthing activities;

- Salvage activities.

Exclusion:

- Riverport cargo handling, under class 52244 (Riverport cargo handling);

- Operation of marinas, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

5223: Service activities incidental to air transportation

This class includes service activities related to air transport of passengers, animals or freight:

- Operation of airway terminals;

- Flight management and air-traffic-control activities;

- Ground service activities on airfields, etc.

The class also includes firefighting and fire prevention activities at airports.

Exclusion:

- Airport cargo handling, under class 52245 (Airport cargo handling);

- Operation of flight schools, under class 85590 (Other educational activities).

52231: Flight management activities

This class includes flight management and air-traffic-control activities;

52239: Other service activities incidental to air transportation

This class includes service activities related to air transport of passengers, animals or freight:

- Management of travelers at airway terminals;

- Ground service activities on airfields.

The class also includes firefighting and fire prevention activities at airports.

Exclusion:

- Airport cargo handling, under class 52245 (Airport cargo handling);

- Operation of flight schools, under class 85590 (Other educational activities).

5224: Cargo handling

This class includes:

- Loading and unloading of goods or passengers' luggage into or out of the means of transport;

- Stevedoring;

- Loading and unloading of rail freight.

Exclusion: Operation of railway stations, coach stations, airports and harbors, under classes from 5221 (Service activities incidental to rail and road transportation) to 5223 (Service activities incidental to air transportation) accordingly.

52241: Rail freight handling

This class includes:

- Loading and unloading of goods or passengers’ luggage into and out of trains;

- Railway stevedoring.

Exclusion: Operation of railway stations, under class 52211 (Service activities incidental to rail transportation);

52242: Road cargo handling

This class includes:

- Loading and unloading of goods or passengers’ luggage into and out of land vehicles;

- Stevedoring at road transport terminals.

Exclusion: Operation of road transport terminals, under class 5221 (Service activities incidental to rail and road transportation);

52243: Seaport cargo handling

This class includes:

- Loading and unloading of goods or passengers’ luggage into and out of maritime vessels;

- Seaport stevedoring.

Exclusion: Seaport activities, under class 52221 (Service activities incidental to coast and seawater transportation).

52244: Riverport cargo handling

This class includes:

- Loading and unloading of goods or passengers' luggage into or out of ships and boats that operate via rivers, lakes and canals;

- Stevedoring.

Exclusion: Riverport activities, under class 52222 (Service activities incidental to inland water transportation);

52245: Air cargo handling

This class includes:

- Loading and unloading of goods or passengers’ luggage into and out of aircraft;

- Stevedoring.

Exclusion: Operation of airway terminals and airfields, under classes 52231 (Flight management activities) and 52239 (Service activities incidental to air transportation);

5229: Other transportation support activities

This class includes:

- Freight forwarding;

- Arranging or organizing of transport operations by rail, road, sea or air;

- Pickup and delivery of goods;

- Obtaining and issuing of transport documents and waybills;

- Activities of customs agents;

- Activities of sea-freight forwarders and air-cargo agents;

- Brokerage for chartering of maritime vessels and aircraft;

- Other related activities such as: crating for protecting goods during transit, uncrating, sampling and weighing of goods.

Exclusion:

- Courier activities, under class 53200 (Courier activities);

- Provision of insurance of vehicles, maritime vessels, aircraft and transport insurance, under class 65129 (Other non-life insurance);

- Activities of travel agencies, under class 79110 (Travel agency activities);

- Activities of tour operators, under class 79120 (Tour operator activities);

- Tourist assistance activities, under class 79200 (Tourism promotion and operation support activities)

52291: Shipping agency activities

This class includes service activities performed on behalf of ship owners.

This class includes:

- Handling of procedures for ships entering or leaving ports, renting of tugs, piloting, arranging of piers and berths for freight handling and passenger boarding;

- Provision of essential information concerning the ship, freight and passengers; preparation of documents regarding the freight and passengers; arranging of the delivery of goods to consignees; handling of customs and border procedures related to the ship, loading and unloading of goods and passengers;

- Collection and paying of charges, amends and other pecuniary amounts on behalf of other entities; arranging of supplies for maritime vessels at seaports;

- Signing of vessel charter agreements, handling procedures for ship and crew delivery; engaging in contracts for transportation and freight handling;

- Handling of procedures regarding maritime disputes and of other tasks as entrusted.

52292: Sea freight forwarder activities

This class includes:

- Service activities performed on behalf of freight owners;

- Activities of seawater transport of goods, passengers and related luggage and of goods delivery on a contract basis (including multimodal transportation); 

- Leasing and renting, on behalf of other entities, of equipment for seawater transport, freight handling, warehousing, mooring and other maritime equipment;

- Activities of container agencies;

- Other activities as entrusted.

52299: Other transportation support activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Service activities supporting air transport, road transport and inland water transport;

- Brokerage for chartering of maritime vessels, aircraft and road transport vehicles;

- Activities of flight booking agencies;

- Activities of customs agents;

- Activities of freight forwarders, including logistics services;

- Brokerage for chartering of maritime vessels and aircraft;

- Other activities such as sampling, weighing of goods, etc. in connection with transportation.

Exclusion:

- Courier activities, under class 53200 (Courier activities);

- Provision of insurance of vehicles, maritime vessels, aircraft and transport insurance, under class 65129 (Other non-life insurance);

- Activities of travel agencies, under class 79110 (Travel agency activities);

- Activities of tour operators, under class 79120 (Tour operator activities);

- Tourist assistance activities, under class 79200 (Tourism promotion and operation support activities)

53: POSTAL AND COURIER ACTIVITIES

This division includes postal and courier activities, such as pickup, transport and delivery of letters and parcels under various arrangements. Local delivery and messenger services are also included.

531 - 5310 - 53100: Postal activities

This class includes the activities of postal services operating under universal and consistent regulations. Postal activities include the use of the universal service infrastructure for gathering, sorting, packing, and delivering letters, postcards, newspapers, magazines, print advertisements, packets, goods or documents by route and region.

The class also includes other services necessary to support such activities:

- Pickup, sorting, transport and delivery (domestic or international) of letters and mail-type parcels and packages by postal services operating through postal networks under a universal service obligation. One or more modes of transport may be involved and the activity may be carried out with either post units’ self-owned transport or via public transport.

- Collection of letters and parcels from public letter-boxes or from post offices;

- Distribution and delivery of mails and parcels.

Exclusion: Postal giro, postal savings activities and money order activities, under class 64190 (Other monetary intermediation).

532 - 5320 - 53200: Courier activities

This class includes:

- Pickup, sorting, transport and delivery (domestic or international) of letters and mail-type parcels and packages by firms not operating under a universal service obligation. One or more modes of transport may be involved and the activity may be carried out with the firms’ self-owned transport or via public transport;

- Distribution and delivery of mails and parcels.

The class also includes home delivery services

Exclusion: Transport of freight according to mode of transport, under classes 4912 (Transport via railways), 4933 (Freight transport by road), 5012 (Coastal and sea freight water transport), 5022 (Inland freight water transport) and 5120 (Freight air transport).

I: ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES

This section includes the provision of short-stay accommodation tourists and other travelers, and of meals and drinks fit for immediate consumption. A variety of supplementary services are included.

Exclusion:

- Provision of long-term accommodation as permanent residences, which is classified in real estate activities (section L, Real estate activities);

- Preparation of food or drinks that are either not fit for immediate consumption or that are sold through independent distribution channels, i.e. through wholesale or retail trade activities. Such food preparation activities are classified in section C (Manufacturing).

55: ACCOMMODATION

This division includes the provision of short-stay accommodation for tourists and other travelers. Also included is the provision of longer-term accommodation for students, workers and similar individuals. Some units may provide only accommodation while others provide a combination of accommodation, meals and/or recreational facilities.

Exclusion: Provision of long-term accommodation as permanent residences (e.g. apartments leased on monthly or annual basis), which is classified in real estate activities (section L, Real estate activities);

551 - 5510: Short-term accommodation activities

This class includes:

- Provision of accommodation, typically on a daily or weekly basis, principally for short stay by tourists or visitors. This includes furnished guest rooms and suites or complete self-contained units with kitchens and related utensils, with or without daily housekeeping services. It and may include a range of additional services such as food and beverage services, parking, laundry services, swimming pools and gym rooms, recreational facilities and conference rooms and convention facilities.

- Accommodation activities of: hotels, resort hotels, suites or apartment hotels, guesthouses, motels, rooms for rent, trailer parks, youth hostels, dormitories, cottages.

Exclusion: Leasing of homes, flats or residential units, furnished or unfurnished, for permanent use, typically on a monthly or annual basis, under class 68100 (Trading of own or rented property and land use rights).

55101: Hotels

This class includes the provision of accommodation in hotels, floating hotels, commercial hotels and resort hotels rated 1 to 5 stars and offering 15 or more rooms and comfort facilities and services to travelers. Hotels offer daily housekeeping services and a range of additional services such as food and beverage services, parking, laundry services, swimming pools and gym rooms, recreational facilities and conference rooms and convention facilities.

55102: Villas and apartments providing short-term accommodation

This class includes the provision of accommodation:

- Tourist villas: furnished and serviced low-rise mansions with gardens for tourists;

- Tourist apartments: self-catering furnished apartments with kitchens and related utensils, etc.

55103: Guesthouses and hostels providing short-term accommodation

This class includes the provision of accommodation in furnished guesthouses and hostels that are not qualified to be a hotel. Daily housekeeping services, food and beverage services, parking and laundry facilities, etc. may be offered.

55104: Motels, rooms for rent and similar lodging establishments

This class includes the provision of accommodation in motels and rooms for rent with minimum furnishment.

559 - 5590: Other accommodation

This class includes the provision of short-term or long-term accommodation in single rooms, shared rooms or student residences, school dormitories and rooming houses for migrant workers and other individuals. Also included are trailer parks and campgrounds.

55901: Student residences

This class includes the provision by separate units of long-term accommodation (e.g. dormitories) to students attending secondary schools, colleges and universities.

55902: Trailer parks, tents and bivouac facilities

This class includes the provision of fabric or canvas shelters accommodating short-stay visitors in campgrounds and outdoor recreational camps.

55909: Other accommodation not elsewhere classified

This class includes the provision of short-term or long-term accommodation: workers hostels, railway sleeping cars, and other accommodation not classified in other classes.

56: FOD AND BEVERAGE SERVICES

This division includes the provision of food and beverages to served or self-served customers for immediate consumption on premises with or without seating or for taking away. The decisive factor is the characteristics of food and beverages offered but not the type of facilities providing them.

Exclusion:

- Production of meals not fit for immediate consumption or of prepared food not considered as a ready-made meal, under divisions 10 (Manufacture of food products) and 11 (Manufacture of beverages);

- Sale of food that is not produced by the vendor and is not considered as meal(s) fit for immediate consumption, under section G (Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles).

561 - 5610: Restaurants and mobile food services

This class includes the provision of food and beverage services to customers, whether they are served while seated or serve themselves from a display of items, whether they eat the prepared meals on the premises, or take them away. This includes the preparation and serving of meals from motorized vehicles or non-motorized carts.

This class includes:

- Restaurants;

- Self-service cafeterias;

- Fast-food restaurants;

- Take-out eating places;

- Ice cream trucks;

- Mobile food carts;

- Street vendors and market stalls.

The class also includes restaurant and bar activities, when carried out by separate units, on board ships or means of transport.

Exclusion: Operation of food concession, under class 56290 (Other food services)

56101: Restaurants

This class includes the provision of food and beverage services in restaurants and eateries. Customers are served while seated or serve themselves from a display of items, whether they eat the meals on the premise or take them out.

56109: Other mobile food services

This class includes the preparation and serving of meals from motorized vehicles or non-motorized carts: ice cream trucks and food carts.

562: Event catering and other food services

This class includes catering activities on a contract basis for events such as meetings, family parties, wedding parties, etc. or for a specified period of time and the operation of food concessions for sporting events or similar facilities.

5621 - 56210: Event catering (for parties, meetings, weddings, etc.)

This class includes the provision of food services based on contractual arrangements with the customer, at the location specified by the customer, for the customer’s events such as business meetings, weddings or family events, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of perishable food items for resale, under class 10790 (Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified);

- Retail sale of perishable food items, under division 47 (Retail trade, except motor vehicles and motorcycles).

5629 - 56290: Other food services

This class includes the provision of food services based on contractual arrangements with the customer, for a specific period of time.

The class also includes:

- Operation of food concessions at sporting events or similar events for a specific period of time. The food is often prepared in the service provider’s premises then carried to locations where services are provided to customers;

- Activities of food service contractors, e.g. provision of meals for airlines or railway companies, etc.;

- Operation of food concessions at sporting events and similar events.

- Operation of canteens and self-service cafeterias (e.g. for offices, factories, hospitals and schools) on a concession basis.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of perishable food items for resale, under class 10790 (Manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified);

- Retail sale of perishable food items, under division 47 (Retail trade, except motor vehicles and motorcycles).

563 - 5630: Beverage serving activities

This class includes the preparation and serving of beverages for immediate consumption in bars, taverns, discotheques (with predominant serving of beverages), beer parlors and pubs, coffee shops, fruit juice bars and other vendors of drinks such as: vendors of sugarcane juices, smoothies or sweet dessert soups, mobile beverage vendors, etc.

Exclusion:

- Resale of bottled, canned or boxed beverages, under classes 47110 (Retail sale of food, beverages or tobacco predominating in non-specialized stores), 47230 (Retail sale of beverages in specialized stores), 47813 (Retail sale of beverages via stalls or markets) and 47990 (Other retail sale not elsewhere classified);

- Operation of discotheques and dance floors without beverage serving, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

56301: Taverns and bars

This class includes the activities of taverns serving beverages for immediate consumption on the premise: spirits, wines, cocktails, beers, etc.

Exclusion: Provision of food, as predominant serving, and alcoholic beverages, under class 56101 (Restaurants)

56309: Other beverage serving activities

This class includes the preparation and serving of beverages for immediate consumption of: coffee, smoothies, sugarcane juice, fruit juices or sweet dessert soups.

The class also includes the activities of mobile beverage vendors.

J: INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION

58: PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES

This division includes:

- Publishing of books, calendars, leaflets, dictionaries, textbooks, atlases, maps and charts; publishing of newspapers, journals and periodicals; publishing of directories and mailing lists, other publishing activities, as well as software publishing.

- Publishing includes the acquisition of copyrights to content (information products) and making this content available to the general public by engaging in (or arranging for) the reproduction and distribution of this content in various forms. All the feasible forms of publishing (in print, electronic or audio form, on the Internet, as multimedia products such as CD-ROM reference books, etc.), except publishing of motion pictures, are included in this division.

Exclusion: publishing of motion pictures, video tapes and movies on DVD or similar media, under division 59 (Motion picture, television program production, sound recording and music publishing activities); production of master copies for audio recordings, under division 59 (Motion picture, television program production, sound recording and music publishing activities); printing under class 18110 (Printing) and mass reproduction of recorded media under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media).

581: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities

This class includes the activities of publishing books, newspapers, magazines and other periodicals, directories and mailing lists, and other works such as photos, engravings, postcards, timetables, forms, posters and reproduction of paintings.

These works are characterized by the intellectual creativity required in their development and are usually protected by copyright.

5811 - 58110: Book publishing

This class includes the activities of publishing books in print, electronic (CD, electronic displays, etc.) or audio form or on the Internet.

This class includes:

- Publishing of books, calendars, leaflets and similar publications, including publishing of dictionaries and textbooks.

- Publishing of atlases, maps and charts;

- Publishing of audio books;

- Publishing of textbooks, etc. on CD-ROM.

Exclusion:

- Manufacture of globes, under class 32900 (Other manufacture not elsewhere classified);

- Publishing of advertising material, under class 58190 (Other publishing activities);

- Publishing of music and sheet books, under class 59200 (Sound recording and music publishing activities);

- Activities of independent authors, under group 749 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified) and class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities).

5812 - 58120: Publishing of directories and mailing lists

This class includes the activities of publishing of lists of facts or information that is protected in their form but not in their content. These lists can be published in printed or electronic form, including mailing lists, telephone books, directories and compilations, such as legal cases, pharmaceutical compendia, etc.

5813 - 58130: Publishing of newspapers, journals and periodicals

This class includes the activities of publishing of newspapers, including advertising newspapers, periodicals and other journals. Publishing can be done in print or electronic form, including publishing on the Internet. Also included is the publishing of radio and television schedules.

5819 - 58190: Other publishing activities

This class includes:

- Publishing of catalogs, photos, engravings and postcards, greeting cards, forms, posters, reproductions of works of art, advertising materials and other printed matter;

- Online publishing of statistics or other information.

Exclusion:

- Retail sale of software, under class 4741 (Retail sale of computers, peripheral equipment, software and telecommunications equipment in specialized stores);

- Publishing of advertising newspapers, under class 58130 (Publishing of newspapers, journals and periodicals);

- Online provision of software (application hosting and provision of application services), under class 63110 (Data processing, hosting and related activities).

582 - 5820 - 58200: Software publishing

This class includes the activities of publishing of ready-made (non-customized) software: operating systems, business and other applications, computer games.

Exclusion:

- Reproduction of software, under class 58200 (Software publishing);

- Retail sale of non-customized software, under class 4741 (Retail sale of computers, peripheral equipment, software and telecommunications equipment in specialized stores);

- Production of software not associated with publishing, under class 62010 (Computer programming activities);

- Online provision of software (application hosting and provision of application services), under class 63110 (Data processing, hosting and related activities).

59: MOTION PICTURE, TELEVISION PROGRAM PRODUCTION, SOUND RECORDING AND MUSIC PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES

This division includes:

- Production of theatrical and non-theatrical motion pictures and television programs on film, videotape, disc or other materials for direct projection in theatres or for broadcasting on television.

- Supporting activities such as film editing, cutting, dubbing, etc.;

- Distribution of motion pictures and other film productions to other industries;

- Projection of motion pictures.

This division also includes:

- Buying and selling of distribution rights for motion pictures or other film productions;

- Sound recording activities, e.g. production of original sound recordings, releasing, promoting and distributing them, publishing of music as well as sound recording activities in a studio or elsewhere.

591: Motion picture and television program production activities

This class includes:

- Production of theatrical and non-theatrical motion pictures on film, videotape, disc or other media, including digital distribution, for direct projection in theatres or for broadcasting on television;

- Supporting activities such as film editing, cutting, dubbing, etc.;

- Distribution of motion pictures or other film productions (video tapes, DVDs, etc.); as well as their projection.

The class also includes the activities of buying and selling of distribution rights for motion pictures or other film productions.

5911: Motion picture, video and television program production activities

This class includes:

- Production of motion pictures, videos, television programs or television commercials;

- Production of television programs and commercials without the use of radio and television media, and other activities of motion picture storage.

Exclusion:

- Film duplicating (except reproduction of motion picture film for theatrical distribution) as well as reproduction of audio and video tapes, CDs or DVDs from master copies, under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media);

- Wholesale of recorded video tapes, CDs and DVDs, under class 46499 (Wholesale of other household goods not elsewhere classified);

- Wholesale of blank video tapes and DVDs, under class 46520 (Wholesale of electronic and telecommunications equipment and parts);

- Retail sale of video tapes, CDs and DVDs, under class 47620 (Retail sale of audio and video tapes and discs, including blank tapes and discs, in specialized stores);

- Post-production activities, under class 59120 (Post-production activities);

- Sound recording and recording of books on tape, under class 59200 (Sound recording and music publishing activities);

- Television broadcasting, under group 602 (Television programming and broadcasting activities);

- Film processing other than for the motion picture industry, under class 74200 (Photographic activities);

- Activities of personal theatrical or artistic agents or agencies, under class 74909 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

- Renting of video tapes and DVDs to the general public, under class 77220 (Renting of video tapes and discs);

- Real-time (simultaneous) captioning of live television performances, conferences, etc., under class 82990 (Other business support service activities not elsewhere classified);

- Activities of actors, cartoonists, directors, stage designers and technical specialists, under class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities).

59111: Motion picture production activities

This class includes the production of motion pictures on film stock for theatrical or non-theatrical distribution.

59112: Video production activities

This class includes the production of videos on tape, disc or other media.

59113: Television program production activities

This class includes the production of television programs and commercials, etc. for their projection on television.

5912 - 59120: Post-production activities

This class includes editing, film/tape transfers, titling, subtitling, credits (introduction of actors, actresses, directors, cameramen, etc.), captioning, computer-produced graphics, animation and special effects, developing and processing motion picture film, activities of motion picture film laboratories and activities of special laboratories for animated films.

Exclusion:

- Film duplicating (except reproduction of motion picture film for theatrical distribution) as well as reproduction of audio and video tapes, CDs or DVDs from master copies, under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media);

- Wholesale of recorded video tapes, CDs and DVDs, under class 46499 (Wholesale of other household goods not elsewhere classified);

- Wholesale of blank video tapes and DVDs, under class 46520 (Wholesale of electronic and telecommunications equipment and parts);

- Retail sale of video tapes, CDs and DVDs, under class 47260 (Retail sale of audio and video tapes and discs, including blank tapes and discs, in specialized stores);

- Film processing other than for the motion picture industry, under class 74200 (Photographic activities);

- Renting of video tapes and DVDs to the general public, under class 77220 (Renting of video tapes and discs);

- Activities of actors, cartoonists, directors, stage designers and technical specialists, under class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities).

5911: Motion picture, video and television program distribution activities

This class includes:

- Distributing films, video tapes, DVDs and similar productions to motion picture theatres, television networks and stations and cinema exhibitors;

- Acquiring distribution rights for films, video tapes and DVDs.

Exclusion: Film duplicating and reproduction of video and audio tapes, CDs or DVDs from master copies, under class 18200 (Reproduction of recorded media);

5914: Motion picture projection activities

This class includes:

- Projection of motion pictures and videos in cinemas, in the open air or in other projection facilities;

- Activities of cinema clubs.

59141: Theatrical film projection

This class includes the activities of cinema exhibitors in stationary theaters that have cinema halls, seating, convenience facilities for the audience, and projection booths. There are also regular activities and ticket booths (motion picture theaters).

59142: Non-theatrical film projection

This class includes the activities of itinerant cinema exhibitors that have specialized personnel, regular cinema projection schedules and related equipment such as: projectors, electric generators, for regular screening of films to the general public. (Predominant projection of motion pictures on film stock).

592 - 5920 - 59200: Sound recording and music publishing activities

This class includes:

- Production of original sound master recordings, such as tapes and CDs;

- Publishing, promoting and distributing sound recordings to wholesalers, retailers or directly to the public. A unit may or may not conduct such activities simultaneously with the production of original sound master recordings. Otherwise, the unit engaged in such activities must have the right to reproduce and distribute original sound master recordings;

- Sound recording activities in a studio or elsewhere, including the production of taped (i.e. non-live) radio programs;

- Music publishing, such as activities of acquiring and registering copyrights for musical compositions, promoting, authorizing and using these compositions in recordings, radio, television, motion pictures, live performances, print and other media. Units engaged in these activities may own the copyright or act as administrator of the music copyrights on behalf of the copyright owners.

- Publishing of music and sheet books.

60: PROGRAMMING AND BROADCASTING ACTIVITIES

This division includes:

- Activities of creating content or acquiring the right to distribute content and subsequently broadcasting that content, such as radio, television and data programs of entertainment, news, weather forecast,  talks, etc.;

- Data broadcasting, typically on radio or television. The broadcasting can be performed via different technologies, over-the-air, via satellite, via a cable network or via Internet.

- Production of programs that are typically narrowcast in nature (limited format, such as news, sports, education or youth-oriented programming) on a fee or subscription basis, to a third party, for subsequent broadcasting to the public.

Exclusion: Distribution of cable and subscription programs, under division 61 (Telecommunications).

601 - 6010 - 60100: Radio broadcasting

This class includes:

- Broadcasting audio signals through radio stations utilizing broadcasting studios and facilities for the transmission of aural programming to the public, to affiliates or to subscribers;

- Activities of radio networks, e.g. receiving and transmitting aural programming to the affiliates or subscribers via over-the-air broadcasts, cable or satellite;

- Radio broadcasting activities over the Internet (Internet radio stations);

- Data broadcasting integrated with radio broadcasting.

Exclusion: Production of taped radio programming, under class 59200 (Sound recording and music publishing activities).

602: Television programming and broadcasting activities

This group includes:

- Creation of a complete television channel program, from purchased program components (e.g. movies, documentaries, etc.), self-produced program components (e.g. local news) or a combination thereof;

- This complete television program can be either broadcasted by the producing unit or produced for transmission by third party distributors, such as cable companies or satellite television providers.

- Data broadcasting integrated with television broadcasting.

6021 - 60210: Television programming

This class includes:

- Broadcasting of images together with sound and data on television channels through television broadcasting studios and public television transmission facilities. This includes scheduling and transmitting programs. Programming may originate from one’s own studio or from external sources;

- Transmission of television programming to television stations, which in turn broadcast the programs to the public of a predetermined schedule.

Exclusion: Production of television programs and commercials not integrated with broadcasting, under class 5911 (Motion picture, video and television program activities).

6022 - 60220: Cable, satellite and other subscription programming

This class includes the development of channels or arranging of images, sound and data for transmission on a subscription basis to a third party, such as cable television companies or satellite television providers. Programming may originate from one’s own studio or from external sources. Programming typically specializes in news, sports, education, youth-oriented programs in limited time format: subscription programming of sports, cinematic content and news.

Exclusion:

- Production of television program elements (e.g. movies, documentaries, commercials), under class 5911 (Motion picture, video and television program activities).

- Scheduling programs for direct transmission of programming to the public viewers, under class 60210 (Television programming);

- Assembly of a package of channels and distribution of that package via cable or satellite to viewers, under division 61 (Telecommunications).

61: TELECOMMUNICATIONS

This division includes:

- Activities of providing telecommunications and related service activities, e.g. transmitting voice, image, data and text. The transmission facilities that carry out these activities may be based on a single technology or a combination of technologies. The commonality of activities classified in this division is the content, without being involved in its creation. The breakdown in this division is based on the type of infrastructure operated to implement such activities;

- In the case of transmission of television signals, this may include the bundling of complete programming channels, produced in division 60, into program packages for distribution.

611 - 6110 - 61100: Wired telecommunications activities

This class includes:

- Operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, sound and image via a wired telecommunications infrastructure. The transmission facilities that carry out these activities may be based on a single technology or a combination of technologies.

- Operating and maintaining facilities of switching and transmission to provide point-to-point communications via landlines, microwave or a combination of landlines and satellite linkups;

- Operating of cable distribution systems (e.g. for distribution of data and television signals);

- Furnishing telegraph and other non-vocal communications via one’s own facilities.

The class also includes:

- Purchasing access to telecommunications infrastructure from external sources and utilizing such access to provide telecommunications services to organizations, companies and individuals;

- Provision of Internet access via a wired telecommunications network.

Exclusion: Reselling network capacity (without providing services), under class 61909 (Other telecommunications activities not elsewhere classified).

612 - 6120 - 61200: Wireless telecommunications activities

This class includes the activities of operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, sound and image via a wireless telecommunications infrastructure. The transmission facilities provide omni-directional transmission via airwaves and may be based on a single technology or a combination of technologies. Maintaining and operating cellular paging and other wireless telecommunications networks

The class also includes the activities of purchasing access to telecommunications infrastructure from external sources and utilizing such access to provide wireless telecommunications services (except satellite) to organizations, companies and individuals; Provision of Internet access via a wireless telecommunications network.

Exclusion: Reselling network capacity (without providing services), under class 61909 (Other telecommunications activities not elsewhere classified).

613 - 6130 - 61300: Satellite telecommunications activities

This class includes the activities of operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, sound and image via a satellite telecommunications infrastructure.

The class also includes:

- Delivery of visual, aural or original programming received from cable networks, local television stations or radio networks to households via satellite systems. The units classified here do not generally create programming material;

- Provision of Internet access via a satellite telecommunications network.

Exclusion: Reselling network capacity (without providing services), under class 61909 (Other telecommunications activities not elsewhere classified).

619 - 6190: Other telecommunications activities

This class includes:

- Provision of specialized telecommunications applications, such as satellite tracking, communications telemetry, and radar station operations;

- Operation of satellite terminal stations and associated facilities connected with one or more terrestrial communications systems and capable of transmitting or receiving telecommunications to and from satellite systems;

- Provision of Internet access over networks between the client and the ISP, which are not owned or controlled by the ISP, such as dial-up Internet access;

- Provision of telecommunications services over existing telecom connections such as VOIP (Voice Over Internet Protocol);

- Reselling telecommunications network capacity (without providing services).

Exclusion: Provision of Internet access by operators of telecommunications infrastructure, under classes 61100 (Wired telecommunications activities), 61200 (Wireless telecommunications activities) and 61300 (Satellite telecommunications activities).

61901: Internet access points

This class includes the activities of intermediate providers of Internet access to individual customers.

Exclusion: activities of Internet cafés providing Internet access as an auxiliary service to their customers, under class 56309 (Other beverage serving activities).

61909: Other telecommunications activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Provision of specialized telecommunications applications, such as satellite tracking, communications telemetry, and radar station operations;

- Operation of satellite terminal stations and associated facilities connected with one or more terrestrial communications systems and capable of transmitting or receiving telecommunications to and from satellite systems;

- Provision of telecommunications services over existing telecom connections such as VOIP (Voice Over Internet Protocol);

- Reselling telecommunications network capacity (without providing services).

Exclusion:

- Provision of Internet access by operators of telecommunications infrastructure, under classes 61100 (Wired telecommunications activities), 61200 (Wireless telecommunications activities) and 61300 (Satellite telecommunications activities).

- Internet access points, under class 61901 (Internet access points).

62: COMPUTER PROGRAMMING, CONSULTANCY AND RELATED ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of providing services in the field of information technologies: writing, modifying, testing and supporting software; planning and designing computer systems that integrate computer hardware, software and communication technologies; management and operation of clients' computer systems and data processing facilities; and other professional and technical computer-related activities.

620: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities

6201 - 62010: Computer programming

This class includes the activities of writing, modifying, testing and supporting software to meet the needs of a particular customer.

The class also includes the activities of programming of embedded software.

Exclusion:

- Publishing of software, under class 58200 (Software publishing);

- Planning and designing computer systems that integrate computer hardware, software and communication technologies, even though providing software might be an integral part, under class 62020 (Computer consultancy and computer system management).

6202 - 62020: Computer consultancy and computer system management

This class includes the activities of planning and designing of computer systems that integrate computer hardware, software and communication technologies. The units classified in this class may provide the hardware and software components of the system as part of their integrated services or these components may be provided by third parties or vendors. Such units often install the system, train, guide and support the users of the system.

The class also includes the management and operation of clients' computer systems and/or data processing facilities, as well as professional and other related activities.

6209 - 62090: Other information technology and computer service activities

This class includes other information technology and computer related activities not elsewhere classified, such as: computer disaster recovery and software installation.

Exclusion:

- Computer programming, under class 62010 (Computer programming);

- Computer consultancy, under class 62020 (Computer consultancy and computer system management);

- Computer system management, under class 62020 (Computer consultancy and computer system management);

- Data processing and hosting, under class 63110 (Data processing, hosting and related activities).

63: INFORMATION SERVICE ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of information portals, data processing and hosting activities, as well as other activities that primarily supply information.

631: Data processing, hosting and related activities, information portals
