This class includes the provision of infrastructure for hosting, data processing services and related activities, as well as the provision of search facilities and other portals for the Internet.

6311 - 63110: Data processing, hosting and related activities

This class includes the provision of infrastructure for hosting, data processing services and related activities, such as: specialized hosting activities including as web hosting, streaming services or application hosting and time-share provision of mainframe facilities to clients. Data processing activities including complete processing of data and generation of specialized reports from data supplied by clients, or data entry and automated data processing services.

6312 - 63120: Information portals

This class includes the operation of websites that use a search engine to generate and maintain extensive databases of Internet addresses and content in an easily searchable format.

The class also includes the operation of other websites that act as portals to the Internet, such as news or media sites providing periodically updated content.

632: Other information service activities

This class includes the activities of news agencies, libraries, archives and all other remaining information service activities.

6321 - 63210: News agency activities

This class includes the activities of press syndicates and news agencies furnishing news, pictures and videos to the media.

Exclusion:

- Activities of independent photo journalists, under class 74200 (Photographic activities);

- Activities of independent journalists, under class 9000 (Activities of independent journalists).

6329 - 63290: Other information service activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes other information service activities not elsewhere classified, such as:

- Telephone-based information services;

- Information search services provided on a contract or fee basis;

- News clipping services, press clipping services, etc.

Exclusion: activities of call centers, under class 82200 (Activities of call centers)

K: FINANCIAL, BANKING AND INSURANCE ACTIVITIES

This section includes service activities of finance, banking, insurance, reinsurance and social insurance (pension) and similar activities such as financial intermediary, and activities to support financial services.

This section also includes the activities of holding assets: activities of holding companies and the activities of trusts, funds and similar financial entities.

64: FINANCIAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES (EXCEPT PRIVATE AND SOCIAL INSURANCE)

This division includes banking and financial service activities.

Exclusion:

- Social insurance activities, under class 65300 (Social insurance);

- Compulsory social insurance, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security activities).

641: Monetary intermediation

This group includes:

- Central banking activities that include establishing monetary policies, issuing currency, managing foreign exchange activities, controlling international reserves, supervising operations of banking institutions, etc.;

- Activities of juridical persons that locate permanently and operate in the banking sector; including their accepting credits in their accounts to acquire monetary assets to participate in monetary activities of the market. The nature of such units' activities is providing creditors’ capital to debtors by receiving, converting or rearranging capital resources from creditors to meet debtors’ needs.

6411 - 64110: Central banking

This class includes the activities of a central bank:

- Issuing currency;

- Acting as a banking agent to credit institutions (i.e. taking deposits that are used for clearance between credit institutions; refinancing credit institutions to provide short-term credits and payment instruments to the economy);

- Managing foreign exchange activities and controlling international reserves;

- Supervising banking operations;

- Acting as a banker to the government.

6419 - 64190: Other monetary intermediation

This class includes the activities of companies and credit institutions legally incorporated to trade in currency, perform banking services such as receiving and utilizing deposits to grant credits, and provide payment services (except financial leasing). Activities classified in this class involve commercial banking, development banking, investment banking, policy-implementing banking, cooperative banking, financial company, people’s credit funds, postal saving service provider, credit unions, etc.

The class also includes:

- Postal savings bank activities and postal giro;

- Credit granting for house purchase by specialized deposit-taking institutions.

Exclusion:

- Credit granting for house purchase by specialized non-depository institutions, under class 64920 (Other credit granting);

- Credit card transaction processing and settlement activities, under class 66190 (Other activities auxiliary to financial services not elsewhere classified).

642 - 6420 - 64200: activities of holding companies

This class includes the activities of companies holding assets of a group of subsidiary corporations and conducting the principal activity of managing the group. The holding companies in this class do not provide any other service to the businesses in which the equity is held, i.e. they do not administer or manage other units.

Exclusion: Management of companies and enterprises, strategic planning and corporate decision making, under class 70100 (Activities of head offices).

643 - 6430 - 64300: Trusts, funds and similar financial entities

This class includes the activities of juridical persons established to pool securities or other financial assets, without managing, on behalf of shareholders or beneficiaries. These entities earn interest, dividends and other property income, but have few or no employees and no revenue from the sale of services.

Exclusion:

- Funds and trusts that earn revenue from the sale of goods or services, which are classified according accordingly in the standard industrial classification system;

- Activities of holding companies, under class 64200 (Activities of holding companies);

- Social insurance, under class 65300 (Social insurance);

- Management of funds, under class 66300 (Fund management activities).

649: Other financial service activities (except private and social insurance)

This class includes financial service activities other than those conducted by monetary institutions.

Exclusion: Insurance and pension funding activities, under division 65 (Insurance, reinsurance and social insurance, except compulsory social insurance).

6491 - 64910: Financial leasing

This class includes short-term and medium-term credit activities of leasing of machinery, equipment, means of transports and movable property on a contract basis between the lessor and the lessee. The lessor undertakes to purchase, at the lessee’s requests, machinery, equipment, means of transport and other movable property and holds ownership of assets leased. The lessee utilizes the rented assets and pay the rent for the entire term of the lease agreed by the parties involved.

Exclusion: Operational leasing, under division 77 (Leasing of machinery and equipment without an operator); leasing of personal and household goods; leasing of non-financial intangible assets), according to type of goods leased.

6492 - 64920: Other credit granting

This class includes financial service activities primarily concerned with making loans by institutions not involved in monetary intermediation (e.g. venture capital companies, specialized banks, investment clubs). Provision of the following services:

- Granting of consumer credit;

- International trade financing;

- Provision of long-term finances by specialized banks;

- Lending of money outside the banking system;

- Credit granting for house purchase by non-depository institutions;

- Pawnbroker’s activities.

Exclusion:

- Credit granting for house purchase by specialized institutions that also take deposits, under class 64190 (Other monetary intermediation);

- Operational leasing, under division 77 (Leasing of machinery and equipment without an operator); leasing of personal and household goods; leasing of non-financial intangible assets), according to type of goods leased.

6499 - 64990: Other financial service activities not elsewhere classified (except private and social insurance)

This class includes other financial intermediation activities primarily concerned with distributing funds other than by making loans:

- Factoring activities;

- Writing of swaps, options and other hedging arrangements;

- Activities of payment settlement companies, etc.

Exclusion:

- Financial leasing, under class 64910 (Financial leasing);

- Security dealing on behalf of others, under class 66120 (Security and commodity contracts brokerage);

- Trade, leasing and lending of tangible fixed property, under division 68 (Real estate activities);

- Bill collection without buying entire debt, under class 82910 (Activities of collection agencies and credit bureaus);

- Grant-giving activities by membership organizations, under class 94990 (Activities of other membership organizations not elsewhere classified).

65: INSURANCE, REINSURANCE AND SOCIAL INSURANCE (EXCEPT COMPULSORY SOCIAL INSURANCE)

This division includes:

- Insurance purchasing and annuitization, insurance policies and investing premiums to build up a portfolio of financial assets to be used against future claims;

- Direct insurance and reinsurance.

651: Insurance

This group includes the activities of life insurance and life reinsurance, with or without a savings element, and other non-life insurance.

The group also includes the activities of juridical persons (funds, plans or programs) organized to provide retirement income benefits for workers or members.

6511 - 65110: Life insurance

This class includes the collection of insurance premiums and payment of annuities and life insurance policies, illness insurance policies, accidental death and dismemberment insurance policies (with or without a savings element).

6512: Non-life insurance

This class includes the provision of insurance services other than life insurance: accident and fire insurance; health insurance; travel insurance; property insurance; motor, marine, aviation and transport insurance; pecuniary loss and financial liability insurance.

65121: Health insurance

This class includes the collection of premiums for health insurance and making of payments for health services and medications for contributors to health insurance at regulated medical facilities that provide examinations and treatments to health insurance contributors.

65129: Other non-life insurance

This class includes the collection of premiums for accident and property insurance (e.g. automobile, ship and transport insurance), money insurance, etc. and settlement of payments for customers incurring property or monetary damage as a result of external factors to the extent defined by non-life insurance organizations.

652 - 6520 - 65200: Reinsurance

This class includes the activities of insuring all or part of the risk associated with existing insurance policies originally underwritten by other insurance carriers.

653 - 6530 - 65300: Social insurance

This class includes the activities of juridical persons (funds, plans or programs) organized to provide retirement income benefits exclusively for workers or members.

The class also includes the activities of pension plans with defined benefits, as well as individual plans where benefits are defined through the member's contribution. It includes employee benefit plans, pension plans and funds, and retirement plans.

Exclusion:

- Management of pension funds, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security activities);

- Compulsory social security schemes, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security activities).

66: OTHER FINANCIAL ACTIVITIES

This division includes the provision of services involved in or closely related to financial intermediation; however, such services themselves are not financial intermediation. The primary breakdown of this division is subject to the type of financial transaction or funding served.

661: activities auxiliary to financial service activities (except private and social insurance)

6611 - 66110: Administration of financial markets

This class includes the operation and supervision of financial markets other than by public authorities, such as: commodity contracts exchanges; futures commodity contracts exchanges; security exchanges; stock exchanges; commodity or stock options exchanges.

6612 - 66120: Commodity and security contracts brokerage

This class includes:

- Dealing in financial markets on behalf of others (e.g. stockbrokers’ activities) and related activities;

- Securities brokerage;

- Commodity contracts brokerage;

- Activities of bureaux de change, etc.

Exclusion: Dealing in markets on one’s own account, under class 64990 (Other financial service activities not elsewhere classified).

6619 - 66190: Other activities auxiliary to financial service activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes the activities auxiliary to financial service activities not elsewhere classified:

- Financial transaction negotiating and settlement activities, including credit card transactions;

- Investment advisory services;

- Activities of mortgage advisers and brokers.

The class also includes fiduciary and custody services provided on a fee or contract basis.

Exclusion:

- Activities of insurance agents and brokers, under class 66220 (Activities of insurance agents and brokers);

- Management of funds, under class 66300 (Fund management activities).

662: activities auxiliary to private and social insurance

This class includes the activities of agents (i.e. broker) in selling annuities and insurance policies or providing other employee benefits and insurance related services such as claims adjustment and insurance selling administration.

6621 - 66210: Risk and damage evaluation

This class includes the provision of administration services of insurance, such as assessing and settling insurance claims:

- Assessing insurance claims: claims adjusting; risk assessing; risk and damage evaluation; average and loss adjusting;

- Settling insurance claims.

Exclusion:

- Appraisal of fixed assets, under class 68200 (Real estate consultancy, brokerage and auctioning, land use right auctioning);

- Appraisal for other purposes, under class 7490 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

- Investigation activities, under class 80300 (Investigation activities).

6622 - 66220: activities of insurance agents and brokers

This class includes the activities of insurance agents and brokers (insurance intermediaries) in selling, negotiating or advising of insurance policies.

6629 - 66290: Other activities auxiliary to private and social insurance

This class includes the activities involved in or closely related to insurance and pension funding (except financial intermediation, claims adjusting and activities of insurance agents): salvage administration, insurance statistics.

Exclusion: Marine salvage activities, under class 5222 (Service activities incidental to inland water transportation).

663 - 6630 - 66300: Fund management activities

This class includes portfolio and fund management activities on a fee or contract basis: Management of mutual or other investment funds.

L: REAL ESTATE ACTIVITIES

This section includes the activities of lessors, agents and brokers in one or more of the following: selling or buying real estate, leasing real estate, providing other real estate services such as appraising real estate or acting as real estate brokers.

This section also includes:

- Purchasing or renting property on a fee or contract basis;

- Building of structures, combined with maintaining ownership or leasing of such structures;

- Real estate management.

68: REAL ESTATE ACTIVITIES

681 - 6810 - 68100: Trading of own or rented property and land use rights

This class includes the activities of buying, selling, leasing and operating of self-owned, self-used or leased property, such as:

- Apartment buildings and other dwellings;

- Non-residential buildings: exhibition halls, warehouses, malls and shopping centers;

- Land;

- Provision of homes and furnished or unfurnished flats for more permanent use, typically on a monthly or annual basis.

The class also includes:

- Buying, selling, leasing and managing subdivision lots;

- Buying, selling, leasing and managing residential mobile home sites.

Exclusion:

- Development of building projects for sale, under class 4100 (Construction of buildings);

- Subdividing and improving of land, under class 42900 (Construction of other civil engineering projects);

- Operation of hotels, hostels, campgrounds and other non-residential buildings or short-stay rooms for rent, under classes 55101 (Hotels), 55102 (Villas and apartments providing short-term accommodation) and 55103 (Guesthouses and hostels providing short-term accommodation);

- Operation of hotels and similar accommodation, under classes 55101 (Hotels) and 55102 (Villas and apartments providing short-term accommodation).

682 - 6820 - 68200: Real estate consultancy, brokerage and auctioning, land use right auctioning

This class includes the provision of real estate activities on a fee or contract basis including property-related services.

- Activities of real estate agents and brokers;

- Intermediation in buying, selling and leasing of real estate on a fee or contract basis;

- Management of real estate on a fee or contract basis;

- Real estate appraisal services;

- Activities of real estate trading floors.

Exclusion:

- Legal activities, under class 69100 (Legal activities);

- Facilities support services, under class 81100 (Combined support activities);

- Management of facilities, such as military bases, prisons and other facilities (except computer facilities management), under class 81100 (Combined support activities).

M: PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL ACTIVITIES

This section includes specialized professional, scientific and technological activities. These activities require a high degree of training, and make specialized knowledge and skills available to users.

69: LEGAL, ACCOUNTING AND AUDIT ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of legal representation of one party's interest against another party, whether or not before courts or other judicial bodies by, or under supervision of, persons related to the court, such as advising and representation in civil cases and in criminal actions, etc.

This division also includes:

- Preparation of legal documents such as terms and articles, partnership agreements or similar documents in connection with company formation, patents and copyrights, preparation of deeds, wills, trusts, as well as other activities of notaries public, civil law notaries, bailiffs, arbitrators, examiners and referees.

- Auditing and bookkeeping services such as reviewing of accounting records, designing audit systems, preparing financial statements and bookkeeping.

691 - 6910: Legal activities

This class includes:

- Legal representation of one party's interest against another party, whether or not before courts or other judicial bodies by, or under supervision of, persons related to the court, such as advising and representation in civil cases and in criminal actions, etc.;

- Other activities of notaries public, civil law notaries, bailiffs, arbitrators, examiners and referees.

Exclusion: Law court activities, under class 84230 (Public order and safety activities).

69101: Legal representation and counseling

This class includes the activities of legal representation of one party's interest against another party, whether or not before courts or other judicial bodies by, or under supervision of, persons related to the court:

- Advising and representation in civil cases;

- Advising and representation in criminal cases;

- Advising and representation in connection with labor disputes;

- General counseling and advising, preparation of legal documents;

- Arranging terms and articles, partnership agreements or similar documents in connection with company formation.

69102: Notary and certification activities

This class includes:

- Activities of protecting patents and copyrights;

- Activities of notarizing property mortgage contracts, wills, etc.

69109: Other legal activities

This class includes other activities of notaries public, civil law notaries, bailiffs, arbitrators, examiners and referees.

692 - 6920 - 69200: Accounting and auditing activities, tax consultancy

This class includes:

- Recording of commercial transactions from businesses;

- Preparation or auditing of financial accounts;

- Examination of accounts and certification of their accuracy;

- Preparation of personal and business income tax data;

- Advisory activities and representation (except legal representation) on behalf of clients before tax authorities.

Exclusion:

- Data processing and tabulation activities, under class 63110 (Data processing, hosting and related activities);

- Management consultancy, such as design of accounting systems, cost accounting programs, budgetary control procedures, under class 70200 (Management consultancy activities);

- Bill collection, under class 82910 (Activities of collection agencies and credit bureaus);

70: activities OF HEAD OFFICES; MANAGEMENT CONSULTANCY ACTIVITIES

This division includes the provision of advice and assistance to businesses and other organizations on management issues: strategic planning; financial planning and budgeting; marketing objectives and policies; human resource policies, practicing of plans; production scheduling; and control planning.

This division also includes the activities of overseeing and managing of other units of the same company or enterprise, i.e. the activities of head offices.

701 - 7010 - 70100: Activities of head offices

This class includes the activities of overseeing and managing of other units of the company or enterprise; undertaking the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Units classified here are put under day-to-day operation and management through:

- Head offices;

- Centralized administrative offices;

- Corporate offices;

- District and regional offices;

- Subsidiary management offices.

Exclusion: activities of holding companies, not engaged in managing, under class 64200 (Activities of holding companies);

702 - 7020 - 70200: Management consultancy activities

This class includes the provision of advice, guidance and operational assistance to businesses and other organizations on management issues, such as strategic and organizational planning; decision areas that are financial in nature; marketing objectives and policies; human resource policies, practices and planning; production scheduling and control planning. This provision of business services may include advice, guidance or operational assistance to businesses and the public service regarding:

- Public relations and communication;

- Lobbying activities;

- Design of accounting methods or procedures, cost accounting programs, budgetary control procedures;

- Advice and help to businesses or services in planning, organization, efficiency and management information.

Exclusion:

- Design of computer software for auditing systems, under class 62010 (Computer programming);

- Legal advice and representation, under class 69100 (Legal activities);

- Accounting, auditing activities, tax consulting, under class 69200 (Accounting and auditing activities, tax consultancy);

- Architectural, engineering and other technological advisory activities, under classes 7110 (Architectural and engineering activities and related activities), 7490 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

- Advertising activities, under class 73100 (Advertising);

- Market research and public opinion polling, under class 73200 (Market research and public opinion polling);

- Employment placement and consulting services, under class 78100 (Activities of employment agencies);

- Educational consulting activities, under class 85600 (Educational support activities).

71: ARCHITECTURAL ACTIVITIES; TECHNICAL TESTING AND ANALYSIS

This division includes the provision of architectural services, engineering services, drafting services, building inspection services, surveying and mapping services.

This division also includes physical, chemical, and other technical testing services.

711 - 7110: Architectural activities and related technical consultancy

71101: Architectural activities

This class includes the provision of architectural services, engineering services, drafting services, building inspection services such as:

- Architectural consulting activities: building design and drafting; urban planning and landscape architecture;

- Design of machinery and equipment;

- Engineering design and consulting services for projects involving civil engineering, hydraulic engineering, traffic engineering.

Exclusion:

- Technical testing, under class 71200 (Technical testing and analysis);

- Research and development activities related to engineering, under class 72100 (Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering);

- Interior decorating, under class 74100 (Specialized design activities).

71102: Cartographic surveying activities

This class includes:

- Cartographic surveying and drafting services;

- Mapping and spatial information activities.

71103: Geodetic surveying and water sourcing activities

This class includes:

- Geophysical and seismic surveying;

- Geodetic surveying activities;

- Land and boundary surveying activities;

- Hydrologic surveying activities;

- Subsurface surveying activities.

Exclusion:

- Test drilling in connection with mining operations, under classes 09100 (Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction) and 09900 (Support activities for other mining and quarrying);

- Development or publishing of associated software, under classes 58200 (Software publishing) and 62010 (Computer programming);

- Activities of computer consultants, under class 62020 (Computer consultancy and computer system management) and 62090 (Other information technology and computer service activities);

- Aerial photography, under class 74200 (Photographic activities).

71109: Other related technical consultancy

This class includes:

- Project elaboration and realization relative to electrical and electronic engineering, mining engineering, chemical engineering, pharmaceutical engineering, industrial and systems engineering, safety engineering and water management;

- Elaboration of projects using air conditioning, refrigeration, sanitary and pollution control engineering, acoustical engineering, etc.

712 - 7120 - 71200: Technical testing and analysis

This class includes the performance of physical, chemical and other analytical testing of all types of materials and products:

- Acoustics and vibration testing;

- Testing of composition and purity of minerals, etc.;

- Testing activities in the field of food hygiene, including veterinary testing and control in relation to food production;

- Testing of physical characteristics and performance of materials, such as strength, durability, thickness, radioactivity, etc.

- Qualification and reliability testing;

- Performance testing for complete machinery: motors, automobiles, electrical equipment, etc.;

- Technical testing of welds and joints;

- Failure analysis;

- Testing and measuring of environmental indicators: air and water pollution, etc.;

- Certification of products, including consumer goods, motor vehicles, aircraft, pressurized containers, nuclear plants;

- Periodic road-safety testing of motor vehicles;

- Testing with use of models or mock-ups (e.g. aircraft, ships, dams, etc.)

- Operation of police laboratories.

Exclusion: Testing of animal specimens, under class 75000 (Veterinary activities).

72: SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT

This division includes the activities of three types of research and development:

- Basic research: theoretical and experimental work undertaken primarily to acquire new knowledge of the underlying foundations of phenomena and observable facts, without particular application or use in view;

- Applied research: original investigation undertaken in order to acquire new knowledge, directed primarily towards a specific aim or objective;

- Experimental development: systematic work deriving from existing knowledge gained from research and/or practical experience, directed to producing new materials, products and devices, to installing new processes, systems and services, and to providing auxiliary parts just produced or installed.

Research and experimental development activities in this division are subdivided into two categories: natural sciences and engineering; social sciences and the humanities.

Exclusion: Market research, under class 73200 (Market research and public opinion polling).

721 - 7210 - 72100: Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering

This class includes:

- Research and experimental development on natural science and engineering, except experimental research and development on biotechnology;

- Research and development on natural sciences;

- Research and development on engineering and technology;

- Research and development on medical sciences;

- Research and development on biotechnology;

- Research and development on agricultural sciences;

- Academic research and development, predominantly on natural sciences and engineering.

722 - 7220 - 72200: Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities

This class includes:

- Research and development on social sciences;

- Research and development on humanities;

- Academic research and development, predominantly on social sciences and humanities.

Exclusion: Market research, under class 73200 (Market research and public opinion polling).

73: ADVERTISING AND MARKET RESEARCH

This division includes the creation of advertising campaigns and placement of such advertising in magazines, newspapers, radio and television, or other media as well as the design of display structures and sites.

731 - 7310 - 73100: Advertising

This class includes the provision of a full range of advertising services (through in-house capabilities or subcontracting), including counseling, creative services, production of advertising material, media planning and buying, as follows:

- Creation and realization of advertising campaigns: creating and placing advertising in newspapers, magazines, radio, television, the Internet and other media; placing outdoor advertising, e.g. billboards, panels, bulletins, window dressing, showroom, car and bus, etc; aerial advertising; distribution of advertising material or samples; provision of advertising space on billboards; creation of stands and other display structures and sites;

- Conducting marketing campaigns and other advertising services aimed at attracting and retaining customers: promotion of products; point-of-sale marketing; direct mail advertising; marketing consulting.

Exclusion:

- Publishing of advertising material, under class 58190 (Other publishing activities);

- Production of commercial messages for radio, television or film, under class 59113 (Television program production activities);

- Public-relations activities, under class 70200 (Management consultancy activities);

- Market research, under class 73200 (Market research and public opinion polling);

- Advertising photography, under class 74200 (Photographic activities);

- Organizing of exhibitions and trade shows, under class 82300 (Trade promotion);

- Online mailing activities (e.g. filling addresses, etc.), under class 82990 (Other business support services not elsewhere classified).

732 - 7320 - 73200: Market research and public opinion polling

This class includes:

- Investigation into market potential, acceptance and familiarity of products and buying habits of consumers for the purpose of sales promotion and development of new products, including statistical analyses of the results;

- Investigation into collective opinions of the public about political, economic and social issues and statistical analysis thereof.

74: OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL ACTIVITIES

This division includes:

- Provision of specialized scientific and technical services (except legal and accounting activities, architecture and engineering activities, technological testing and analysis; management and management consultancy; research and development and advertising activities).

- Manual technologies or other technological activities are classified under class 74909 (Other professional, scientific and technology activities not elsewhere classified).

741 - 7410 - 74100: Specialized design activities

This class includes:

- Fashion design related to textiles, wearing apparel, shoes, jewellery, furniture and other interior decoration and other fashion goods as well as other personal or household goods;

- Urban design activities;

- Interior decoration activities.

Exclusion: Architectural and engineering design, under class 7110 (Architectural activities and related technical consultancy).

742 - 7420 - 74200: Photographic activities

This class includes:

- Consumer and commercial photograph production:

+ Portrait photography for passports, ID cards, weddings, etc.,

+ Photography for commercials, publishers, fashion, real estate or tourism,

+ Aerial photography,

+ Videotaping: weddings, meetings, etc.;

- Film production:

+ Developing, printing and enlarging from negatives or cine-films,

+ Film developing and photo print testing;

+ Processing, restoration or retouching of photos;

- Activities of photojournalists.

The class also includes the activities of microfilming of documents.

Exclusion:

- Processing film related to motion picture and television industries, under class 59111 (Motion picture production activities);

- Cartographic and spatial information activities, under class 71102 (Cartographic surveying activities).

749 - 7490: Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified

74901: Meteorological and hydrological activities

This class includes:

- Weather forecasting;

- Measuring of water content, humidity, storm circulation, etc.

74909: Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes various services delivered to consumer clients. The activities require professional, scientific and technological skill levels:

- Translation and interpretation activities;

- Activities of authoring of scientific and technological books;

- Activities of independent journalists;

- Business brokerage activities, i.e. purposeful arranging and sale of small and medium-sized businesses, including professional practices, but not including real estate brokerage;

- Patent brokerage activities (arranging for the purchase and sale of patents);

- Appraisal activities except appraisal of real estate and insurance (for antiques, jewellery, etc.);

- Bill settlement and freight rate information;

- Securities consulting;

- Agronomy consulting;

- Environmental consulting;

- Other technological consulting;

- Activities of consultants except architecture, engineering and management consulting.

The class also includes the activities carried on by agents or agencies on behalf of individuals usually involving the recruitment of personnel for motion picture, music production or other sports and entertainment attractions and the placement of books, plays, artworks, photographs, etc., with publishers or producers, etc.

Exclusion:

- Wholesale of used motor vehicles by auctioning, under classes 4511 (Wholesale of motor vehicles) and 45411 (Wholesale of motorcycles);

- Online auction activities (retail), under class 47910 (Retail sale via mail order or via Internet);

- Activities of auctioning houses (retail), under class 47990 (Other retail sale not elsewhere classified);

- Activities of real estate brokers, under class 68200 (Real estate consultancy, brokerage and auctioning, land use right auctioning).

- Accounting activities, under class 69200 (Accounting and auditing activities; tax consultancy);

- Management consultancy activities, under class 70200 (Management consultancy activities);

- Architecture and engineering consultancy activities, under class 7110 (Architectural activities and related technical consultancy);

- Industrial and machinery design, under class 7110 (Architectural activities and related technical consultancy).

- Display of advertisement and other advertising design, under class 73100 (Advertising);

- Creation of stands and other display structures and sites, under class 73100 (Advertising);

- Activities of exhibitions and fairs, under class 82300 (Trade promotion);

- Activities of independent auctioneers, under class 82990 (Other business support service activities not elsewhere classified);

- Management of administrative programs, under class 82990 (Other business support service activities not elsewhere classified);

- Consumer credit and debt counseling, under class 88900 (Other social work activities without accommodation);

- Activities of authors of scientific and technological books, under class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities)

- Activities of independent journalists, under class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities)

75: VETERINARY ACTIVITIES

This division includes:

- Provision of animal health care facilities where animals are confined to be treated and monitored directly by highly qualified veterinarians;

- These activities are carried out by veterinary units upon their examining farms, kennels or homes, in consulting and surgery rooms or elsewhere.

This division also includes animal ambulance activities.

750 - 7500 - 75000: Veterinary activities

This class includes:

- Animal health care and control activities for farm animals;

- Animal health care and control activities for pet animals.

These activities are carried out by highly qualified veterinarians working in animal health care facilities. Animal health care activities occur upon examinations of farms, kennels or homes, in consulting and surgery rooms or elsewhere.

The class also includes:

- Activities of veterinary assistants or other auxiliary veterinary personnel;

- Specialized research and other diagnostic activities pertaining to animals;

- Animal ambulance activities.

Exclusion:

- Farm animal feeding without health care, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

- Sheep shearing, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

- Herding services, agistment services, cattle castration, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

- Activities related to artificial insemination, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

- Pet animal feeding activities without health care, under class 96390 (Other personal service activities not elsewhere classified).

N: ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPPORT SERVICE ACTIVITIES

This section includes the activities that support general business operations. Their primary purpose is not the transfer of specialized knowledge.

77: LEASING OF MACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT (WITHOUT AN OPERATOR); LEASING OF PERSONAL AND HOUSEHOLD GOODS; LEASING OF NON-FINANCIAL INTANGIBLE ASSETS

This division includes the renting and leasing of tangible and non-financial intangible assets, including a wide array of tangible goods, such as automobiles, computers, consumer goods and industrial machinery and equipment to customers in return for a periodic or long-term rental.

This division also includes:

- Leasing of motor vehicles;

- Leasing of recreational and sports equipment and personal and household equipment;

- Leasing of machinery and equipment used for business operations, including other transport equipment;

- Leasing of non-financial intangible assets;

Exclusion:

- Financial leasing, under class 64910 (Financial leasing);

- Leasing of real estate, under section L (Real estate activities);

- Leasing of equipment with operator, classified according to the activities carried out with this equipment, to section F (Construction) or section H (Transportation and storage).

771 - 7710: Leasing of motor vehicles

77101: Leasing of automobiles

This class includes:

- Leasing of passenger cars (without drivers);

- Leasing of trucks, trailers and recreational vehicles.

Exclusion:

- Leasing of automobiles with driver, under group 493 (Other land transport);

- Financial leasing, under class 64910 (Financial leasing).

77109: Leasing of other motor vehicles

This class includes the leasing of entertainment vehicles, ski cars, etc.

772: Leasing of personal and household goods

This group includes the leasing of personal and household goods as well as renting of recreational and sports equipment and video tapes. Activities generally include short-term renting of goods although in some instances, the goods may be leased for a longer period of time.

7721 - 77210: Leasing of sports and recreational goods

This class includes the leasing of recreational and sports equipment:

- Pleasure boats, canoes, sailboats;

- Bicycles;

- Beach chairs and umbrellas;

- Other sports equipment;

- Skis.

Exclusion:

- Renting of video tapes and discs, under class 77220 (Renting of video tapes and discs);

- Leasing of other personal and household goods not elsewhere classified, under class 77290 (Leasing of other personal and household goods);

- Leasing of leisure equipment as an integral part of recreational facilities, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

7722 - 77220: Renting of video tapes and discs

This class includes the renting of video tapes, CDs, DVDs, etc.

7729 - 77290: Leasing of other personal and household goods

This class includes the leasing of all kinds of (personal and household) goods, to households or businesses (except sports and recreational equipment):

- Textiles, wearing apparel and footwear;

- Furniture, pottery, kitchenware, electrical appliances and housewares;

- Jewellery, musical instruments, tables and chairs, coverings, costumes, etc.;

- Books and magazines;

- Machinery and equipment used by amateurs or as a hobby, e.g. tools for home repairs;

- Flowers and plants;

- Electrical appliances for household use.

Exclusion:

- Leasing of cars, trucks and recreational vehicles without driver, under class 7710 (Leasing of motor vehicles);

- Leasing of recreational and sports goods, under class 77210 (Leasing of sports and recreational goods);

- Renting of video tapes and discs, under class 77220 (Renting of video tapes and discs);

- Leasing of motorcycles and caravans without driver, under class 77309 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified);

- Leasing of office furniture, under class 77303 (Leasing of office machinery and equipment, including computers);

- Provision of linen, work uniforms and related items by laundries, under class 96200 (Washing and cleaning of textile and fur products).

773 - 7730: Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods

This class includes:

- Leasing of machinery and equipment for agriculture and forestry, without operator;

- Leasing of machinery and equipment for construction and civil engineering, without operator;

- Leasing of office machinery and equipment, without operator;

- Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified, e.g. business goods.

Exclusion:

- Leasing of agricultural and forestry machinery and equipment with operator, under classes 01610 (Cultivation service activities) and 02400 (Support services to forestry);

- Leasing of construction and civil engineering machinery and equipment with operator, under division 43 (Specialized construction activities);

- Leasing of air-transport equipment without operator, under division 51 (Air transport);

- Leasing of water-transport equipment with operator, under division 50 (Water transport);

- Financial leasing, under class 64190 (Other monetary intermediation);

- Leasing of real estate, under class 68100 (Trading of own or rented property and land use rights);

- Leasing of tangible assets, under classes 77110 (Leasing of motor vehicles), 7720 (Leasing of personal and household goods) and 7730 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods);

- Renting of video tapes and discs, under class 77220 (Renting of video tapes and discs);

- Book renting, under class 77290 (Leasing of other personal and household goods).

77301: Leasing of agricultural and forestry machinery and equipment

This class includes:

- Leasing of machinery and equipment for agricultural and forestry, without operator:

- Leasing of goods, e.g. agricultural tractors, manufactured under class 28210 (Manufacturing of agricultural and forestry machinery).

77302: Leasing of construction machinery and equipment

This class includes the leasing of machinery and equipment for construction and civil engineering, without operator:

- Crane trucks;

- Scaffolds and work platforms, without erection or dismantling.

77303: Leasing of office machinery and equipment (including computers)

This class includes the leasing of office machinery and equipment, without operator:

- Computers and peripheral equipment;

- Duplicating machines, typewriters and word-processing machines;

- Accounting machinery and equipment: cash registers, electronic calculators, etc.;

- Office furniture.

77309: Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Leasing of other equipment and tangible goods, without operator, for business activities:

+ Engines,

+ Machine tools,

+ Mining and oil-field equipment,

+ Professional radio, television and communication equipment,

+ Motion picture production equipment,

+ Measuring and controlling equipment,

+ Other industrial, commercial and scientific machinery;

- Leasing of land-transport equipment (except motor vehicles) without operator:

+ Motorcycles, caravans and campers, etc.,

+ Railroad vehicles;

- Leasing of water-transport equipment without operator:

+ Commercial boats and ships;

- Leasing of air-transport equipment without operator:

+ Airplanes,

+ Hot-air balloons.

The class also includes:

- Leasing of containers;

- Leasing of pallets;

- Renting of animals (e.g. domestic animals, race horses).

774 - 7740 - 77400: Leasing of non-financial intangible goods

This class includes the activities of using non-financial intangible products on a basis of royalty or licensing fee paid to the owner of the products. The use of these products can take various forms, such as permission for reproduction, use in subsequent processes or products, operating businesses under a franchise, etc. The current owners may or may not have created these products.

The class also includes:

- Leasing of non-financial intangible products (except copyrighted works, such as books or software);

- Receiving royalties or licensing fees for the use of:

+ Patents,

+ Trademarks or service marks,

+ Brand names,

+ Right to mineral extraction,

+ Franchise agreements,

+ Other non-financial intangible goods.

78: EMPLOYMENT ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of searching, selecting and replacing workers, supplying workers to clients' businesses at clients’ requests for limited periods of time to supplement the working force of the client, and the brokers’ activities of providing human resources and human resource management services.

This division also includes:

- Employment management research and referral;

- Activities of theatrical casting agencies.

Exclusion: activities of arts organizations, under class 74909 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified).

781 - 7810 - 78100: activities of employment agencies

This class includes the activities of searching, selecting and replacing workers who are not employees of the employment agencies.

The class also includes:

- Personnel research, selection and replacement, including managerial executives;

- Activities of casting agencies;

- Activities of online employment agencies.

Exclusion: activities of arts organizations, under class 74900 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

782 - 7820 - 78200: Supplying of temporary workers

This class includes the activities of supplying workers to clients' businesses at clients’ requests for limited periods of time to supplement the working force of the client. The workers employed work in the sector of temporary employment services. However, units classified here do not supervise directly the workers’ occupational activities for the client.

783 - 7830: Human resources provision and management

78301: Local human resources provision and management

This class includes the activities of supplying local workers and providing services for management of local workers at clients’ requests, representing employer of record for the employees on matters relating to payroll, taxes, and other fiscal and human resource issues, but the units involved are not responsible for direction and supervision of employees.

Exclusion:

- Provision of human resources for executive or managerial positions, see the respective economic activity of the business;

- Provision of single human resource element, see the respective economic activity of the element.

78302: Overseas human resources provision and management

This class includes the activities of supplying local workers and providing services for management of overseas workers at overseas companies’ requests; representing employer of record for the employees on matters relating to payroll, taxes, and other fiscal and human resource issues, but the units involved are not responsible for direction and supervision of employees.

Exclusion:

- Provision of human resources for executive or managerial positions, classified according to the respective economic activity of the business;

- Provision of single human resource element, see the respective economic activity of the element.

79: TRAVEL AGENCY, TOUR OPERATOR AND RELATED SERVICE ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of units primarily engaged in selling travel products, tours, transportation and accommodation services to the tourists and travelers. Also included are the activities of arranging and assembling tours that are sold through travel agencies or directly by agents such as tour operators, as well as other auxiliary services related to promotion and operation of tours.

This division also includes the activities of tourist guides.

791: Travel agency and tour operator activities

This group includes the activities of agencies primarily engaged in selling travel products, tours, transportation and accommodation services to the tourists and travelers; and the activity of arranging and assembling tours that are sold through travel agencies or directly by agents such as tour operators.

7911 - 79110: Travel agencies

This class includes the activities of agencies primarily engaged in selling travel products, tours, transportation and accommodation services to the tourists and travelers, etc.

7912 - 79120: Tour operators

This class includes the activities of arranging and assembling tours that are sold through travel agencies or directly by agents such as tour operators. The tours may include any or all of the following: transportation, accommodation, food, visits to museums, historical sites, cultural sites, theaters, musical or sporting events.

The class also includes the activities of tourist guides.

792 - 7920 - 79200: Service activities for promotion and operation of tours

This class includes the activities of market research and travel promotion in relation to conventions and sightseeing by providing information and operational assistance at local accommodation units, convention centers and recreational sites; time-share exchange services, tour assembling and travel-related reservation services for transportation, hotels, restaurants, motor vehicle rentals, entertainment and sport. Ticket sales activities for theaters, sporting events, museums and entertainment services.

Exclusion:

- Activities of travel agencies and tour operators, under classes 79110 (Travel agencies) and 79120 (Tour operators);

- Organization and operation of events such as meetings, conventions and press conferences, under class 82300 (Trade promotion).

80: INVESTIGATION AND SECURITY ACTIVITIES

This division includes: Security-related services such as: investigation and detective services; guard and patrol services; picking up and delivering money, receipts, or other valuable items with personnel and equipment to protect such properties while in transit; operation of electronic security alarm systems, such as burglar and fire alarms, activity-focused control systems, often involving sale, installation and repair services. If such components are provided separately, they are excluded from this division and classified in retail sale, construction, etc.

801 - 8010 - 80100: Private security activities

This class includes the provision of services: guard and patrol services, picking up and delivering money, receipts or other valuable items with personnel and equipment to protect such properties while in transit.

The class also includes:

- Armored car services;

- Bodyguard services;

- Detector machine services;

- Fingerprinting services;

- Security guard services.

Exclusion:

- Safety activities, under class 84230 (Public order and safety activities).

802 - 8020 - 80200: Security systems service activities

This class includes:

- Monitoring or remote monitoring of electronic security alarm systems, such as burglar and fire alarms, including their maintenance;

- Installing, repairing, rebuilding, and adjusting mechanical or electronic locking devices, safes and security vaults.

It may also include the sale of security systems, mechanical or electronic locking devices, safes and security vaults.

Exclusion:

- Installation of security systems, under class 43210 (Electrical installation);

- Selling security systems, mechanical or electronic locking devices, safes and security vaults, without monitoring, installation or maintenance services, under class 47599 (Retail sale of other electrical household appliances, furniture, lighting equipment and household articles in specialized stores);

- Security consultants, under class 74909 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

- Public order and safety activities, under class 84230 (Public order and safety activities);

- Key duplication services, under class 95290 (Repair of other personal and household goods).

803 - 8030 - 80300: Investigation activities

This class includes investigation and detective service activities. All activities of all private investigators, according to the type of client or purpose of investigation.

81: BUILDING CLEANING AND LANDSCAPE SERVICE ACTIVITIES

This division includes the provision of staff to carry out general support services at clients' requests but the providers are not involved with or responsible for the core business or activities of the client.

This division also includes: the interior and exterior cleaning of buildings of all types, cleaning of industrial machinery, cleaning of trains, buses, planes, etc., cleaning of roads and sea tankers, disinfecting and exterminating activities for buildings, ships, trains, etc., bottle cleaning, street sweeping, snow removal, provision of landscape care and maintenance services along with the design of landscape plans and/or the construction (i.e. installation) of walkways, repairing walls, decks, fences, and similar structures.

811 - 8110 - 81100: Combined support services

This class includes the provision of staff to carry out a combination of support services at clients’ requests. It includes general interior cleaning, maintenance, trash disposal, guard and security, mail routing, reception, laundry and related services to fulfill clients’ requests. Units providing such services are not involved with or responsible for the core business or activities of the client.

Exclusion:

- Provision of only one support service (e.g. general interior cleaning), see the appropriate class corresponding with the service rendered;

- Provision of management and operating staff for the complete operation of a client's establishment, such as a hotel, restaurant, mine or hospital, see the class of the unit operated;

- Provision of on site management and operation of a client's computer systems and/or data processing facilities, under class 62020 (Computer consultancy and computer system management).

812: Cleaning services

This group includes the activities of general interior cleaning of all types of buildings, exterior cleaning of buildings, disinfecting and extermination activities for buildings and industrial machinery, bottle cleaning, street sweeping, snow removal.

Exclusion: Agricultural pest control, sand blasting and similar activities for building exteriors (construction), carpet and rug shampooing, drapery and curtain cleaning (other services). Post-construction cleaning of new buildings (construction)

8121 - 81210: General cleaning of buildings

This class includes:

- General (non-specialized) cleaning of all types of buildings, such as:

+ Offices,

+ Apartments or houses,

+ Factories,

+ Shops,

+ Other professional premises and multi-unit residential and business buildings,

These activities cover mostly interior cleaning although they may include the cleaning of exterior areas such as windows or passageways.

Exclusion: Specialized interior cleaning activities, such as chimney cleaning, cleaning of fireplaces, incinerators, boilers, ventilation ducts, exhaust units, under class 81290 (Other building and industrial cleaning activities).

8129 - 81290: Other building and industrial cleaning activities

This class includes:

- Exterior cleaning of buildings of all types, including offices, factories, shops, professional premises and multi-unit buildings;

- Specialized cleaning activities for buildings such as window cleaning, chimney cleaning and cleaning of fireplaces, incinerators, boilers, ventilation ducts and exhaust units;

- Cleaning or maintenance of swimming pools;

- Cleaning of industrial machinery;

- Cleaning of trains, buses, planes, etc.;

- Cleaning of roads;

- Disinfecting and exterminating services;

- Street sweeping and snow removal;

- Other building cleaning activities not elsewhere classified.

Exclusion:

- Agricultural pest control, under class 01610 (Cultivation service activities);

- Automobile cleaning, car wash, under class 45200 (Maintenance and repair of motor vehicles).

813 - 8130 - 81300: Landscape care and maintenance service activities

This class includes:

- Planting, care and maintenance of:

+ Parks and gardens for:

+ Private and public housing,

+ Public and semi-public buildings (schools, hospitals, administrative buildings, church buildings, etc.),

+ Municipal grounds (parks, green areas, cemeteries, etc.),

+ Highway greenery (roads, train lines, tramlines, ports),

+ Industrial and commercial buildings;

- Planting of greenery for:

+ Buildings (roof gardens, façade gardens, indoor gardens),

+ Sports grounds, play grounds and recreational parks (e.g. lawns for sunbathing, golf courses),

+ Flowing and stationary water (basins, alternating wet areas, ponds, swimming pools, ditches, rivers, streams, plant sewage systems),

+ Plants for protection against noise, wind, erosion and dazzling. The class also includes:

- Design and auxiliary construction services;

- Working the soil in favorable agricultural and ecological conditions.

Exclusion:

- Commercial production and planting for commercial production of plants, under division 01 (Agriculture and related services), group 014 (Animal husbandry) and division 02 (Forestry and related services);

- Tree nurseries (except forest tree nurseries), under class 01300 (Propagation and growing of agricultural cultivars);

- Construction activities for landscaping purposes, under section F (Construction);

- Landscape design and architectural activities, under class 7110 (Architectural activities and related technical consultancy).

82: ADMINISTRATIVE, OFFICE SUPPORT AND OTHER BUSINESS SUPPORT ACTIVITIES

This division includes the provision of day-to-day office administrative services, as well as routine business support functions for others, on a fee or contract basis.

This division also includes business support service activities not elsewhere classified. Units classified in this division do not provide staff to carry out the complete operations of a business.

821: Office administrative and support activities

This group includes the provision of day-to-day office administrative services, such as financial planning, book keeping, personnel and physical distribution for others on a fee or contract basis.

The group also includes support activities on a fee or contract basis, which are routine business support functions and traditional operations.

Exclusion: Provision of staff to carry out the complete operations of a business. Units engaged in one particular aspect of these activities are classified according to that particular activity.

8211 - 82110: Combined office administrative service activities

This class includes the provision of a combination of day-to-day office support services, such as reception, financial planning, book keeping, personnel and mail delivery, etc. for others on a fee or contract basis.

Exclusion: Provision of staff to carry out the complete operations of a business. Classification is subject to the business activity performed.

Provision of only one particular aspect of these activities. Classification is subject to the particular activity.

8219: Photocopying, document preparation and other specialized office support activities

82191: Photocopying and document preparation

This class includes:

- Document preparation;

- Document editing or proofreading;

- Typing, word processing and desktop publishing;

- Letter or resume writing;

- Photocopying;

- Duplicating;

- Blueprinting;

- Word processing;

- Other document copying services without printing services such as offset printing, quick printing, digital printing.

Exclusion:

- Printing of documents (offset printing, quick printing, etc.), under class 18110 (Printing);

- Specialized stenotype services such as court reporting, under class 82199 (Other specialized office support activities);

- Public stenography services, under class 82990 (Other business support service activities not elsewhere classified).

82199: Other specialized office support activities

This class includes:

- Secretarial support services;

- Transcription of documents and other secretarial services;

- Provision of mailbox rental and other mailing activities (except direct mail advertising);

- Mailing services.

822 - 8220 - 82200: activities of call centers

This class includes:

- Activities of inbound call centers, answering calls from clients by using human operators, automatic call distribution, computer telephone integration, interactive voice response systems or similar methods to receive orders, provide product information, deal with customer requests for assistance or address customer complaints;

- Activities of outbound call centers using similar methods to sell or market goods or services to potential customers, undertake market research or public opinion polling and similar activities for clients.

823 - 8230 - 82300: Trade promotion

This class includes the organization, promotion and/or management of events, such as business and trade shows, product launch events and meetings, whether or not including the management and provision of the staff to undertake organizational tasks.

829: Business support service activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes the activities of collection agencies, credit bureaus and business support activities not elsewhere classified.

8291 - 82910: activities of collection agencies and credit bureaus

This class includes the collection of payments for claims and remittance of payments collected to the clients, such as bill or debt collection services.

The class also includes the activities of compiling of information, such as credit and employment histories on businesses and providing the information to financial institutions, retailers and others who have a need to evaluate the creditworthiness of individuals and businesses.

8292 - 82920: Packaging services

This class includes:

- Packaging activities on a fee or contract basis, whether or not these involving an automated process:

+ Bottling of liquids, including beverages and food,

+ Packaging of solids,

+ Packaging for storage of pharmaceutical preparations,

+ Stamping, labeling and imprinting,

+ Gift wrapping.

Exclusion:

- Production of soft drinks and mineral water, under class 1104 (Manufacture of non-alcoholic beverages and mineral water);

- Packaging activities incidental to transport, under class 5229 (Other transportation support activities).

8299 - 82990: Other business support service activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Providing written report processing and stenotype services, such as:

+ Court reporting or stenotype recording,

+ Public stenography services;

- Real-time closed captioning of television performances of meetings;

- Address bar coding services;

- Mail presorting services;

- Repossession services;

- Parking fee collection services;

- Activities of independent auctioneers;

- Other business support activities not elsewhere classified.

Exclusion:

- Provision of stenotype services for mailing, reporting and other documentation or document transcription services, under class 82990 (Other business support service activities not elsewhere classified);

- Providing film or tape captioning or subtitling services, under class 59120 (Post-production activities).

O: ACTIVITIES OF VIETNAM COMMUNIST PARTY, POLITICAL AND SOCIAL ORGANIZATIONS, STATE MANAGEMENT AND NATIONAL DEFENSE; COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY

This section includes the activities of state management: This includes the making and enactment of laws and their pursuant regulation, as well as the administration of the implementation of laws, national defense, residence services, foreign affairs and the administration of government programs.

This section also includes:

- Compulsory social security;

- The legal or institutional status is not, in itself, the determining factor for an activity to belong in this section. Activities being of a nature not suitable under this section, though occurring in a similar field, shall be classified elsewhere in the classification system. For example, administration of the school system (i.e. regulations, curricula) falls under this section, but teaching itself does not and belongs to section P (Education and training) instead, or medical units (in prison or military hospital) are classified to section Q (Health activities). Some activities described in this section may be carried out by non-government organizations.

84: ACTIVITIES OF VIETNAM COMMUNIST PARTY, POLITICAL AND SOCIAL ORGANIZATIONS, STATE MANAGEMENT, NATIONAL DEFENSE AND COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY

841: ACTIVITIES OF VIETNAM COMMUNIST PARTY, POLITICAL AND SOCIAL ORGANIZATIONS, STATE MANAGEMENT AND ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICY ADMINISTRATION

8411: ACTIVITIES OF VIETNAM COMMUNIST PARTY, POLITICAL AND SOCIAL ORGANIZATIONS, GENERAL STATE MANAGEMENT AND COMBINED ECONOMIC ADMINISTRATION

84111: ACTIVITIES OF VIETNAM COMMUNIST PARTY, POLITICAL AND SOCIAL ORGANIZATIONS

This class includes:

- Activities of Vietnam Communist Party for developing policies towards national economic and social growth as directions for the Government to determine specific actions in relation to the country's development in economy and society. Such activities involve specialized central units, sectoral units, local units and grassroot units of Vietnam Communist Party;

- Activities of bodies under Vietnam General Confederation of Labor, Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, Vietnam’s Women Union and Vietnam Fatherland Front for involving their members in implementation of every policy of the Vietnam Communist Party and the Government in each period of national economic and social growth. In other words:

+ Activities of bodies under Vietnam General Confederation of Labor. Such activities involve specialized central units, local units, sectoral and grassroot units of trade unions in state-owned enterprises and other state-funded businesses,

+ Activities of Vietnam Communist Youth Union: the activities involve specialized central units, sectoral units, local and grassroot units of the Youth Union, whose operations are mainly funded by the state budget,

+ Activities of bodies under Vietnam's Women Union: the activities involve specialized central units, sectoral units, local and grassroot units of the Women Union, whose operations are mainly funded by the state budget,

+ Activities of Vietnam Fatherland Front: the activities involve specialized central units, sectoral units, local and grassroot units of the Fatherland Front, whose operations are mainly funded by the state budget,

+ Farmers union, war veteran association, etc.

Exclusion:

- Manufacturing activities (whether or not involving market activities) that the bodies of Vietnam Communist Party perform. Such manufacturing activities shall be classified accordingly in the standard industrial classification system. As follows:

+ Newspaper publishing activities performed by the bodies of Vietnam Communist Party, under class 58130 (Publishing of newspapers, journals and periodicals),

+ Education and training activities provided by the bodies of Vietnam Communist Party, classified accordingly in section P (Education and training),

+ Research and development activities performed by the bodies of Vietnam Communist Party, under class 72200 (Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities);

- Manufacture of physical goods and services (whether or not involving market traits) by units of political and social organizations (e.g. newspaper publishing, education, training, etc.) Such activities shall be classified accordingly in the standard industrial classification system.

84112: General state management and combined economic administration activities

This class includes the activities of general public administration (i.e. law enforcement, legislation, judiciary, financial administration at all echelons of the government) and supervision of economic and social activities.

This class includes:

- Legislative and executive administration of central, regional and provincial bodies;

- Administration and supervision of fiscal affairs:

+ Operation of the taxation system,

+ Collection of taxes and duties on goods and investigation into tax violation,

+ Customs administration;

- Budget allocation and management of public funds and public debts”

+ Raising and receiving of moneys and control of their disbursement;

- Administration of overall (civil) research and development (R&D) policy and their connections;

- Administration and organization of overall economic and social planning and statistical services at various levels of the government.

Exclusion:

- Operation of buildings owned by or related to the government, under class 68100 (Trading of own or rented property and land use rights);

- Administration of research and development (R&D) policies intended to increase personal well-being and associated funds, under class 84120 (State management of health care, education, cultural services and other social services, except compulsory social security);

- Administration of research and development (R&D) policies intended to improve economic performance and competitiveness, under class 84130 (State management of specialized economic sectors);

- Administration of defense-related research and development (R&D) policies and of associated funds, under class 84220 (National defense activities).

8412 - 84120: State management of health care, education, cultural services and other social services (except compulsory social security)

This class includes:

- Public administration of programs aimed to increase personal well-being: health, education, culture, sport, recreation, environment, housing and social services;

- Administration of research and development (R&D) projects and associated funds for these areas.

The class also includes:

- Sponsoring of recreational and cultural activities;

- Distribution of grants to artists;

- Administration of clean water supply programs;

- Administration of waste collection and disposal operations;

- Administration of environmental protection programs;

- Administration of housing programs.

Exclusion:

- Sewage, refuse disposal and remediation activities, under divisions 37 (Sewerage), 38 (Waste collection, treatment and disposal; materials recovery) and 39 (Remediation activities and other waste management services);

- Compulsory social security activities, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security activities);

- Educational activities, under division 85 (Education and training);

- Health-related activities, under division 86 (Health activities);

- Activities of libraries and archives, under class 91010 (Library and archives activities);

- Operation of museums and other cultural sites, under class 91020 (Conservation activities and museums);

- Sporting and recreational activities, under division 93 (Sports activities, amusement and recreational activities).

8413 - 84130: State management of specialized economic sectors

This class includes:

- Administration and regulation, including subsidy allocation, for different economic sectors:

+ Agriculture,

+ Land use,

+ Energy and mining resources,

+ Transport,

+ Communication,

+ Hotels and tourism,

+ Wholesale and retail trade;

- Administration of research and development (R&D) policies and associated funds to improve economic performance;

- Administration of general labor affairs;

- Implementation of regional development policy measures, e.g. to reduce unemployment.

Exclusion: Research and experimental development activities, under division 72 (Scientific research and development).

842: Provision of services to the nation as a whole

This class includes the service activities concerning foreign affairs, national defense and public safety.

8421 - 84210: Foreign affairs

This class includes:

- Administration and operation of diplomatic security activities, embassies and consular missions stationed abroad or overseas offices of national organizations operating on global scale;

- Administration, operation and support for information and cultural services beyond national boundaries;

- Aid to foreign countries, whether or not routed through international organizations;

- Provision of military aid to foreign countries;

- Management of foreign trade, international financial and technical affairs.

Exclusion: International disaster or refugee aid, under class 88900 (Other social work activities without accommodation).

8422 - 84220: National defense activities

This class includes:

- Administration and operation of military defense affairs covering land, water and air:

+ Forces of army, navy and air force,

+ Engineering, transport, communications, intelligence, logistics and other defense support forces,

+ Reserve and auxiliary forces for national defense,

+ Logistics (provision of equipment and military supplies),

+ Health activities for military personnel in the field;

- Administration, operation and support of defense forces;

- Support for combat planning and military and public security exercises;

- Administration of defense-related research and development (R&D) projects and associated funds.

Exclusion:

- Research and experimental development activities, under division 72 (Scientific research and development);

- Provision of military aid to foreign countries, under class 84220 (National defense activities);

- Activities of military tribunals, under class 84230 (Public order and safety activities).

- Provision of supplies for natural disasters and emergencies, under class 84230 (Public order and safety activities);

- Educational activities of military schools, under group 854 (Tertiary education);

- Activities of military hospitals, under group 861 (Hospital and clinic activities).

8423 - 84230: Public order and safety activities

This class includes:

- Administration and operation of regular and auxiliary police forces supported by governmental authorities at ports and borders, and other special police forces, including traffic operation, civil registration, maintenance of arrest records;

- Firefighting and fire prevention;

- Administration and operation of regular and auxiliary units in fire prevention, firefighting, rescue of persons and animals, assistance in civic disasters, floods, road accidents, etc.;

- Administration and operation of administrative aspects of civil and criminal law courts, military tribunals and the judicial system, including legal representation and counsel on behalf of the government;

- Rendering of judgments and interpretation of the law;

- Arbitration of civil actions;

- Prison administration and provision of correctional services, whether their administration and operation is done by governmental units or by private units on a contract basis;

- Provision of emergency aid in case of disasters.

Exclusion:

- Forestry fire-prevention and fire-fighting services, under class 02400 (Support services to forestry);

- Oil and gas field fire fighting, under class 09100 (Support activities for crude petroleum and natural gas extraction);

- Firefighting and fire-prevention services at airports, which are provided by non-specialized units, under class 52239 (Other service activities incidental to air transportation);

- Advice and representation in civil, criminal and other cases, under class 69100 (Legal activities);

- Operation of police laboratories, under class 72100 (Research and experiment development on natural sciences and engineering);

- Administration and operation of military forces, under class 84220 (National defense activities);

- Activities of prison schools, under division 85 (Education and training);

- Activities of prison hospitals, under group 861 (Hospital and clinic activities).

843 - 8430 - 84300: Compulsory social security

This class includes:

- Funding and operation of government-provided social security programs:

+ Sickness, maternity, work-accident and unemployment insurance,

+ Retirement pensions,

+ Programs covering losses of income due to temporary disablement, widowhood, death, etc.

Exclusion:

- Non-compulsory social security, under class 65300 (Social insurance);
