- Provision of social welfare services (without accommodation), under classes 8810 (Social work activities without accommodation for the persons having rendered meritorious services, wounded and sick soldiers, elderly and disabled) and 88900 (Other social work activities without accommodation).

P: EDUCATION AND TRAINING

This section includes the activities of education at any level or for any profession in oral or written forms as well as by radio and television or other means of communication. Activities of education by different educational institutions in the regular school system at different levels as well as Illiteracy eradication and adult education programs, etc.

This section also includes:

- Military academies and schools, prison schools, etc. at respective levels;

- For each level of initial education, the classes include special education for physically or mentally handicapped learners. Activities of education by public and private institutions, fundamental instruction concerned with sport and recreational activities and education support activities.

85: EDUCATION AND TRAINING

851 - 8510 - 85100: Pre-primary education

This class includes pre-primary education activities that provide care and education to children by three months to six years of age. Pre-primary schools are educational institutions comprising kindergartens and preschools or providing special education for handicapped students in this age range. The purpose of pre-primary education is to develop children’s physique, sentiments, intelligence, aesthetic sense and initial elements of their personality. This stage of education also prepares children for the first grade. Educational activities at this level focus on collective works and are designed to introduce children to a school-type environment.

852 - 8520 - 85200: Primary education

This class includes:

- Educational activities for children attending primary schools through a 5-year period (starting with the admission of six-year-olds into the first grade progressing to the fifth grade).  Educational instruction is designed to give students an adequate basic education in reading, writing and mathematics along with a fundamental understanding of other subjects such as history, geography, natural science, social science, art and music. The degree of specialization at this level is generally low;

- Such education is generally provided to children; however, the provision of literacy programs within or outside the school system, which are similar in content to programs in primary education but are intended for those considered too old to enter elementary schools, is also included;

- Also included is the provision of talent programs for children (singing, dance, music, languages, sport, etc.) and primary-level programs suited to children with special needs education;

- Educational programs, at a similar primary level, provided to adolescents in minority ethnic groups and remote areas or children of state officials, etc.

Education can be provided in classrooms or through radio, television broadcast, Internet or correspondence.

Exclusion: Adult education, under group 855 (Other education).

853: Secondary education

This group includes the provision of general secondary, technical and vocational secondary education.

8531: General secondary education

This class includes:

- Provision of the type of education that lays the foundation for life-long learning and human development and is capable of furthering education opportunities. Such units provide programs that are usually on a more subject-oriented pattern with more specialized teachers, and more often employ several teachers conducting classes in their field of specialization;

- Subject specialization at this level often begins to have some influence on the educational experience of those pursuing a general program. Such programs are designed to qualify students either for technical and vocational education or for entrance to higher education without any special subject prerequisite.

- Education can be provided in classrooms or through radio, television broadcast, Internet or correspondence.

85311: Lower secondary education

This class includes:

- Educational activities provided by lower secondary schools through a 4-year period (starting with the admission of students accomplishing primary education into the six grade progressing to the ninth grade); 

- Also included is the provision of talent programs (singing, dance, music, languages, sport, etc.) and lower secondary-level programs suited to learners with special needs education; - Educational programs, at a similar level, provided to young adults learning while working and to adolescents in minority ethnic groups and remote areas, etc.;

- Lower secondary education consolidates and develops the contents taught at the primary education level, and provides students with basic understanding in Vietnamese, mathematics, further knowledge in social science, natural science, law, computing, foreign language. It equips students with minimum technical and career-oriented knowledge necessary to advance to upper secondary education, professional secondary education, vocational education or to engage in working.

Exclusion: Adult education, under group 855 (Other education).

85312: Upper secondary education

This class includes:

- Upper secondary education provided in three years (starting with the admission of students accomplishing lower secondary education into the tenth grade progressing to the twelfth grade);

- Upper secondary education consolidates and develops achievements gained from lower secondary education, completes the general education and provides ordinary technical and career-oriented knowledge for students to advance to tertiary education, professional secondary education, vocational education or to engages in working;

- Also included is the provision of talent programs (singing, dance, music, languages, sport, etc.) and upper secondary-level programs suited to children with special needs education;

- Educational programs, at a similar level, provided to young adults learning while working and to adolescents in minority ethnic groups and remote areas, etc.;

Exclusion: Adult education, under group 855 (Other education).

8532: Vocational education

This class includes:

- Education particularly emphasizing subject-oriented specialization and instruction in both theoretical background and practical skills generally associated with present or prospective employment. The aim of a program can vary from preparation for a general field of employment to a very specific job, making learners capable of practicing and growing their career according to each particular job.

- Contents of vocational education focus on developing abilities to practice professions, give prominence to ethical, physical and skill training according to each job. Moreover, it heightens academic knowledge required.

85321: Professional secondary education

This class includes:

- Activities of new and advanced training provided by professional secondary schools. The length of programs is three to four years for lower secondary school graduates and one to two years for upper secondary school graduates, regardless of the form of training;

- Professional secondary education aims at developing workers with basic knowledge and practical skills for a particular profession. Learners shall be capable of working independently and creatively and applying technologies at work.

Exclusion: Technical and vocational college-level education (higher than professional and vocational secondary education) and university-level education, under group 854 (Tertiary education).

85322: Vocational training

This class includes:

- Activities of new and supplementary training provided by vocational (secondary) schools and basic profession schools. The length of training is less than one year for basic profession courses and short-term vocational courses. Otherwise, it takes one to three years for longer vocational secondary programs, regardless of the form of training;

- Vocational training aims at developing technical workers capable of practicing professions pertinent to their training level, in manufacturing and service sectors.

Exclusion: Technical and vocational college-level education (higher than professional and vocational secondary education) and university-level education, under group 854 (Tertiary education).

854: Tertiary education

8541 - 85410: College training

This class includes the activities of college-level training. An academic program may take two to three years for students having graduated from upper secondary or vocational secondary schools. Otherwise, the program for holders of a vocational secondary diploma in the same major may take one and a half to two years. Students are equipped with specialized knowledge and fundamental skills for a specific profession to solve issues common to their training major, regardless of the form of training. Students are awarded with college degree upon graduation.

8542 - 85420: University and postgraduate training

This class includes:

- Activities of new and advanced training provided by academies and universities. An academic program may take 4 to 6 years for holders of upper secondary or vocational secondary diploma. Otherwise, the program takes one to two years of training for holders of a college degree in the same major, Regardless of the form of training. An academic program consists of two parts: general subjects and broad professional subjects that equip students with a basically complete set of fundamental and professional knowledge, scientific working methods and abilities to apply theoretical knowledge in practical tasks. Students are prepared to adapt to the diversity of real occupations, to possess firm capacities to change various jobs or progress to higher education. Students are awarded with university degree upon graduation.

- Activities of further postgraduate training provided by academies and universities. This includes master’s programs for holders of university degrees to pursue in averagely 2 years. Academic programs equip learners with deep or interdisciplinary knowledge and skills. A doctoral program takes averagely 4 years for university graduates but 2 to 3 years for holders of master’s degrees. The doctoral programs equip graduate students with elevated theoretical and practical qualifications to conduct independent studies, to perform creative works, to solve scientific and technological issues and to give professional instructions.

855: Other education

This group includes the activities of general education and continuing vocational education and professional training. Instruction may be oral or written and may be provided in classrooms or by radio, television, Internet, or other means of communication.

The group also includes training camps and schools that provide instruction in athletic activities to groups or individuals, foreign language instruction, instruction in the arts, drama or music or other instruction or specialized training.

Exclusion: Educational activities described in groups 852 (Primary education), 853 (Secondary education) and 854 (Tertiary education)

8551 - 85510: Sports and recreation education

This class includes the provision of instruction in athletic activities to groups or individuals, such as by camps and schools. Overnight and day sports instruction camps are also included. This class does not include activities of academies, colleges and universities. Instruction may be provided in diverse settings, such as the unit's or client's training facilities, educational institutions or by other means. Instruction provided in this class is formally organized.

The class also includes:

- Sports instruction (e.g. baseball, basketball, football, etc.);

- Sports instruction, camps;

- Cheerleading instruction;

- Gymnastics instruction;

- Riding instruction;

- Swimming instruction;

- Professional sports coaches, teachers and instructors;

- Martial arts instruction;

- Card game instruction;

- Yoga instruction.

Exclusion: Cultural education, under class 85520 (Cultural education).

8552 - 85520: Cultural education

This class includes the provision of instruction in arts, drama and music. Units giving this type of instructions might be named "schools", "studios", "classes", etc. They provide formally organized instruction, mainly for hobby, recreational or self-development purposes, but such instruction does not lead to a professional diploma.

The class also includes:

- Piano and other music instruction;

- Painting instruction;

- Dance instruction;

- Drama instruction;

- Fine arts instruction;

- Performing arts instruction;

- Photography instruction (except commercial activities).

8559 - 85590: Other education not elsewhere classified

This class includes the provision of instruction and specialized training, generally for adults, not comparable to the general education in groups 852 (Primary education) to 854 (Tertiary education). This class does not include activities of academies, colleges and universities. Instruction may be provided in diverse settings, such as the unit's or client's training facilities, educational institutions, workplace, home, possibly through correspondence, television, Internet, in classrooms or by other means. Such instruction does not lead to a secondary diploma or undergraduate degree.

This class includes:

- Education by refresher course providers, which is not definable by level;

- Tutoring services;

- Academic preparation;

- Learning centers offering remedial courses;

- Professional examination review courses;

- Language instruction and conversational skills instruction;

- Speed reading instruction;

- Religious instruction;

- Schools organized by bodies of Vietnam Communist Party and authorities.

This class also includes:

- Driving training for non-driver learners;

- Flying training;

- Lifeguard training;

- Survival training;

- Public speaking training;

- Computer training.

Exclusion:

- Adult literacy programs, under class 85200 (Primary education), and general secondary education, under class 8531 (General secondary education);

- Driving schools for occupational drivers, under class 8532 (Vocational education);

- College, university and postgraduate education, under group 854 (Tertiary education).

856 - 8560 - 85600: Educational support activities

This class includes:

- Provision of non-instructional services that support educational processes or systems:

+ Educational consulting,

+ Educational guidance counseling services,

+ Educational testing evaluation services,

+ Educational testing services,

+ Organization of student exchange programs.

Exclusion: Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities, under class 72200 (Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities).

Q: HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES

This section includes the provision of health and social work activities. This includes a wide range of activities, starting from health care provided by trained medical professionals in hospitals and other facilities, over residential care activities that involve a degree of health care activities to social work activities without any involvement of health care professionals.

86: HEALTH ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of short-term or long-term hospitals, general or specialty medical, surgical, psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals, sanatoria, preventoria (tuberculosis), medical nursing homes, asylums, mental hospital institutions, rehabilitation centers, leprosaria and other human health institutions which have accommodation facilities and which engage in providing diagnostic and medical treatment to inpatients with any of a wide variety of medical conditions.

This division also includes the activities of medical consultation and treatment in the field of general and specialized medicine by general practitioners and medical specialists and surgeons. Dental practice activities of a general or specialized nature and orthodontic activities. Health activities not performed by hospitals or by practicing medical doctors but by paramedical practitioners legally recognized to treat patients.

861 - 8610: Hospital and clinic activities

86101: Hospital activities

This class includes:

- Activities of (general and specialized) hospitals, nursing homes, leprosaria and other medical institutions that conduct studies as well as provide treatment to inpatients;

- The activities are chiefly directed to inpatients and are carried out under the direct supervision of experienced medical doctors and medical practitioners; with services of medical and paramedical staff working in the same institutions, and with services of technical and laboratory facilities for diagnosing and treating patients.

Exclusion:

- Testing and inspection of all types of materials and products, except medications, under class 71200 (Technical testing and analysis);

- Veterinary activities, under class 75000 (Veterinary activities);

- Health activities for military personnel in the field, under class 84220 (National defense activities);

- Dental practice activities of a general or specialized nature, e.g. dentistry, pediatric dentistry; oral pathology and orthodontic activities, under class 86202 (Dental practice activities);

- Private consultants’ services to inpatients, under class 86201 (Medical practice activities);

- Drug testing, under class 86990 (Other health activities not elsewhere classified);

- Ambulance transport activities, under class 86990 (Other health activities not elsewhere classified);

- Other activities for human health, under class 86900 (Other health activities not elsewhere classified).

86102: Communal, ministerial and sectoral medical units

This class includes:

- Activities of communal or ward-level public health facilities such as medical service units (health stations), maternity houses, medical clinics, etc. or privately operated facilities on similar scale;

- Activities of medical clinics of the army, prisons, offices, schools and enterprises within the authority of ministries and authorities.

862 - 8620: Medical and dental practice activities

This class includes the activities of general and specialized medical clinics and dental clinics that chiefly provide diagnostic services and prescription treatment to outpatients through services of experienced medical doctors and medical practitioners.

86201: Medical practice activities

This class includes:

- Medical consultation and treatment in the field of general and specialized medicine by medical doctors, medical specialists and surgeons;

- Family planning centers providing medical treatment, such as sterilization and termination of pregnancy, without accommodation;

- These activities can be carried out in private practice, group practices and in hospital outpatient clinics, and in clinics such as those attached to enterprises, schools, nursing homes for the elderly, labor organizations, as well as in patients' homes;

- Private consultants' services to inpatients.

Exclusion:

- Inpatient hospital activities, under class 86101 (Hospital activities);

- Paramedical activities such as those of midwives, nurses and physiotherapists, under class 86990 (Other health activities not elsewhere classified).

86202: Dental practice activities

This class includes:

- Activities of dental clinics;

- Dental practice activities of a general or specialized nature, e.g. dentistry, pediatric dentistry; oral pathology;

- Orthodontic activities;

- Dental surgery activities;

- Dental consultation and care.

Exclusion: Production of artificial teeth, denture and prosthetic appliances by dental clinics, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies).

869: Other health activities

8691 - 86910: Preventive medicine activities

This class includes the activities of central and local agencies that carry out propagandas on sanitary affairs for epidemic prevention, injection, prevention of social (i.e. veneral) diseases, prevention of HIV/AIDS, prevention of germ warfare, chemical or radiological warfare, etc.

Exclusion: activities of medical care facilities, under classes 86101 (Hospital activities), 86102 (Communal, ministerial and sectoral medical units), 86201 (Medical practice activities), 86202 (Dental practice activities) and 86990 (Other health activities not elsewhere classified), including even those that participate in sanitary activities for state-run epidemic prevention campaigns.

8692 - 86920: Orthopedic and rehabilitation centers

This class includes the activities of orthopedic and rehabilitation centers across the nation.

8699 - 86990: Other health activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Activities for human health not elsewhere classified, performed under supervision of nurses, midwives, physiotherapists or other paramedical practitioners in the field of optometry, hydrotherapy, medical massage, occupational therapy, speech therapy, chiropody, homeopathy, chiropractic, acupuncture or health care activities by medical practitioners not elsewhere classified;

- These activities may be carried out in health clinics such as those attached to enterprises, schools, nursing homes for the aged, labor organizations and fraternal organizations and in residential health facilities other than hospitals, as well as in own consulting rooms, patients' homes or elsewhere. The activities do not involve medical treatment.

This class also includes:

- Activities of dental paramedical personnel such as dental therapists, school dental nurses and dental hygienists, who may work remote from, but are periodically supervised by, the dentist;

- Activities of medical laboratories such as:

+ X-ray laboratories and other diagnostic imaging centers,

+ Blood analysis laboratories;

- Activities of blood banks, sperm banks, transplant organ banks, etc.

- Ambulance transport of patients by any mode of transport including airplanes. These services are often provided during a medical emergency.

Exclusion:

- Production of artificial teeth, denture and prosthetic appliances by dental laboratories, under class 32501 (Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies).

- Transfer of patients, with neither equipment for lifesaving nor medical personnel, under divisions 49 (Land transport and transport via pipelines), 50 (Water transport) and 51 (Air transport);

- Non-medical testing, under class 71200 (Technical testing and analysis);

- Testing activities in the field of food hygiene, under class 71200 (Technical testing and analysis).

87: RESIDENTIAL CARE AND NURSING ACTIVITIES

This group includes the provision of residential care combined with either nursing, supervisory or other types of care as required by the residents. Accommodation facilities are a significant part of the care process and the care provided is a mix of health and social services with the health services being largely some level of nursing services.

871 - 8710: Nursing care facilities

This class includes the activities of nursing facilities and convalescent facilities providing inpatient services to people recovering, suffering poor health conditions or requiring examination and supervision by medical personnel, or undergoing physiotherapy, rehabilitation and rest.

87101: Nursing care facilities for wounded and sick soldiers

This class includes the activities of facilities providing nursing care to wounded and sick soldiers, persons entitled to wounded soldier's benefits and deprived of 81% or more capacity to work due to injuries, diseases or special circumstances that inhibit their living with family. Such individuals shall be put under care by provincial nursing care facilities adjacent to the residential location of their family.

87109: Other nursing care facilities

This class includes:

- Homes for the elderly with nursing care;

- Convalescent homes;

- Rest homes with nursing care;

- Nursing care facilities;

- Nursing homes.

Exclusion:

- In-home health care services, under division 86 (Health activities);

- Homes for the elderly without or with minimal nursing care, under class 87302 (Health care activities for the elderly);

- Social work activities with accommodation, such as orphanages or temporary homeless shelters, under class 87909 (Other residential care activities not elsewhere classified).

872 - 8720: Health care activities for mental retardation, mental illness and substance abuse

87201: Health care activities for mental retardation and mental illness

This class includes the provision of health care (but not licensed hospital care) to people with mental retardation and mental illness. Facilities provide room, meal, protective supervision and counseling and some health care. It also includes provision of care and treatment for patients with mental health issues.

This class also includes:

- Psychiatric convalescent homes;

- Residential homes for the delusioned and the emotionally disturbed;

- Mental retardation facilities;

- Mental health halfway houses.

Exclusion: Social work activities with accommodation, such as temporary homeless shelters, under class 87909 (Other residential care activities not elsewhere classified).

87202: Health care activities for substance abuse

This class includes:

- Provision of care (but not licensed hospital care) to people with substance abuse problems. Facilities provide room, meal, protective supervision and counseling and some health care. It also includes provision of residential care and treatment for patients with substance abuse issues;

- Facilities for treatment of alcoholism and drug addiction;

- Activities of drug addiction rehabilitation facilities providing patients recovering with: treatment, vocational training, re-integration into society.

873 - 8730: Health care activities for the persons having rendered meritorious services, the elderly and disabled not capable of self-care

87301: Health care activities for the persons having rendered meritorious services (except wounded and sick soldiers)

This class includes the activities of facilities providing health and nursing care to people who rendered meritorious services to the revolution.

Exclusion: Provision of health and nursing care to wounded and sick soldiers, under class 87101 (Nursing care facilities for wounded and sick soldiers).

87302: Health care activities for the elderly

This class includes the provision of care services for the elderly who are unable to fully care for themselves or who do not desire to live independently. The care typically includes room and board, supervision, and assistance in daily living, such as housekeeping services. In some instances, these units provide skilled nursing care for residents in separate on-site facilities.

This class also includes:

- Activities of assisted-living facilities;

- Continuing care activities for retired people;

- Homes for the elderly with minimal nursing care;

- Rest homes without nursing care.

Exclusion:

- Homes for the elderly with nursing care, under class 87109 (Other nursing care facilities);

- Social work activities with accommodation where medical treatment or accommodation is not an important element, under class 87909 (Other residential care activities not elsewhere classified).

87303: Health care activities for the disabled

This class includes the provision of care services to the disabled. The care typically includes room, meal, supervision, and assistance in daily living, such as housekeeping services. In some instances, these units provide skilled nursing care for residents in separate on-site facilities.

Exclusion: Social work activities with accommodation where medical treatment or accommodation is not an important element, under class 87909 (Other residential care activities not elsewhere classified).

879 - 8790: Other residential care activities

87901: Medical treatment and rehabilitation activities for prostitutes

This class includes the activities of facilities providing education, treatment, vocational training and social reintegration to prostitutes.

87909: Other residential care activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Provision of personal or residential care services for the elderly and disabled who are unable to fully care for themselves or who do not desire to live independently;

- Activities provided by governmental or private organizations on a round-the-clock basis directed to provide social assistance to children and special categories of persons with some limits on ability for self-care, but where medical treatment or education are not important elements, such as:

+ Orphanages,

+ Children's dormitories and boarding homes,

+ Temporary homeless shelters,

+ Institutions that provide care to unmarried mothers and their children.

Exclusion:

- Establishment and allocation of compulsory social security funds, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security);

- Nursing care facilities, under class 8710 (Nursing care facilities);

- Residential care activities for the elderly and disabled, under class 87302 (Health care activities for the elderly) and 87303 (Health care activities for the disabled);

- Adoption activities, under class 88900 (Other social work activities without accommodation);

- Short-term shelter activities for disaster victims, under class 88900 (Other social work activities without accommodation).

88: SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES WITHOUT ACCOMMODATION

This division includes the provision of diverse social assistance services directly to the clients. The activities in this division do not include accommodation services, except on a temporary basis.

881 - 8810: Social work activities without accommodation for the persons having rendered meritorious services, wounded and sick soldiers, the elderly and disabled

88101: Social work activities without accommodation for the persons having rendered meritorious services (except wounded and sick soldiers)

This class includes supports and assistance provided by public authorities, private organizations and individuals to the people having rendered meritorious services (except wounded and sick soldiers) through practical gratitude programs, such as giving gratitude houses, savings accounts, care, education, sponsorship, employment, etc. in order to help stabilizing the beneficiaries’ life.

88102: Social work activities without accommodation wounded and sick soldiers

This class includes supports and assistance provided by public authorities, private organizations and individuals to wounded and sick soldiers through practical gratitude programs, such as giving gratitude houses, savings accounts, care, education, sponsorship, employment, etc. in order to help stabilizing the beneficiaries’ life.

88103: Social work activities without accommodation for the elderly and disabled

This class includes social, counseling, welfare, referral and similar services which are aimed at the elderly and disabled in their homes or elsewhere and carried out by governmental authorities or by private organizations, national or local self-help organizations and by specialists providing counseling services:

- Visiting of the elderly and disabled;

- Day-care activities for the elderly and for handicapped adults;

- Vocational habilitation and rehabilitation activities for disabled persons whose education is limited.

Exclusion:

- Establishment and allocation of compulsory social security funds, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security);

- Activities similar to those described in this class, but including accommodation, under classes 87302 (Health care activities for the elderly) and 87303 (Health care activities for the disabled).

889 - 8890 - 88900: Other social work activities without accommodation

This class includes: Social, counseling, welfare, refugee services, referral and similar services which are aimed at individuals and families in their homes or elsewhere and carried out by governmental authorities or by private organizations, disaster recovery organizations, national or local self-help organizations and by specialists providing counseling services:

- Activities of protecting and orienting children and adolescents;

- Adoption activities;

- Activities of preventing violence against children and others;

- Counseling services for family finance, marital and family affairs, loan and lending;

- Community-based and neighborhood-based reciprocal activities;

- Relief activities for disaster victims, refugees, immigrants, etc. including provision of employment, temporary or permanent shelters;

- Vocational habilitation and rehabilitation activities for unemployed persons whose education is limited.

- Day-care social activities for homeless and physically ill people;

- Philanthropic activities such as funding or other activities that provide social assistance.

Exclusion:

- Establishment and allocation of compulsory social security funds, under class 84300 (Compulsory social security);

- Activities similar to those described in this class, but including accommodation, under class 87900 (Other residential care activities not elsewhere classified).

R: ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION

This section includes a wide range of activities to meet varied cultural, entertainment and recreational interests of the general public, including live performances, operation of museum sites, gambling, sports and recreation activities.

90: CREATIVE, ARTS AND ENTERTAINMENT ACTIVITIES

900 - 9000 - 90000: Creative, arts and entertainment activities

This class includes the operation of facilities and provision of services to meet the cultural and entertainment interests of their customers. This includes the production and promotion of, and participation in, live performances, events or exhibits intended for public viewing; the provision of artistic, creative or technical skills for the production of artistic products and live performances.

This class also includes:

- Organization of live theatrical presentations, concerts and opera or dance productions and other stage productions:

+ Activities of groups, circuses or companies, bands or orchestras,

+ Activities of individual artists such as authors, actors, directors, producers, musicians, speakers or show hosts, stage-set designers and builders, etc.,

+ Operation of concert and theatre halls and other arts facilities,

+ Activities of sculptors, painters, cartoonists, engravers, etchers, etc.

+ Activities of writers, for all subjects including fictional writing and technical writing, etc.,

+ Activities of independent journalists,

+ Restoring of works of art such as painting restoration, etc.;

- Activities of producers or contractors of arts live events, with or without facilities.

Exclusion:

- Restoring of stained glass windows, under class 23100 (Manufacture of glass and glass products);

- Manufacture of statues, other than artistic originals, under class 23960 (Cutting, shaping and finishing of stone);

- Restoring of organs and other historical musical instruments, under class 33190 (Repair of other equipment);

- Restoring of historical sites and buildings, under class 41000 (Construction of buildings);

- Motion picture and video production, under classes 5911 (Motion picture, video and television program production activities) , 5912 (Post-production activities) and 5913 (Motion picture, video and television program distribution activities);

- Operation of cinemas, under class 5914 (Motion picture projection activities);

- Activities of personal theatrical or artistic agents or agencies, under class 74909 (Other professional, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

- Casting activities, under class 78100 (Activities of employment agencies);

- Activities of ticket agencies, under class 79200 (Tourism promotion and operation support activities)

- Operation of museums of all kinds, under class 91020 (Conservation activities and museums);

- Sports, amusement and recreation activities, under division 93 (Sports activities, amusement and recreational activities);

- Restoring of furniture (except museum-type restoration), under class 95240 (Repair of furniture and home furnishings).

91: LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, MUSEUMS AND OTHER CULTURAL ACTIVITIES

This division includes the activities of libraries and archives; operation of museums of all kinds, botanical and zoological gardens; operation of historical sites and nature reserves activities. It also includes the preservation and exhibition of objects, sites and natural wonders of historical, cultural or educational interest (e.g. world heritage sites, etc.). Exclusion: Sports and recreation activities, such as the operation of bathing beaches and recreation parks, under division 93 (Sports, amusement and recreation activities).

910: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities

9101 - 91010: Library and archives activities

This class includes the provision of books, newspapers, photos, documents and information by libraries and national archives, reading rooms and audiovisual facilities. The activities include specialized and non-specialized collecting, making of folders, searching of information on request, storing of books, newspapers, motion picture, discs, tapes, maps, etc. Such activities are intended for students, science researchers, politicians, members or the public.

9102 - 91020: Conservation activities and museums

This class includes the operation of museums of various types such as museums of revolution, history museums, art museums, science and technological museums, museums of jewellery, museums of ceramics, museums of costumes and furniture, architecture museums, etc. including the conservation of houses, historical sites and buildings.

Exclusion:

- Renovation and restoration of historical sites and buildings, under section G (Construction);

- Restoration of works of art and museum collection objects, under class 90000 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities);

- Activities of libraries and archives, under class 91010 (Library and archives activities);

9103 - 91030: Botanical and zoological gardens and nature reserves activities

This class includes:

- Operation of botanical and zoological gardens, including children’s zoos;

- Operation of nature reserves, including wildlife preservation, etc.

Exclusion:

- Landscape and gardening services, under class 81300 (Landscape care and maintenance service activities);

- Operation of sport fishing and hunting preserves, under class 93190 (Other sports activities).

92: LOTTERY, BETTING AND GAMBLING ACTIVITIES

This division includes the operation of gambling facilities such as casinos, bingo halls and video gaming terminals and the provision of gambling services, such as lotteries and off-track betting.

920: Lottery, betting and gambling activities

9200: Lottery, betting and gambling activities

92001: Lottery activities

This class includes the sale of lottery tickets.

92002: Betting and gambling activities

This class includes betting and gambling activities.

It includes:

- Exploitation of coin-operated gambling machines;

- Exploitation of coin-operated gaming machines;

- Operation of virtual gambling websites;

- Horse racing bookmaking and other betting operations;

- Off-track betting;

- Operation of casinos.

93: SPORTS, AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION ACTIVITIES

This division includes the provision of recreational, amusement and sports activities (except museums activities, conservation of historical sites, botanical and zoological gardens and nature reserves activities; and gambling and betting activities).

Exclusion: Dramatic arts, music and other arts and entertainment such as the production of live theatrical presentations, concerts and opera or dance productions and other stage productions, under division 90 (Creative, arts and entertainment activities).

931: Sports activities

This group includes the operation of sports facilities; activities of sports teams or clubs primarily participating in live sports events before paying audiences; independent athletes engaged in participating in live sporting or racing events before paying audiences; owners of racing participants such as cars, dogs, horses, etc. primarily engaged in entering them in racing events or other spectator sports events; sports trainers providing specialized services to support participants in sports events or competitions; operators of arenas and stadiums; other activities of organizing, promoting or managing sports events, not elsewhere classified.

9311 - 93110: Operation of sports facilities

This class includes:

- Operation of facilities for indoor or outdoor sports events (open, closed or covered, with or without spectator seating):

+ Football, hockey, cricket and baseball stadiums,

+ Racetracks for auto, dog and horse races,

+ Swimming pools and stadiums,

+ Track and field stadiums,

+ Winter sports arenas and stadiums,

+ Boxing arenas,

+ Golf courses,

+ Bowling lanes;

- Organization and operation of outdoor or indoor sports events for professionals or amateurs by organizations with own facilities;

- This includes managing and providing the staff to operate these facilities.

Exclusion:

- Leasing of recreation and sports equipment, under class 77210 (Leasing of sports and recreational goods);

- Park and beach activities, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

9312 - 93120: activities of sports clubs

This class includes:

- Activities of professional, semi-professional or amateur sports clubs, which give their members the opportunity to engage in sporting activities.

It includes:

- Football clubs;

- Bowling clubs;

- Swimming clubs;

- Golf clubs;

- Boxing clubs;

- Wrestling and body-building clubs;

- Winter sports clubs;

- Chess clubs;

- Track and field clubs;

- Shooting clubs.

Exclusion:

- Sports instruction by individual teachers and  trainers, under class 85510 (Sports and recreation education);

- Operation of sports facilities, under class 93110 (Operation of sports facilities);

- Organization and operation of outdoor or indoor sports events for professionals or amateurs by sports clubs with their own facilities, under class 93110 (Operation of sports facilities).

9319 - 93190: Other sports activities

This class includes:

- Activities of directors and organizers of sports events, with or without facilities;

- Activities of individual own-account sportsmen and athletes, referees, timekeepers, etc.;

- Activities of sports leagues and regulating bodies;

- Activities related to promotion of sporting events;

- Activities of racing stables, kennels and garages;

- Operation of sport hunting and fishing preserves;

- Support activities for sport or recreational fishing and hunting.

Exclusion:

- Leasing of sports equipment, under class 77210 (Leasing of sports and recreational goods);

- Activities of sport and game schools, under class 85510 (Sports and recreation education);

- Activities of sports instructors, teachers and coaches, under class 85510 (Sports and recreation education);

- Organization and operation of outdoor or indoor sports events for professionals or amateurs by sports clubs with or without their own facilities, under classes 93110 (Operation of sports facilities) or 93120 (Activities of sports clubs);

- Park and beach activities, under class 93290 (Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified).

932: Other amusement and recreation activities

This group includes a wide range of units that operate facilities or provide services to meet the varied recreational interests of their customers. It includes the operation of a variety of attractions, such as mechanical rides, water rides, games, shows, theme exhibits and picnic grounds. This group excludes sports activities, dramatic arts, music and other arts and entertainment activities.

9321 - 93210: activities of amusement parks and theme parks

This class includes the activities of amusement parks or theme parks, including the operation of a variety of attractions, such as mechanical rides, water rides, games, shows, theme exhibits and picnic grounds.

9329 - 93290: Other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Other amusement and recreation activities (except amusement parks and theme parks);

- Activities of recreation parks, beaches, including renting of facilities such as bathhouses, lockers, chairs, umbrella poles, etc.;

- Operation of recreational transport facilities, e.g. marinas;

- Leasing of leisure equipment as an integral part of recreational facilities;

- Operation of fairs and shows of a recreational nature;

- Operation of dance floors.

This class also includes the activities of directors or contractors of live events other than arts or sports events, with or without facilities.

Exclusion:

- Marine fishing, under classes 5011 (Coastal and sea passenger water transport) and 5021 (Inland passenger water transport);

- Provision of space and facilities for short stay by visitors in recreational parks and forests and campgrounds, under class 55902 (Trailer parks, tents and bivouac facilities);

- Beverage serving activities of discotheques, under class 5630 (Beverage serving activities);

- Climbers gardens, campgrounds, recreational camps, hunting and fishing camps, under class 55902 (Trailer parks, tents and bivouac facilities).

S: OTHER SERVICE ACTIVITIES

94: activities OF OTHER ASSOCIATIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS

This division includes the activities of organizations representing interests of specific groups or promoting ideas to the general public. These organizations usually have a constituency of members, but their activities may involve and benefit non-members as well. The primary breakdown of this division is determined by the purpose that these organizations serve, namely interests of employers, self-employed individuals and the scientific community under group 941 (Activities of business associations, employers and professional organizations), interests of employees under group 942 (Activities of trade unions) or promotion of religious, political, cultural, educational activities under group 949 (Activities of other organizations).

941: activities of business associations, employers and professional organizations

This group includes the activities of units that promote the interests of the members of business and employers organizations. In the case of professional membership organizations, it also includes the activities of promoting the professional interests of members.

9411 - 94110: activities of business associations and employers organizations

This class includes:

- Activities of organizations whose members' interests focus on the development and prosperity of enterprises in a particular line of business or trade, including farming, or on the economic growth and climate of a particular geographical area or political subdivision without regard for the line of business.

- Activities of federations of such enterprises;

- Activities of chambers of commerce, guilds and similar organizations;

- Dissemination of information, representation before government agencies, public relations and labor negotiations.

Exclusion: activities of trade unions, under class 9420 (Activities of trade unions).

9412 - 94120: activities of professional organizations

This class includes:

- Activities of organizations whose members' interests focus on a particular field, such as medical associations, legal associations, accounting associations, engineering associations, architects associations, etc.;

- Activities of associations of specialists engaged in scientific, theoretical or cultural activities, such as associations of writers, painters, performers, journalists, etc.;

- Dissemination of information, establishment and supervision of standards of practice, representation before government agencies and labor negotiations;

This class also includes the activities of learned societies.

Exclusion: Education provided by these organizations, under division 85 (Education and training).

942 - 9420 -94200: activities of trade unions

This class includes the activities of trade unions in non-state-owned enterprises (e.g. labor federations). Activities of trade unions that defend the interests (e.g. salary, work hours, etc.) of member workers in enterprises where the workers engage in business activities.

Exclusion: activities of specialized trade unions chiefly funded by the government, under class 84130 (State management of specialized economic sectors).

949: activities of other organizations

This group includes the activities of units (except business and employers organizations, professional organizations, trade unions) that operate toward the interests of their members.

9491 - 94910: activities of religious organizations

This class includes:

- Activities of religious organizations (e.g. Christianity, Buddhism, etc.) providing services directly to worshippers in churches, temples, pagodas, cathedrals or other places;

- Activities of organizations providing supplies to monasteries and convents;

- Religious retreat activities.

This class also includes religious funeral services.

Exclusion:

- Education provided by such organizations, under division 85 (Education and training);

- Health activities by such organizations, under division 86 (Health activities);

- Social work activities by such organizations, under divisions 87 (Residential care and nursing activities) and 88 (Social work activities without accommodation).

9499 - 94990: activities of other organizations not elsewhere classified

This class includes the activities of organizations of specific nature affiliated to members’ hobbies, which are organized voluntarily and funded by the members: football fan clubs, ornamental plant clubs, bird clubs, etc.

95: REPAIR OF COMPUTERS, PERSONAL AND HOUSEHOLD GOODS

This division includes the repair and maintenance of desktop computers, laptops, peripheral equipment such as storage devices and printers, etc. It also includes the repair of communications equipment such as fax machines, consumer electronics such as radios, cassette players, home appliances, footwear and genuine and imitation leather goods, furniture and home furnishings, clothing and other apparel, sporting goods, musical instruments, and other personal and household goods.

Exclusion: Repair of medical and diagnostic machines and imaging equipment, measuring and testing instruments, laboratory instruments, radar and sonar and supersonic equipment, under class 33130 (Repair of electronic and optical equipment).

951: Repair of computers and communication equipment

This group includes the repair and maintenance of computers, peripheral equipment and communications equipment.

9511 - 95110: Repair of computers and peripheral equipment

This class includes:

- Repair of electronic equipment, such as computers and peripheral equipment;

- Desktop computers and laptop computers;

- Magnetic disk drivers and other storage devices;

- Optical disk drivers (CD-RW, CD-ROM, DVD-ROM, DVD-RW);

- Printers;

- Processing units:

- Keyboards;

- Mice, joysticks and trackballs;

- Internal and external modems;

- Dedicated computer terminals;

- Computer servers;

- Scanners, including bar code scanners;

- Smart card readers;

- Virtual reality helmets;

- Computer projectors.

This class also includes:

- Repair and maintenance of:

+ Input/output terminals such as automatic teller machines, point-of-sale terminals, not mechanically operated,

+ Hand-held computers.

Exclusion: Repair and maintenance of carrier equipment modems, under class 95120 (Repair of communication equipment);

9512 - 95120: Repair of communication equipment

This class includes the repair and maintenance of communications equipment such as:

- Wired telephones;

- Cellular phones;

- Carrier equipment modems;

- Fax machines;

- Communications transmission equipment;

- Two-way radios;

- Commercial TV and video cameras.

952: Repair of personal and household goods

This group includes the repair of personal and household goods.

9521 - 95210: Repair of audiovisual and consumer electronics

This class includes the repair and maintenance of audiovisual and consumer electronics:

- Television, radio, cassette players;

- Video players;

- CD players;

- Household-type video cameras.

9522 - 95220: Repair of household appliances and goods

This class includes the repair of household appliances and goods:

- Refrigerators, stoves, grills, washing machines, pressing machines, clothes dryers, air conditioners, etc.

- Garden equipment, trimmers, etc.

Exclusion:

- Repair of electrical hand tools, under class 33120 (Repair of machinery and equipment);

- Repair of central air conditioning systems, under class 43222 (Heating and air-conditioning installation).

9523 - 95230: Repair of footwear and leather goods

This class includes the repair of shoes, sandals, luggage and leather goods.

9524 - 95240: Repair of furniture and home furnishings

This class includes the repairing, restoring and refinishing of furniture, including office furnishings.

9529 - 95290: Repair of other personal and household goods

This class includes:

- Repair of bicycles;

- Repair of clothing;

- Repair of jewellery;

- Repair of watches, clocks, watch bands, watchcases, etc.;

- Repair of sporting goods (except sporting guns);

- Repair of musical instruments, books, other personal and household goods.

Exclusion:

- Industrial engraving of metals, under class 25920 (Machining, treatment and coating of metals);

- Repair of electrical hand tools, under class 33120 (Repair of machinery and equipment);

- Repair of sporting and recreational guns, under class 33120 (Repair of machinery and equipment);

- Repair of time clocks, time stamps, date stamps, time locks and similar time recording devices, under class 33130 (Repair of electronic and optical equipment).

96: OTHER PERSONAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES

961 - 9610 - 96100: Steambath, massage and health improvement services (except sports activities)

This class includes steambath, massage, tanning, non-invasive cosmetic procedures (stomach flattening, body contouring, etc.)

962 - 9620 - 96200: Washing and cleaning of textile and fur products

This class includes:

- Dry-cleaning, washing, laundering, etc. of clothing (including fur) and textiles, by hand or by machines;

- Laundry collection and delivery;

- Cleaning of rug, sheet cover, pillow, drapery and curtain, including collection and delivery of items to clients' premises.

This class also includes the repair and minor alteration of garments or other textile articles (e.g. re-buttoning, zipper replacement, etc.) when done in connection with cleaning.

Exclusion:

- Renting of wearing apparel other than protective clothing, even if cleaning of the clothing is an integral part of the renting activity, under class 7730 (Leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods);

- Repair of clothing as an independent activity, under class 95290 (Repair of other personal and household goods).

963: Other personal service activities not elsewhere classified

9631 - 96310: Hairdressing and shampooing

This class includes:

- Hair cutting, washing, setting, drying, dyeing, straightening and other hairdressing activities for men and women;

- Shaving and beard trimming;

- Facial massage, manicure, pedicure, make-up, etc.

Exclusion: Manufacture of wigs, under class 32900 (Other manufacturing not elsewhere classified).

9632 - 96320: Funeral service activities

This class includes:

- Burial, incineration and electric cremation and related activities;

- Embalming and morticians’ activities and services for preparing the dead for burial, incineration or electric cremation;

- Funeral parlors’ services;

- Sale or renting of graves;

- Maintenance of cemeteries.

Exclusion: Religious funeral service activities, under class 94910 (Activities of religious organizations).

9633 - 96330: Wedding service activities

This class includes the activities of a social nature, such as marriage brokerage, organizing and servicing of weddings and engagement events, etc.

9639 - 96390: Other personal service activities not elsewhere classified

This class includes:

- Shoe shiners, porters, home maids;

- Pet care and training services;

- Concession operation of coin-operated service machines: weighing machines, blood pressure checking machines, etc.

Exclusion:

- Veterinary activities, under class 75000 (Veterinary activities);

- Activities of fitness and bodybuilding centers, under class 93110 (Operation of sports facilities).

T: ACTIVITIES OF HOUSEHOLDS AS EMPLOYERS; GOODS-PRODUCING AND SERVICES-PRODUCING ACTIVITIES OF HOUSEHOLDS FOR OWN USE

97: ACTIVITIES OF HOUSEHOLDS AS EMPLOYERS

970 - 9700 - 9700: ACTIVITIES OF HOUSEHOLDS AS EMPLOYERS

This class includes:

- Activities of households as employers such as babysitters, cooks, butlers, gardeners, gatekeepers, caregivers for the elderly, chauffeurs, caretakers, tutors, governesses, secretaries, etc.;

- The employer states the household activity of personnel employed in censuses or studies, even though the employer is an individual. The product produced by this activity is intended for the employing household.

Exclusion: Provision of services such as cooking, gardening, etc. by independent service providers (companies or individuals), classified according to the type of service.

98: GOODS-PRODUCING AND SERVICE-PRODUCING ACTIVITIES OF HOUSEHOLDS FOR OWN USE

This division includes:

- Subsistence goods-producing and services-producing activities of households;

- Households should be classified here if it is possible to identify a primary activity for the subsistence activities of the household. If the household engages in market activities (i.e. producing goods for sale), it should be classified according to the primary market activity carried out under the standard industrial classification system.

981 - 9810 - 98100: Goods-producing activities of households for own use

This class includes subsistence goods-producing activities of households. The activities include rice farming and production of household goods such as: Baskets, clothing, hats and other goods for own subsistence. If households are also engaged in the production of marketed goods, they are classified to the appropriate goods-producing industry of Vietnam’s standard industrial classification system. If households are principally engaged in a specific goods-producing subsistence activity, they are classified to the goods-producing activity of households for own use.

982 - 9820 - 98200: Services-producing activities of households for own use

This class includes subsistence services-producing activities of households. These activities include cooking, teaching, caring for household members, transportation and other services produced by the household for its own subsistence. If households are also engaged in the production of marketed services, they are classified to the appropriate manufacturing industry of Vietnam’s standard industrial classification system. If households are principally engaged in a services-producing subsistence activity, they are classified to the services-producing activity of households for own use under this class.

U: ACTIVITIES OF INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND BODIES

99: ACTIVITIES OF INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND BODIES

990 - 9900 - 99000: activities of international organizations and bodies

This class includes the activities of international organizations such as the United Nations and the specialized agencies of the its system, regional bodies such as the International Monetary Fund, the World Bank, the Consumers International, the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development, the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, the European Communities, the European Free Trade Association, etc.

Exclusion: activities of diplomatic and consular missions by other countries.
mdContentEn:
**MINISTRY OF PLANNING AND INVESTMENT  
\--------**

**SOCIALIST** **REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM  
Independence - Freedom - Happiness  
\---------------**

No. 337/QD-BKH

_Hanoi, April 10, 2007_

**DECISION**

ON CONTENTS OF VIETNAM STANDARD INDUSTRIAL CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM

**MINISTER OF PLANNING AND INVESTMENT**

_Pursuant to the Government’s Decree No. [61/2003/ND-CP](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/doanh-nghiep/-76768.aspx "Decree of Government 61/2003/ND-CP") dated June 06, 2003 on functions, missions, authority and organizational structure of the Ministry of Planning and Investment;_

_Pursuant to the Government’s Decree No. 01/ND-CP dated January 04, 2007 on re-assignment of the General Statistics Office of Vietnam to the Ministry of Planning and Investment;_

_Pursuant to the Prime Minister's Decision No. [10/2007/QD-TTg](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/doanh-nghiep/decision-no-10-2007-qd-ttg-of-january-23-2007-promulgating-the-vietnams-system-75547.aspx "Decision 10/2007/QD-TTg") dated January 23, 2007 on promulgation of Vietnam's standard industrial classification system;_

_At the request of the Head of the General Statistics Office of Vietnam;_

**DECIDES:**

**Article 1.** This Decision is enclosed with the regulated details of Vietnam’s standard industrial classification system, which was promulgated under the Prime Minister's Decision No. [10/2007/QD-TTg](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/doanh-nghiep/decision-no-10-2007-qd-ttg-of-january-23-2007-promulgating-the-vietnams-system-75547.aspx "Decision 10/2007/QD-TTg") .

**Article 2.** General Statistics Office of Vietnam shall cooperate with relevant authorities:

\- It shall provide guidelines to Ministries, agencies and organizations concerned for their adherence to the regulated details of Vietnam’s standard industrial classification system;

\- It shall supervise relevant activities and present to the Minister of Planning and Investment the revisions, if deemed necessary, to Vietnam’s standard industrial classification system.

**Article 3.** Head of General Statistical Offices of Vietnam, Manager of the Ministry’s office, Heads of agencies under the Ministry and Planning and Investment shall be responsible for implementing this Decision.

**MINISTER  
  
  
  
  
Vo Hong Phuc**

**BUSINESS LINE SYSTEM**

**A: AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND AQUACULTURE**

**01: AGRICULTURE AND RELATED SERVICES**

**011: Annual crop cultivation**

**0111 - 01110: Growing of rice**

This class includes the activities of cultivating (transplanting or sowing) varieties of rice: wet rice or upland rice.

**0112 - 01120: Growing of corn and grain crops**

This class includes the activities of cultivating corn (except cornstalk grown as cattle feed) and grain crops such as: wheat, oats, sorghum, millet.

**0113 - 01130: Growing of starchy root and tuber crops**

This class includes the activities of cultivating root and tuber crops high in starch such as: sweet potato, cassava, taro, yam, canna, etc.

**Exclusion:** Growing of potato, under class **01181 (Growing of vegetables)**.

**0114 - 01140: Growing of sugarcane**

This class includes the activities of cultivating sugarcane for raw serving or for production of sugar or treacle.

**0115 - 01150: Growing of tobacco or aztec tobacco**

This class includes the activities of growing tobacco or aztec tobacco for cigarette rolling (cigar) and production of tobacco or aztec tobacco.

**0116 - 01160: Growing of fiber crops**

This class includes the activities for cultivating levant cotton, jute, sedges, ramie, flax and other fiber crops.

**0117 - 01170: Growing of oilseed crops**

This class includes the activities of cultivating oilseed crops such as soybean, peanut, sesame, castor, rapeseed, sunflower, safflower, mustard and other oilseed crops.

**0118: Growing of vegetables, bean, flowers and ornamental plants**

**01181: Growing of vegetables**

This class includes the activities of cultivating vegetables:

\- Growing of leaf vegetables: cruciferous vegetables, cabbage, water spinach, broccoli, green cauliflower, lettuce, asparagus, garland chrysanthemum, Japanese parsley, celery and other leaf vegetables;

\- Growing of fruit vegetables such as: water melon, cucumber, wax gourd, pumpkin, tomato, chili, melons and other fruit vegetables;

\- Growing of root vegetables or shoot vegetables: kohlrabi, carrot, potato, radish, onion, garlic, leek, coriander, Chinese chives and other root vegetables or shoot vegetables;

\- Growing of beet;

\- Growing of mushroom or gathering of shiitake or paddy straw mushroom.

**Exclusion:**

\- Growing of spice crops, under class

01281 (Growing of spice crops) and 01282 (Growing of pharmaceutical crops);

\- Gathering of wild fruits such as: Chinese olive, wild mushrooms, wild vegetables, wild fruits, etc., under class 02300 (Gathering of non-timber forest products).

**01182: Growing of bean**

This class includes the activities of cultivating beans such as: black peas, green peas, yellow split peas, cranberry bean, garden peas, etc.

**Exclusion:** Growing of soybean, under class 01170 (Growing of oilseed crops).

**01183: Growing of flowers and ornamental plants**

This class includes the activities of growing of flowers and ornamental plants for daily activities, landscape or environment decoration, cultural activities, etc.

**0119 - 01190: Growing of perennial plants**

This class includes the activities of cultivating annual agricultural plants that do not, under class 0111 to 0118, as follows: activities for cultivating plants as cattle feed: growing of cornstalk or grass, planning and nurturing of natural grasslands, growing of azolla as pig’s feed, growing of plants as green fertilizer (sicklepod), etc.

**Exclusion:** Growing of spice crops, under class 01281 (Growing of spice crops) and growing of medicinal plants, under class 01282 (Growing of pharmaceutical crops).

**012: Growing of perennial plants**

**0121: Growing of fruit plants**

**01211: Growing of grapes**

This class includes growing of grapes for eating and for production of wine.

**Exclusion:** Production of grape wine, under class 11020 (Manufacture of wine).

**01212: Growing of mango, tropical and sub-tropical fruit plants**

This class includes the activities of growing of mango, banana, papaya, cluster fig, date palm, tropical and sub-tropical fruit plants.

**01213: Growing of orange, tangerine and hesperidia**

This class includes the activities of growing of orange, lemon, tangerine, pomelo and other citrus fruits.

**01214: Growing of apple, plum and stone fruits such as apple**

This class includes the activities of growing of apple, plum, apricot, cherry, pear and other stone fruits such as apple.

**01215: Growing of longan, litchi and rambutan**

This class includes the activities of growing of longan, litchi and rambutan.

**01219: Growing of other fruit plants**

This class includes the activities of growing of fruit plants that do not, under class 01211 to 01215, as follows: Growing of fruit bushes and stone fruits such as berries, blackberry, strawberry, chestnut, walnut, etc.

**Exclusion:** Growing of cashew, under class 01230 (Growing of cashew) 0122 - 01220: Growing of oil-bearing fruits

This class includes the activities of growing of coconut, olive, oil palm and other oil-bearing fruits.

**0123 - 01230: Growing of cashew**

This class includes the activities of cultivating cashew.

**0124 - 01240: Growing of pepper**

This class includes the activities of cultivating pepper.

**0125 - 01250: Growing of rubber tree**

This class includes the activities of cultivating rubber tree.

**0126 - 01260: Growing of coffea**

This class includes the activities of cultivating coffea.

**0127 - 01270: Growing of tea plant**

This class includes the activities of cultivating tea plant.

**0128: Growing of spice crops and pharmaceutical plants**

**01281: Growing of spice crops**

This class includes the activities of growing of plants mainly used as spice such as ginger, clove, vanilla, etc.

**Exclusion:** Growing of pepper, under class 01240 (Growing of pepper).

**01282: Growing of pharmaceutical crops**

This class includes the activities of growing of plants mainly used as medicines in various forms. Usable parts of such plants can be pharmaceutical ingredients or non-processed (traditional) medicines, as follows: peppermint, star anis, job’s tears, pseudoginseng, mugwort, tsaoko cardamom, etc.

**0129 - 01290: Growing of other perennial plants**

This class includes the activities of growing of other perennial plants that do not, under class 0121 to 0128, as follows: white mulberry, areca, betel, etc.

**013 - 0130 - 01300: Propagation and growing of agricultural cultivars**

This class includes:

Practice of horticulture including activities of cutting, pruning, formation of protocorm or plantlets for direct shoot regeneration or growing of shoots from selected grafting rootstocks to produce cultivars, as follows:

\- Annual germination of cultivars such as: cultivars of kohlrabi, cabbage, broccoli, tomato, etc.

\- Ornamental or perennial plants that are grown by germination, grafting or cutting;

\- Activities of agricultural cultivar arboreta, except forestry nurseries.

**014: Animal husbandry**

**0141 - 01410: Raising of cattle**

This class includes:

\- Raising of cattle for meat production, ploughing, milk production or breeding;

\- Production of whole milk from dairy cattle;

\- Production of bovine semen.

**Exclusion:**

\- Activities for cattle quarantine, care and bottle-feeding, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

\- Cattle slaughtering or processing of cattle meat outside the animal husbandry ranch, under class 1010 (Processing and storage of meat and meat products);

\- Processing of milk outside the ranch, under class 10500 (Processing of milk and dairy products).

**0142 - 01420: Raising of horse, donkey or mule**

This class includes:

\- Raising of horse, donkey or mule for meat production, milk production or breeding; - Production of whole milk from mare, jenny or mare mule;

\- Production of semen from stallion, jack, horse mule.

**Exclusion:**

\- Activities for quarantine, care and bottle-feeding of horse, donkey or mule or sheep shearing, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

\- Slaughtering of horse, donkey or mule or processing of their meat outside the animal husbandry ranch, under class 1010 (Processing and storage of meat and meat products);

\- Processing of milk outside the ranch, under class 10500 (Processing of milk and dairy products);

\- Activities of a horse racing course, under class 93190 (Other sports activities).

**0144 - 01440: Raising of goat or sheep**

This class includes:

\- Raising and breeding of goat and sheep;

\- Production of whole milk from doe and ewe;

\- Sheep shearing.

**Exclusion:**

\- Paid or contract shearing work, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

\- Production of fur fibers, under class 14200 (Manufacture of articles of fur skins);

\- Processing of milk, under class 10500 (Processing of milk and dairy products);

**0145 - 01450: Raising of pig**

This class includes:

\- Raising of breeder boar, sow, feeder pig, suckling pig;

\- Production of pig semen.

**Exclusion:**

\- Activities for pig quarantine, care and bottle-feeding, under class 01620 (Animal husbandry services);

\- Pig slaughtering or processing of pig meat outside the animal husbandry ranch, under class 1010 (Processing and storage of meat and meat products);

**0146: Raising of poultry**

**01461: Egg incubation and poultry breeding**

This class includes the activities of facilities incubating eggs for breeding or production of haft-hatched eggs.

**01462: Raising of chicken**

This class includes the activities of Raising of chicken for meat and eggs.

**01463: Raising of duck, muscovy duck or goose**

This class includes the activities of raising of duck, muscovy duck or goose for meat and eggs.

**01469: Raising of other poultry**

This class includes the activities of raising of ostrich, quail or pigeon.

**0149 - 01490: Other activities of animal husbandry**

This class includes:

\- Raising and breeding of pets and other domestic animals including ornamental animals (except ornamental fish): dog, cat, rabbit, reptile, insect;

\- Beekeeping and honey production;

\- Silkworm Raising and cocoon production;

\- Production of animal fur skins or reptile skin through animal husbandry activities.

**Exclusion:**

\- Raising and domestication of animals from ranches;

\- Production of hide and fur from animals hunted and trapped, under class 01700 (Hunting, trapping and related services);

\- Farming of frog, crocodile or soft-shell turtle, under class 03222 (Freshwater aquaculture);

\- Training of ornamental animals, under class 91030 (Activities of botanical garden, zoo and natural conservation area).

**015 - 0150 - 01550: Mixed crop-livestock farming**

This class includes the activities of combined cultivation and animal husbandry in a mixed farming unit in which none of its activities exceeds 66% of standard gross margin.

**Exclusion:** Mixed crop farming unit or mixed livestock farming unit that is specialized (primary activities occupying at least 66% of standard gross margin).

**016: Agricultural services**

**0161 - 01610: Cultivation service activities**

This class includes:

Paid work or contract work such as:

\- Plant care;

\- Spraying pesticides or plant growing stimulants, or plant insurance;

\- Cutting and pruning perennial plants;

\- Preparing soil, transplanting, sowing, harvesting;

\- Controlling pests on plants;

\- Examining seeds and cultivars;

\- Leasing agricultural machinery with operator(s);

\- Irrigation for cultivation.

**Exclusion:**

\- Subsequent post-harvest activities, under class 01630 (Post-harvest services);

\- Activities of agriculturalists and agricultural economists, under class 7490 (Specialist, scientific and technological activities not elsewhere classified);

\- Organization of agricultural products exhibitions, under class 82300 (Trade promotion);

\- Landscape architecture, under class 71101 (Architectural activities).

**0162 - 01620: Animal husbandry services**

This class includes:

Paid work or contract work such as:

\- Activities for breeding;

\- Quarantine of domestic animals, herding and feeding, castration of cattle and poultry, enclosure cleaning, excreta collection, etc.

\+ Activities for artificial insemination;

\+ Sheep shearing;

\+ Pasturing or leasing of grasslands;

\+ Raising and domestication of animals;

**Exclusion:**

\- Care of birds and ornamental animals, under class 91030 (Activities of botanical garden, zoo and natural conservation area);

\- Activities of horse racing courses, under class 93190 (Other sports activities).

**017 - 0170 - 01700: Hunting, trapping and related services**

This class includes:

\- Capturing sea mammals such as walrus and seal;

\- Domesticating captured animals in zoos;

\- Services that promote hunting and trapping on a commercial basis;

**Exclusion:**

\- Production of fur, hide, reptile skin and bird feather from animal husbandry operations, under class 1420 (Manufacture of articles of fur skins);

**B: MINING AND QUARRYING**

This section includes the activities of extracting of minerals occurring naturally as solids (coal and ores), liquids (crude petroleum) or gases (natural gas). Extraction can be achieved by various methods such as, underground or surface mining, seabed mining, etc.;

This section also includes:

\- Supplementary activities aimed at preparing the crude materials for marketing, for example, crushing, cutting, cleaning, sorting, ore concentration, liquefaction of gas and agglomeration of solid fuels. These operations are often carried out by the units that extract the resource and/or others located nearby;

\- Mining activities are classified into groups 02, 03 and 04 on the basis of the principal mineral produced. Divisions 05 and 06 are concerned with mining of fossil fuels (coal, lignite, petroleum, gas); divisions 07 and 08 concern metal ores, various minerals and mining products;

Some of the technical operations of this section, particularly related to the extraction of hydrocarbons, may also be carried out for third parties by specialized units such as an industrial service, which is reflected in division 09 (Mining support service activities).

**Exclusion:**

\- Processing of extracted materials, under section C (Manufacturing);

\- Use of extract materials without further transformation for construction purposes, under section F (Construction);

\- Bottling of natural spring and mineral waters at springs and wells, under class 1104 (Manufacture of soft drinks and mineral waters);

\- Crushing, grinding or treating of earths, rocks and substances not carried out in conjunction with mining, under class 23990 (Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products not elsewhere classified);

\- Collection, purification and distribution of water, under class 36000 (Water collection, treatment and supply);

\- Site preparation activities for mining, under class 43120 (Site preparation);

\- Geophysical and seismic surveying, under class 7110 (Architectural activities and related technical consultancy).

This division includes the specialized support services incidental to mining provided on a fee or contract basis. Other services such as building well foundations, cementing oil and gas well casings, cleaning and chemical processing of acids in the well, overburden removal services at mines.

This class includes:

This class also includes the services for fighting fire caused by gas and oil.

**Exclusion:**

099 - 0990 - 09900: Support activities for other mining and quarrying

This class includes:

\- Test drilling and test hole boring.

**Exclusion:**
